Decided to check this place out for weekend lunch; the line was long as expected but we got seated in 20-25 minutes. The servers were attentive, refilled our hot teas as often as they can. We ordered various dim sum plates, and beef Lo Mein, which were flavorful and filling. There are a lot of options nearby, but this is definitely one good options to consider when you are debating about which one to check out!
No comment

I recently dined at Dim Sum Palace with a group of 2 and the wait time was 45 minutes on a weekday. While the wait was a bit long, all the food was fresh and well worth it. The restaurant has a unique ordering system where you can mark off your food choices on a menu at the table and then give it to your waiter or waitress. The prices were a little more expensive than other dim sum places I've been to, but not too bad for the quality of food. The atmosphere of the restaurant is good, and the service is friendly. All in all, I would recommend Dim Sum Palace for fresh, high-quality dim sum, but be prepared for a wait during peak hours.

Dim Sum Palace definitely does not live up to it's name.  Most things on the menu were mediocre and overpriced.  On top of all this, they charged us for a bunch of items that didn't even come.  I would not return.
No comment

This was my first time at this location and I took my family who loved it. It felt very welcoming and homey. The service was quick and efficient. The food is authentic. The best dim sum we've had in NYC. There's so many to dim sum options to pick from and I love that the menu has pictures and you write how many orders you want. Our favorites include bbq pork bun, soup dumplings, taro buns, and sesame balls.  Definitely will be back to try them all.

We tried the Peking duck here and it was a fun experience. They come out with the duck and cut it in front of you, and then they have buns with scallions and hoisin sauce. They made 6 buns with duck for us and then gave us a separate plate with the rest of the duck. The skin was very crispy and the meat was well seasoned and flavorful. We also tried their soup dumplings which were decent. I don't think this place gets too busy since we were immediately seated for dinner and there were a lot of open tables around us.
No comment
Everything you want and more. 10/10 recommend for a classic dim sum experience. Pricing is fair, the soup dumplings were great, but my favorite was actually the cold sesame noodles.
No comment
No comment

We were in NYC for a mini vacation and couldn't leave the city without going to the dim sum place.  I searched on yelp near dim sum, and this place kept coming up.  It seems that they have a variety of locations throughout the city.  This was not the typical place where they come around with the cart (or at least when we went on Sunday afternoon), but you order at the table.  We ordered our usual, but I will mention a few here.  The turnip cake was too floury not much turnip.  The shrimp shumai was ok, and the shrimp hakao was good.  Sticky rice with bbq was good but the rice wasn't sweet or sticky rather tasted like regular white rice.   Overall the food was mediocre to good and service was ok.
I was a little sad they didn't offer the shrimp noodle during the week. Was shocked to find out how delicious every dish was! Definitely authentic dim sum! Can't wait to go back!
Friendly staff, really top quality dim sum. Several types of tea including pu er and chrysanthemum. Prices are reasonable, service was prompt. All in all we will definitely go back!

Darn good dim sum and Chinese cuisine establishment.  Authentic dishes and lots of choices.  Air conditioned and comfortable.  This is one of the few places that has both Shanghai soup dumplings AND bbq pork buns.  Obviously, the dim sum is delicious, but do yourself a favor and order the sautéed Chinese broccoli with crispy garlic - an extra special, vegetarian treat!  Overall, a top notch dim sum establishment.
No comment
Unfriendly staffs. The guy was very rude, made us feel unwelcome. Not like the one in Chinatown. They have much nicer staff and food there.

We came here on a Sunday afternoon and only had to wait about 10 minutes for a table. The bad: They didn't check our vaccination status, the first glass of water had a fly in it, and overall they seemed a little rushed. The good: dishes came out fast, prices were good for the serving size, and the food overall was very good. Best dishes were the buns and spring rolls.
No comment

Came here for a quick bite with a friend. This restaurant and the bathrooms were very clean, which is always appreciated. Service was great. Food was awesome! Loved the assortment of dishes we ate. They give a heaping portion of lo mein. Overall, great experience!
Quick service, huge selection of yummy dumplings at reasonable price. A must go to place.
No comment
No comment
Incredible place. Exactly what we were looking for. Very well priced as well. I am thankful we came here. We will be returning.

Absolutely recommend this place for dim sum. The food is reasonably priced (especially if you go with a bigger group) and authentic. The only thing I wouldn't recommend on their menu that I've tried is their shredded duck wonton soup - the soup had almost no flavor. DEFINITELY get the pork and 1000 year egg congee, that may be one of my favorite dim sum dishes here.
No comment

Loved this place! Everyone needs to try the fried milk things. We got thirteen different dishes, and for the most part everything was flavorful and delicious. We were a bit disapointed in the BBQ Port buns and the taro buns, but otherwise this was solid and we'll definitely be returning.

The normal dim sum options were available and everything we ordered was delicious. The place is really clean and orderly, but the staff is a little rude. You have to stop people to get more water and to order more food. I recommend the sticky rice with pork wrapped in lotus leaves. This dish comes with two portions, but they're kind of small.

We were a party of 9 for lunch. The service was outstanding, the owner/manager was very friendly and went out of his way to welcome our table and talk to the teenagers at the table. We overordered (our fault) and although it was not inexpensive, it was worth it. And we have some picky eaters. Plus we then had leftovers to bring home. It was all delicious - the dim sum platter, the soup dumplings, the shumai, egg rolls... The staff was also very patient with us while we decided and we did not feel rushed at all.
Went here for my second time after a few years, and it's just as wonderful as I remember - there's NOTHING on the menu I wouldn't recommend. Their dumplings are worth coming back for every time.
Highly recommend the "chicken juicy bun" soup dumplings. Large portion and great value at $10.95. Table devour is fairly basic. Outdoor seating available
No comment

Gorgeous restaurant, yummy food! I found this place last minute. Family was visiting us and wanted dim sum. When we arrived, I was a little hesitant about eating here because it was so clean (lol). I know that sounds strange but like all the amazing dim sum places I ever been to were chaotic and messy! Anyways, immediately we are greeted with the man who wears a UCLA uncle hat. He knew Filipino dishes so the first thing he offered my entire family was lugaw  (congee). The family couldn't say no - so they got some and they liked it. For our meal, we ordered the chicken juicy dumpling, pork dumpling, shrimp shumai, chicken feet, Peking duck, pineapple fried rice, and this beef noodle dish that I didn't catch the name of. Everyone enjoyed the meal taste-wise! I had ordered the pineapple fried rice, hoping it was going to come in a pineapple like the photo, but it didn't. That was the only upsetting part. Other than that, we're definitely coming back to visit! When I come by myself, I will definitely be ordering more than we did during our visit. I felt like I needed to experience more but we had all gotten full very fast! I didn't get many photos and took more videos... whoops! If curious to see my video, you can find it on IG at @ashrafeats. If not, enjoy the two photos of the Peking duck. Lol.
No comment

We got takeout from here, and it was very good! It was easy to order online, and we only had to wait 30 min for the food to be ready. They packaged everything nicely (the only issue was the soy sauce leaked but that's no big deal). I recommend this spot for great dim sum!
My favorite dim sum place in town. It is really quite during weekday morning. Really delicious. Must order: shrimping dumplings, radish cake and shrimp rice noodle.
Favorite Dim Sum Palace in the City. They are the best. Scallion pancakes. Shanghai fried rice. Bok choy. Congee. Vegetarian Dim Sum platter. Taro buns. Sesame balls. Yes every time.
Good food good vibe and good service. Moreover, lots of good options for gluten intolerant people like me!
No comment
Very good dim sum and the lunch special is great. I highly suggest the "pan fried shrimp with sausage & chives dumplings" and the "Shanghai juicy pork buns". The taro buns are also very good.
No comment
The salt and pepper squid is a definitely must try. The batter is perfectly light and crispy and seasoned perfectly. Would come again. Great service as well!
No comment
No comment

Fresh dimsum, delicious stewed chicken feet, tasty chilly sauce. Fast service. A bit pricey though but I guess because it's in Manhatan. My favorite is the eggyork creamy bun. You have to try it. Once I open it with my hand, the inside york was running. Sooo good.
Delicious dim sum, lots of veggie options & amazing soup dumplings!  Quick service, very friendly.  Loved the spicy mushroom dumplings!
No comment
No comment
Yum!! We couldn't wait to try this location and we were not disappointed! Food was fresh and tasty. Service was friendly and attentive. We are looking forward to visiting again.
Great service, staff are very attentive. Food and dim sum are excellent. Love the dinner menu. Great selections to choose from. Seatings are very comfortable. One of the best dim sum in the area.

The staff was very friendly, the food was AHHHHMAZING. Everything was so fresh. I'm already craving it again! ALLLL the dumplings were delicious. The plum wine was also a perfect pairing with our meal. 10/10 would recommend!
No comment
No comment

5/5 stars. First of all, the flavors of each dumpling, yum yum YUM. I big on flavor so that really impressed me. Not going to lie though, not sure if my senses are heightened or not but the smell of the dumplings were a bit strong but that could just be because I don't eat chicken and my friend ordered some with chicken. But nonetheless, every dumpling ordered I do not regret. I'd definitely come back and recommend those in the city to visit here. It was clean and their bathroom was clean too which is very important to me.
Excellent selection of dim sum, all well prepared. Soup dumplings were perfect for me. Will flag this spot and definitely go back.
Restaurant has a lot of options. everything is super tasty and good portions. the pork congee was my fav, didn't even had the chance to take pictures lol. highly recommend. y'all should come here!
No comment

We ordered every single thing from dimsum menu plus duck and lettuce wraps ( with chicken I believe). What can I say we couldn't stop stuffing our faces no matter how full we all already were. We're were a group of 5. It was so delicious!! Plus super nice sake selection and great attentive service. Recommend!!! Can't wait to go back!
Dimsums are really good and yummy. They are all freshly cooked after placing the order.
No comment
No comment
Great service and food! Everything is brought out so promptly and the servers are so friendly. Definitely in our top 5 for weekend dim sum.
No comment

Decent dim sum restaurant that is currently open for indoor dining. I was excited to come here due to the rave reviews, but I found the dim sum dishes average. Ordering consists of checking off what you want on the menu. The chicken feet were cut into smaller pieces than other restaurants and seemed thinner. This dish comes with peanuts, so be aware if you are allergic. I thought the turnip cakes could have been seared more so that it has a crispier edge. There was too much oyster sauce on them. My favorite was the shrimp dumplings.
The food was tasty, the service was great, I will be returning to dim sum palace soon!
Very delicious and authentic Dim Sum place!!!! Recommend to al of you. LOVE the Dim Sum here!! And the staff are so nice and friendly!
No comment
No comment

Dim sum palace is the best!! We went with a large group for a birthday and had the private room in the back and the staff was so accommodating. Food was all amazing and can't beat the service. New go-to spot
No comment
No comment

Visited the Dim sum palace on 2nd ave in the East Village (they have multiple locations in the city) and it was delicious! We got the Seafood Shu Mai, the bbq pork buns, the chicken dumplings, pan friend tiny bun, the taro cilantro and pork dumplings and the Szechuan Spicy Wontons. They serve the food with chili oil, vinegar and soy sauce which complement the dumplings perfectly. My favorite were the Seafood Shu Mai they were savory and are packed with shrimp. The rest of the dumplings were so tasty as well, all were so fresh and perfectly soft with a savory kick. Both the Pan fried buns and the bbq pork buns the dough was so fluffy and chewy. The service was excellent so kind and attentive. Lastly my favorite part about this place is their visual menus, where they have listed all their dumplings with pictures, perfect to make the right choices!
No comment
Very friendly. Great atmosphere and delicious food. Staff very attentive. The crispy spare ribs were outstanding
Dim Sum Palace is a great spot for all your dim sum favorites. Scrumptious xiao long bao, and a robust menu full of tasty classics. Lovely atmosphere, and charming service...highly recommend
Saturday night and this place is full. Love the service and the food is comforting. 1st time and can't wait to come back.

We've been to the 46th St location a couple times and my kids adore it - today we were downtown and checked out this location. OUTSTANDING. My 8 yo had her faves - pea shoot and seafood dumplings and the crab soup dumplings; my 5 yo wouldnt let anyone else touch the chicken feet or shu mai (both shrimp and pork orders) which he devoured. We also got roast pork buns, chicken dumplings, and mixed mushroom dumplings, plus beef chow fun and sweet and sour pork. The staff were fantastically attentive and friendly with my loud and ravenous children (even surprising them with coconut desserts.) We left stuffed and very very very happy.
No comment
No comment
Definitely some of the best dim sum and service. Really enjoyed the food and the service. Highly recommend.

We were a large group and hadn't had dimsum for quite a while so ordered about 25 different things. Good wide spread choices but a lot of them tasted pretty similar. Dough for the steamed dumplings was pretty thick - should be more delicate. But several dishes were very good.
Great food great service. Highly recommend! We ordered 6 dim sum, all of them were good. Highly recommend shrimp rice roll. :)

maybe it was the 2mi. bike ride on the Brooklyn Bridge but everything here was sooooo yummy. I don't eat red meat or pork and there's a good selection of veggies and seafood. the salt & pepper squidddd was everything. I'm picky about my squid/calamari but this was . we had some dumplings too, shrimp and bamboo && all soooo good. service was also fantastic! didn't realize they had  several locations hope all with this same service and taste. definitely coming back.

My friends and I came in a slow time and we were seated quickly. The dim sum was delicious! They gave us several sauces to use and all the food was brought out in a timely manner. We ordered 9 dishes and our bill was about 80$, which I thought was a little expensive but eh, it's NYC. Very good dim sum and I look forward to taking my family here.
This was a great find in the East Village.  We ordered both the General Tso and Sesame Chicken.  The flavors were excellent and the service was great.  Will definitely come back.

The restaurant is really good. This is my second time being here. Both the dim sum and dishes are delicious. The Peking duck makes me feel like home. Utterly enjoyed having meals here. Besides, the atmosphere is comfortable. It's a good place for union.

I wanted to get stir fried e-fu noodles (yi mein) and the only place on UberEats that looked like they had it was Dim Sum Palace. I couldn't tell which item on the menu was what I was looking for, so I called them and asked them in Cantonese. They told me to order the braised e-fu noodles, and they would replace it for me with what I wanted. I also got the sichuan wontons, pork and thousand year egg congee, and coconut pudding. There actually isn't much dim sum on their UberEats menu. The congee and e fu noodles were excellent and standardly portioned. The sichuan wontons were a bit disappointing - the filling was too firm and the sauce too cornstarchy and gelatinous. The coconut pudding was more watery than expected and a bit too sweet but still good. This place is more expensive than the average Chinatown restaurant but I was satisfied with the food.

The dim sum is made fresh here, and that makes the high prices worth it. It's not overpowering or heavy, unlike other dimsum places where it feels like you're eating buckets of salt/msg. I like that they make chicken shumai here, it's not a strong but comfortable and homey flavor. The congee has many big chunks of meat and pidan. The chashu bun is super fluffy, with yummy sweet meat filling. I would say that the soup dumplings have a thicker, chewier and less artfully folded skin than what you might get at a true soup dumpling restaurant, perhaps since this isn't a Shanghainese establishment but rather Canto. That said, the soup inside is savory and light, and you can tell the skin was housemade, it's still good. The auntie and waitstaff treated us well, and our food was brought out at a good pace. I would come again and try the other dim sum items in a heartbeat.
The quality of dim sum at this place is among the highest in NYC. I also tried lobster noodle and DouMao, they are also great!
No comment
No comment
This is a great restaurant with amazing service! The waiters are very nice and attentive. The menu selection is great, lots to chose from. It has anything you would want.

Wanted to see what the hype was about and was not disappointed. Having eaten a lot of dim sum I have higher expectations and this place exceeded expectations. The shrimp dumplings and Shanghai juicy pork bun (soup dumplings) were some of the best I have ever had!
I loved Dim Sum Palace so much that I almost visited it every week with my friends. Each dim sum tastes really delicious!!! The prices are very reasonable. Take outs are good too.
Great good, friendly staff, fast service. Quality establishment that is great for large gatherings, and casual meals!
The best dim sum downtown! We love dim sum Sam and the owner is great!!! I highly recommend the soup dumplings and the BBQ pork buns

I'm so happy Dim Sum Palace was open during this pandemic. I had a major dimsum craving and travelled pretty far to get it! The place was super clean and service was fast. I suggest calling ahead for pick up (about 40 minutes ahead). They also packed everything so neatly! I've been here for dinner before and I'm equally as pleased with their takeout.
No comment

Fantastic! We stumbled upon this location when we were looking for a dinner spot. I had seen Dim Sum Palace on a couple restaurant lists and was so glad we came here! Everything was fantastic. I'd recommend the crab / pork soup dumplings and the Buddha delight dumplings. Wonderful! Can't wait to come back :)
This place is the best dim sum place we find in the city. They not only have good dim sum but also nice vegetables and seafood dishes.

I never write reviews for places but the service and food quality were so outstanding I really have to give them the praise they are due, as a group of 10 they were able to seat us quickly and get the orders for all of us out of the kitchen blazingly fast, food was delicious and atmosphere was great, 5/5
No comment

Dim Sum Palace is one of my most frequent places I choose to dine at. They have amazing service and outstanding employees (one of the friendliest you'll ever see). There's also some dim sums that you wouldn't usually see at other dim sum places, such as, the shredded roast duck dumpling, the pineapple cheese wonton, and many more! They have many locations around New York City, it's definitely a place to check out!
No comment
So good exactly the dumplings I wanted and neededo. Fast service which was great. Highly recommend
Great go to spot, fast service and amazing food. Highly recommend the soup dumplings and the half duck. All very delicious.

So far the best dim sum store that I've got a chance to eat after coming back to NYC. The good: Their signature is the chili oil sauce that can go well with any dish. The dim sum is juicy and tasty. The chicken feet is so good. The egg yolk bun is excellent. The bad: the xiao long bao cover is so thin that all the juice just gone, and the taste is normal. Most items are pretty pricey compared to other dim sum stores in NYC.
My friend and I went for dinner and all I can say is that they have fantastic food, a cozy atmosphere, fast service and amazing and friendly staff!!!
One of the best dim sum places I've ever eaten. We ordered like crazy and nothing left at the table. Great service and friendly attention.

We ordered a variety of things. Spring rolls, steamed pork dumplings, and pork & chive dumplings were delicious. We also tried a couple things with duck, but I didn't like the texture of that meat (no fault of Dim Sum).
We had a great experience at Dim Sum Palace! The staff is very friendly and attentive. Our favorite dishes were the pork buns and the roasted duck spring rolls!

Came here after a long day, and didn't really want to go far from my hotel room. Ordered all of this food and finished it. My only complaint is that the prices were kind if high and the pork spare rib was very fatty and bony; not much meat was left on the bone. Overall, the food was very good and the service was good too. Thanks!
The food was amazing and service was excellent. We ordered garlic chicken, walnut shrimp, stir fried vege and fried rice. All were excellent authentic Cantonese food!!
The crispy Szechuan bass was delicious with its nice and flavorful sauce. The dim sum was very fresh - the taro balls, sesame balls, and xlb are a must.
This is our favorite Dim sum I Manhattan! Been here 5 times and the service is great everytime. And the food is amazing!
I was told there would be free snacks as long as I posted on the social medias at the Dim Sum Palace establishment.
Some of the best dim sum that I've had in the city! Definitely get the sweet egg yolk creamy bun!!!!
No comment

We come from place (Houston, TX) with lots of  good DimSum restaurants. This restaurant can be compared to the top 5 Dimsum restaurants in Houston. Nice and fun staffs also. Good place to come even a little bit walk from China town. DO NOT SKIP this place for lunch or dinner !!!!
No comment
Really great dim sum with attentive staff!! They were there when we wanted to order more food and were all so nice!

Although it may be a cultural difference, the service was non-existent from our server. He was an older gentleman who I am not sure spoke a lot of English. We were new to Dim Sum and he offered no education. When I attempted to ask him about the checkbox menu that he just dropped on our table, he yanked it out of my hand and submitted the order....although we weren't finished choosing the various items. The options were okay to me but B enjoy more than I did. In fairness, I never enjoy my food as much when I feel the service is poor. If this was in Chinatown I would be more forgiving and expect that they cater to more of their countrymen. However this restaurant is in an area that they should be a little more courteous and informative then they were. I won't be returning but don't let my experience deter you from hiving them a try.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Dim sum that you don't have to go all the way to china town to get! Like some of the other reviews the xlbs weren't the best I've ever had but they were decent. I also had shrimp dumplings, which were good. I would definitely stop in again next time I'm in east village.

Celebrating the Chinese new year with a couple of my friends. I wanted to try some dim sum for the first time. This was pretty close to our job so we walked over after work. Got there around 5pm on a Friday and it was actually pretty empty. We order steamed shrimp dumpling, an assortment of pan fried dumpling, fried crispy spare ribs and broccoli cooked in garlic sauce. We also had some sake to end the night. Really great service and the food was impeccable.

Had family visiting and wanted to take then to dimsum but didn't want the craziness of a packed dining hall in Chinatown during covid. This place was perfect. We sat outside, which is enclosed. It was packed inside at 1220p on a Sunday. You order via a menu with photos instead of carts. The food was fresh and really good. I would say better than Chinatown's Golden Unicorn, Jing Fong, and Pings. Dumplings are $2-4 more, but worth it. I will be back often.

So, I'm finally reviewing Dim Sum Palace after going here since 2018. I grew up eating dim sum with my mom and going on trips home to Taiwan. This is my favorite location of the local chain and the best place you can go in the East Village for dim sum. Tim Ho Wan can not compare (like really, why would you go there if you can go HERE?). When I lived in the east village I would go here minimum twice a month for dim sum and now that I've moved out of the neighborhood I still go out of my way to go here once a month. I would recommend it to anyone. It's affordable and you can't go wrong with their dim sum dishes. I typically go with one other person and get their har gow, shu mai, spare ribs, xiao long bao (soup dumplings), and typically supplement with one to two other dishes. On the weekends they have rice rolls so I definitely recommend getting those if you have the chance. They currently have an indoor and outdoor area to eat. The service is great and the food is delicious.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Quality food an excellent service!! Good for big group gathering or small party  Will definitely go again!!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great food, good prices, and they have vegetarian dumplings in their dim sum. I really like the soybean and the mushroom dumplings. Their custard bau and the bbq pork bau are fluffy. We also got shu mai and turnip cakes. Everything was tasty.
Best food. Best service! The server in the UCLA Uncle hat was very attentive! Would come back again and again! Delicious!
Had some delicious dim sum and it was indeed, a delicious treat. If you go I highly suggest the dim sum. It's delicious. Did I mention their dim sum is delicious?
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place has my favorite vegetable dumplings! The dim sum is very authentic and there is a great variety of options to choose from. The pricing is slightly high but there are usually some offers going around for the restaurant. The taste is great and I would recommend if you want solid dim sum.
The waiters were super nice and they make the dim sums fresh. The shrimp dumpling was probably the best I've had in NYC, speaking that as a native Chinese.
Stopped in for dim sum after dropping our kid at NYU ! Fresh delicious and friendly service !
No comment
No comment

When the Red Peony had the wheels fall of the bus on Christmas, we walked away from our reservation and were welcomed by the staff of Dim Sum Palace. Lucky accident as the food and service were fantastic.
so yum. really good selection of sauces which were delish. the sake tasted like lemonade, which was ok, but my friend really likes sake so she didn't like it that much. great vibes all around.
The service here is great and if you know dim sum then you know they have good dim sum
This was delicious. We really liked the options and flavors of this dim sum restaurant. The staff was nice and efficient. If you have not tried dim sum you should.
No comment

column3: Roma Norte, Ciudad de México, Mexico
column6: this place is so delicious!! the cucumber with szechuan spicy sauce and taro buns are some of my absolute favorites. they have this delicious sauce with ginger in it i will never forget!

Just alright. Very thankful that they were still open at 10:30 PM on Sunday night for dinner, when literally nobody else was in the restaurant anymore. we got the stir fry chicken flat noodle chow mien (just alright), the pork soup dumplings (slightly thick skinned, but the broth was good), and the green onion pancake (hard to mess up this classic, it was great). Food came out quickly, we were (a little too much so) well taken care of, and price was definitely fair for the amount of food ($40 with tax and tip for dinner in the EV at 11 PM).
No comment
No comment
burned my friends apartment down. they didn't care about the fire and continued to serve food. the apartment is gone with all of the belonging as well.
Tasty food！Warm environment. Feel comfortable in the early morning. Will come back again！

Food quality drops tremendously. Dim sum still average. Ok standard. Not great. But the fried noodle n fried mix vege was really bad. It was not even fried well.  Noodle and sauce are still separate. The server service is good. Very attentive. the captain is bad. He only took care of other tables. I was alone even though I ordered a lot of food. I was not even served a glass of water, I probably will not come back for a long long time.
This is the best dim sum place I've ever been to. It's even better now than it was before the pandemic they have an outside covered patio where you can eat which is great.!!
No comment
delicious food and expansive selection. really great service and nice employees. loved everything i had!
No comment
Great restaurant. I especially love the duck and mushroom dim sum and their taro rolls.
No comment

Honestly the best soup dumplings I've ever had. Was randomly doing something in the area two days in a row and ate the soup dumplings for lunch 2 days in a row. I don't live close and I don't love coming to this part of the city, but I'll definitely make the trip again to eat these soup dumplings!
It's a wonderful place to have dim sum! Good service and food comes pretty quickly. Tea is free!
Best dim sum in New York. Good prices, always consistent. Great for take out or dine in

Amazing service and the food is wonderful! They provided  the meal in such a timely fashion. To add to its greatness, they provide very kind services which makes me want to come back on a regular basis.
Very friendly service and they gave us the food quickly when we ordered a lot. I recommend the sweet egg yolk bun and the chicken juicy bun. I also liked the pan fried pork and chives.
Such a great place!! Food is amazing, especially pork buns!! Highly recommend!! Came here on a Saturday and the place had a nice size crowd. The service is fast and chill.

Love this place. Decent dimsum at decent prices. They also have 50% off all dimsum 3-5 pm. We went on a sat afternoon at 2:30 and got seated immediately. Ordered the shrimp dumpling (5/5), pork and thounsand yr egg congee (5/5), steam pork ribs (5/5), pork taro and cilantro dumpling (3/5), egg yold buns (4/5). Everything was excellent and reasonably priced. They also have 20% off all dimsum items because they are relatively new in the neighborhood. Come here and get your fix on dimsum instead of waiting 1hr+ at the overrated Tim Ho Wan nearby.
No comment
No comment
What a fantastic place for a quick bite. Dim sum all day all night. BBQ Pork buns are amazing. Bring your friends

Soup dumplings were yummy,  service was terrible.   Made an online reservation through yelp on a Sunday around lunchtime.   Don't bother.   Host said they don't accept them and we had to put our name on the bottom of the list.   Waited almost an hour for a table.   Dumplings took forever to come out.   At least 45-60 min.   They forgot our soup and then brought it 30 min after the soup dumplings.   At that point,  we were ready to leave so we sent it back.   They didn't take it off the check and we had to ask them to do so. Took about 30 min to get our check.   Spent 2.5 hours here just to have 2 orders of soup dumplings.

Finally a great late night dim sum p(a)lace! You won't be seeing the ladies with the dim sum carts here, but you do get a laminated menu where you can choose the traditional dim sum dishes that you want and then a separate menu that you get at non dim sum Chinese restaurants, so you get the best of both worlds! The dishes from the non dim sum menu are all fresh and delicious, while the dim sum dishes are all delicious. The waiter was also very informative and patient with my partner and I while we were taking a long time to decide on what to get. The restaurant is also quite spacious and the booths were comfortable. Our waiter was also nice enough to let my partner and I sit at a six-people booth instead of a smaller two-people table! Definitely come here for good food and service
No comment
No comment
Very quick and friendly service! Huge section to choose from and all options are amazing, would definitely recommend to anyone!
The workers are very nice. Food/Drinks are also good. I recommend to come here if you like asian food.
This place is really good, best spot in Manhattan. You win sum, you dim sum, this place def wins.
No comment

Hope in the wall Chinese that blew my mind. Everything www super tasty and hit the spot. I'm always on the hunt for good Chinese food bEcause there is none where I'm from. We ordered several small plates and when presented with the billl, we realized it was so low! We didn't know it was happy hour. Could not bElieve we got such great food for such a low price! The staff was on point and always knew when to come around.
Great food. Loved the 小籠包 & 蝦餃. Friendly service :) super convenient location and I'll definitely be coming back !!
Very great atmosphere, spacious, the food is good, service is also better than other Dim Sum places I have been to.
Overpriced for dimsum compared to Chinatown prices, but food is really authentic and good.

Not often do I stumble across a dim sum spot with vegetarian options- this place had a plethora of delicious and interesting veggie dim sum!! The asparagus and mushroom ones are our favorite. They come out steaming hot and the staff is really nice and accommodating. The chicken dumplings were so-so, but will definitely be back to try more!

I know this says Dim Sum Palace, but don't be sleeping on their roast duck. I was jonesing for roast duck one day and got a half duck delivered from them, and no kidding I finished all of it within a day. (In two separate meals, but still.) The duck was flavorful and unctuous, and had all kinds of textures - juicy and fleshy around the duck breast, chewy and slightly cartilaginous around the leg, concentrated flavor around the ribs if you like gnawing on bone... it was a savory, crispy, and oily delight.

Live in the neighborhood and this was my first time here. Sorry I hadn't stopped in before. Really food food and large portions. Staff was friendly and very efficient. I will surely be back. Next time with a group of friends so we can sure a lot of delicious food.
Incredible service! Very attentive and clean environment . Excellent Dim Sum. Would come back again!

I think they're a good solid 3 star and maybe slightly higher. I don't think it is a 5 star like people are saying. Pricing is pretty good. People working there are very pleasant. Szechuan Spicy Dumpling has a nice thin wrapper and is packed with a very tasty pork filling. The downside is the sauce, which is gloppy and a bit gelatinous. They would do better with a really good simple hot oil. The cold sesame noodles are very basic. The scallion pancake has a better than average taste and consistency. We did really enjoy the shrimp shumai; which had a very nice amount of shrimp. Our two favorites were the shredded duck dumplings and the chive and pork dumplings. We thought they both had great taste, great consistency and a different spin on the average dumping. That's the long and short of it.

Fantastic food, service and value in NYC. I highly recommend as a place to stop for a tasty bite of Dim Sun. Each dish was tastier than the previous order. It's easy to order too, just check off what you need on the menu. We've visited 3x's so far and plan on returning when in The East Village

The food here is fairly meh. The xlb was ok but the skin was kinda thick. For reference, if you bite the twisted top off the dough it's the size of a blueberry. Apart from the skin it tasted ok. The pan fried turnip cake bites were a bland soggy mess but the bits of duck it was stir fried with was tasty so I picked those little bits out and left the rest. The taro pork dumpling was more skin than filling so that went unfinished as well. The only thing I liked was the seafood pea shoots dumpling. Even the little egg yolk sesame balls for dessert were a fail....no egg yolk inside any of them. Also not worth finishing.

I am so disappointed, perhaps because I had too much expectation before I came. It's relatively expensive compared how much it provided. I ordered five dishes and only like Shu mai. DON'T order the duck dumplings. It's a waste of money.
No comment

I ordered delivery from this place, and I had a pretty good and unusual experience! I first got the congee, which was pork and thousand year old egg, which I was honestly a bit wary of but which turned out to be an incredibly tasty combo! Huge portions as well, which was great. Highly recommend that, especially for its low price. The other dish was pork chow fun- the pork had all the flavor and the noodles were flat and plain and didn't have really any flavor to it. Overall, it evened out to a fairly impressive experience.
No comment
really good dimsum, nice place! my friend and i went here one evening and enjoyed the ambience and food.
No comment
No comment

Ordered delivery from here a while ago and wasn't great so was a little hesitant to eat here but we wanted dumplings and this was walking distance. We were blown away, the service was amazing the dumplings all fresh. A little more than what you typically spend in China town but we thought it was 100% worth it.
No comment
10/10 food. I've had Dim Sum many times in many places and this was one of the best. The manager was super friendly and kind. Can't wait to go back!

my go to dim sum place whenever i visit new york! so delicious and reasonably priced. there's a few items that aren't typically dim sum items, or at least not where i'm from, but SO GOOD! i wish i lived closer to this place, i'd visit weekly haha. also, the owner (i think) is so kind and makes the place welcoming!

Honestly, it's pretty good to my surprised. The logo outside doesn't help too much, looks a bit basic and tacky but when you enter the restaurant it feel different. Nothing too luxurious or special but it's clean, interior design is nice and simple. A pretty comfortable environment. Not super big or small, just a good size and several tables and it's usually not packed at all. Speaks both mandarin and English. Good service..friendly staffs, attentive, doesn't rush you, doesn't assume you speak Chinese because you look like one, and honestly pretty great prices. Quite a few different options for dim sum but they do have other Chinese dishes from appetizers, meat/veggies, to noodles or rice. A couple desserts and beverages too. Tasty food and nice texture. The Braised Five Spice Duck looks simple but tastes really nice and it's not too dry either. My friend wasn't a big fan on the bamboo shoot dumplings but I find it okay, doesn't have the "wow" factor but it's simple and light so good for the stomach. The steamed spare ribs w/ olive sauce was one of my favourite. Shrimp dumpling is like most places so nothing too special but they tastes good. Chicken feet was nice too. Shu Mai (shrimp and pork) was definitely my friend's favourite,:$3 almost wanted a second one. Is portion is perfect for the both of us. Not too big to be honest but if you have a large appetite it's best to order more dim sum or add some regular dishes from the menu. I'd recommend people to check it out and definitely would come back some time again.
BEST PLACE EVER!!! always my go to place. never disappoints, it is so delicious every time and they have the most amazing staff of all time. John is the most incredible ever. FIVE STARS FOREVER

Hands down one of the best dim sum places I have been to. Despite arriving there at midnight, the food we were served was some of the freshest and tastiest I have had. No dish disappointed. Definitely recommend this place...so much so that I am actually here eating as I write this.
No comment

The sign advertising their grand opening is going to need to advertise a grand closing if they don't fix their service. I and my friend were largely ignored for the duration of our meal, including some difficulty flagging down the wait staff to inquire as to the location of some of our food. It is not the only time I have been somewhere that forgot a dish, but I have never been argued with before about it upon asking. All of this might have been overlookable for good dim sum but that wasn't anywhere in sight. Everything came out decidedly bland, even the dishes labelled spicy, and the only thing I would recommend at all was the cucumbers- hardly worth the wait or the final bill. We will Not be returning.
No comment
No comment

Everything was great, I came here 2 days in a row to enjoy some classic Dim Sum. I really recommend the shrimp dumplings! I also really enjoyed the egg bun dessert as well. All the staff here is really nice and attentive!
great dim sum and relaxing environment! The owner is super friendly and great to explain anything! One of the best dim sum I had in nyc. Def recommend and will come back.

great food, even better ambiance. the duck and chicken dumplings are absolutely to die for. the service was incredible and the wait time for the food was not long at all. definitely coming here again!
I've spent way too much money here in the past 2 years. Great food and great service every time.

I love dim sum and am very critical of food. My wife says that I'm a foodie but I don't think that I am. I just like to eat good food so ok, I am I guess. I've been to my share of dim sum places and this has to be one of the better dim sum spots. I've had some of the best dim sum in Tai Pei, San Fran, and in Vancouver, and this place come in very very close. First off, each dish was fresh and meticulously made. When a chef takes pride in his/her creation, it definitely shows and tastes amazing. My wife, who is a finicky eater, even liked it here. As with many NY restaurants, this place is fairly small but the decor and the ambiance was nice. Table cloth was a nice touch and the it was clean overall. I usually don't care about the ambiance of a restaurant unless it's a special occasion but it's worth mentioning. Excellent dining experience and delicious dim sum!
No comment
Really delicious food! They are pretty good about outdoor seating (I've attached a photo of the set up they put out especially for us!) I highly recommend the Soy Bean Dumplings
Dumplings are between my favorite food, so maybe a little bias that was fully satisfied with the food in this place, as they have a great variety of dumplings from salties to sweet ones!
No comment
No comment

Dim sum place just opened their third restaurant in the East Village and it's got all the late night dim sum you've been dreaming of. Their xiao long bao are extra juicy and they har gow are super plump. It's priced a bit higher than other dim sum spots but still really good!
The best dim sum I've ever had! Everything tasted so fresh and delicious, highly recommend!
No comment

Delicious food. Everything was perfect in regards to texture and flavor. Not only was the food good but the service blew me away. Chinese restaurants usually had waiters who are rude, yell at you and leave you emotionally abused (I'm exaggerating), but not this place! The servers were so nice, attentive, refilled our teas, so nice and polite. We had a great experience. Thank you for a good time and great food!

This place was amazing. They are open late & KEVIN helped us order all the best food and drinks. Great food, good music, great staff. Will definitely be back. Kevin if you are reading this I love you.
Eh it was solid, but not the best dumplings I ever had.  I ordered take out and they gave me the wrong veggie dim sum so that was disappointing.  Best part of the order was the BBQ pork buns.

If you want real dim sum, go to CHINA TOWN!!! We were roaming soho, and decided to seek out some dim sum. The reviews on yelp looked decent and place was in walking distance. The place was clean and nicely decorated so stars for that. We ordered of the dim sum menu and they did not the basics ( shrimp balls) which my daughter was craving. I ordered hai gow and shai mai. Beef chow fun and fried rice. The chow fun was bland. If kids had this complaint, imagine an adult's response. The rice was decent. For the price of the dishes, you would do better at Panda Express. And I don't do panda

I love this place!! Went for dinner with my three girlfriends and sat in their outdoor area. Everyone was so friendly and attentive and gave us great menu recommendations. We got shrimp dumplings, seafood shumai, scallion pancakes, BBQ pork buns, spring rolls, and sesame buns. All were delicious and steaming hot! We were even given a complimentary bottle of sake which was so kind. When we got the bill I was shocked at how affordable it was. Will definitely be back!!

I love this place. Great Cantonese food. I've only eaten in the restaurant a couple of times, but I've had it delivered MANY times because it's super tasty and legit. I love the noodle soups and the pan-fried tofu with vegetables is delicious. Pricier than Chinatown, but it's around the corner from my house and worth the premium!

Outdoor sitting is spacious and the chairs are very comfortable. Food is the most authentic I've ever have in NYC and the prices are reasonable. Also the owners of this place are very friendly which makes it even better! Great food great service, definitely gonna come back soon

Had late night dim sum at dim sum palace near Chinatown. I was craving for something sweet and saw a taro bun and sweet egg custard sesame ball. Never seen these in the other dim sum restaurants I've been to so I decided to give it a try. I was surprised because I thought they would be super sweet but it was just right. There was sweet custard dripping from the inside. Absolutely love it! I also tried a few other dim sums and they were great. I'm planning to go again with friends this time so I can order more things and try their food dishes this time. Will order some noodles next time.
No comment
This place is really good and the prices are standard. I like that we have to order food instead of picking it as it's wheeled around. It's a good idea to make reservations ahead of time.
No comment

Came here to get some dim sum for dinner and really enjoyed the variety here! We ended up getting the bamboo dumblings (highly recommend), the steamed duck and steamed chicken. Since Yelp offered a free dessert with check in, we tried the Sweet egg creamy bun and it was a great way to end the meal! The servers were super attentive too throughout the meal.

Very much enjoyed this experience although I myself am not a dim sum connoisseur. I will tell you however the five millennials who joined me loved it. The dumplings were very good; prepared well and quite flavorful. Service was good; friendly and timely. The traditional Chinese dishes eso other general tsao chicken were tasty and delicious. The experience in itself was most enjoyable and I will most certainly return on my next trip to NYC. I assure you the millennials who go there weekly will continue to do so as dim fanatics!

My friends and I are frequent dim sum goers so we were super excited when we heard about this place! There weren't any carts, however, the food was AMAZING. We got so much shu mai, and I'm not the biggest fan of them, but I think I had more shu mai than anyone at my table. In addition, the pork buns tasted so good, didn't taste frozen. We wished we had more soy sauce in some of the dishes but it's ok, they accommodated us and gave us more when we asked. Highly recommend!!
No comment
No comment

food is so great, best dim sum I have ever had, we tried steamed spare ribs, chicken finger, sticky rice with pork, sweet egg yolk creamy bun, they are all very delicious. We also ordered fried dry rice noodle with beef, it is great, highly recommend.

We tried many other dim sum place. This place is my favorite. Everything was good. We tried the spicy wonton, wonton soup, chicken soup dumplings, the palace assorted dim sum, spare ribs, & chicken feet. Was not disappointed! All the staff were very attentive & friendly.
No comment

Had dimsum at the 33rd street and saw that it had many locations. Decided to try another location closer to chinatown(2nd ave location). Made a reservation for a big party here and was surprised that there were special preorder dishes. I preordered a lot of seafood. I was seated at a big round table and warmly welcomed by the staff. The food was amazing, price was reasonable and the staffs were very attentive. They were really nice even though we made many requests. The place was nice and neat and the food came fast and hot. I'm a seafood lover and I hate when seafood is not fresh I can tell right away but everything was really fresh. Another dish we ordered was chinese broccoli with steak cubes. I loved it! The steak cubes were nice and juicy and the chinese broccoli were fresh and green. They also have a variety of beer and wine to choose from. I would definitely come back and I would also try the other two locations I haven't been to yet. Highly recommend this place to friends, family and everyone!
We were a party of 5 and sat immediately. But there was definitely a wait for smaller parties. Super delicious and very easy to order a lot! We ate it all.

We decided to come here to celebrate my friend's birthday. The atmosphere is great and the servers are friendly. The food came out quickly and everything was delicious, especially the pan fried tiny buns! I would definitely come here again with my friends to try out their other dimsum!

Their food was fine; of course, there are better ones especially if you are coming from the West coast (or East Asia like myself). The reason for 3 stars was more to do with their service. Out of courtesy, I paid 20% tip though cause I didn't want to feel rude.

This was the best dim sum I've ever eaten. Have tried most of the NYC Chinatown parlors which we've thoroughly enjoyed. Dim Sum Palace was a cut above. Small location where you chose off of a menu. The food came out obviously made to order and so good. I will go back because it was the best.
No comment
They do have 50% off from 3pm-5pm during the weekdays, but you may want to check the bill carefully. They put the tax over the original price, not the price after 50% off.
Ordered takeout but the food was all meh. I ordered $70+ but wasn't happy with anything and extremely disappointed. I've had better Chinese.

Came here with two friends for dinner and had a nice experience! The interior is clean and nicely decorated, and the staff was really friendly and attentive. We ordered a variety of dim sum, with some being better than others, but overall it was all delicious. I really recommend getting the stir fried string beans, as those were addictively good.

My friends and I were craving dimsum so we decided to give this place a try, it definitely did not disappoint! The moment we walked in, we were greeted by a staff and quickly seated. The food itself was delicious, especially the lobster noodles. The dimsum was also really fresh and tasty! I would definitely come here again to try out their other foods!

It might be the best dim sum restaurant in town. The location makes the price looks decent. The food came out quickly and drinks were redreshed constantly. Their staff super friendly never gives the attitude like in CT. I ordered the shrimp dumpling and veggie platter. They served big portion and the taste was great. Btw u might want to eat em fast cuz they were all just steam as u ordered. I think they just opened for a couple of weeks. Might thinking of going again. Nice place. :/

My favorite Dim Sum place. The prices are really great especially for the high quality food. We keep coming back and bring a lot of friends so we can try all of the menu, it's a favorite spot for us !
No comment

This place serves very nice and authentic cantonese food. And the service is pretty good. As a cantonese person I would recommend it to everyone. And the menu actually covers so many Cantonese dishes. We tried shrimp dumplings, shu Mai and I can say they are very close to what I had in mainland China. This place is definitely a good place to go to for dim sum and other canto dishes.  :)

Found this place on Yelp while walking in the LES with a booze filled belly and a hunger for Dim Sum. He Dim Sum was actually really good. The Siu Mai, Har Gow, BBQ pork was all good as expected. What surprised me was how good the American Chinese food from here was. I don't think I've ever had General Tso and think I was eating chicken but they use REAL CHICKEN! The Crispy Beef was AMAZING. I'm a huge fan of crispy beef and some restaurants they're crispy beef is semi crisped beef but here it was crunchy and delicious.

This is definitely the worst dim sum place among all my experiences in New York for the couple years. To be honest, the environment is clean and service is good, however this couldn't help to raise the overall rating because their dim sum is below average. We ordered a couple dumplings to start, and the skins are too think while the fillings are all flavorless. We then tried the radish cake, and there is way more corn stretch than radish, making it soggy and flavorless. We also ordered the rice roll and the beef tasted dry as if you just heat up some frozen meat. No flavor again aside from the soy sauce. Their congee is also too over cooked that you can't really taste the texture of the rice. If you want congee, Congee Village or any other classic dim sum place in Chinatown would offer much better options. The congee is faThe best would be the taro bun and sesame balls filled with taro. Overall we will not come back again because they couldn't even get the most basic dim sum dishes right.

2.5/5 Honestly HUGE disappointment ... the pork and chive dumplings were literal pieces of slim with some mystery within the pork buns were actual pretty good but the meat inside was bright pink which I felt was questionable ?? The lo mein smacked tho
No comment

Not a typical dim sum experience with the old fashioned decor and rolling food carts. More pop decor. Can't get as good an idea of what each item is without seeing and smelling the aroma so hard to choose if you are not familiar with the items. However there is a sampler of ten tasty buns for a very reasonable price. Enjoyed the place.

Yesterday my friends and I went to this location for the very first time. The food was as good as the other locations. I loved the shrimp dumplings and the pork bun. The service was good with decent wait time. We will definitely go back.

i decided to give this location a try because it is close to where i live. although there are a lot of dimsum places in chinatown, they do not compare to dim sum palace. yes, the ones in chinatown may be cheaper, but i would rather pay a bit more for food that actually tastes good & is good quality! their dimsum is freshly made and i can definitely taste that freshness. their shrimp dumpling is my favorite because they actually use the whole shrimp, not just a tiny bit & it is FRESH and chewy. i enjoy eating all types of food: korean, japanese, malaysian, and more...but i absolutely love cantonese-style food (because im cantonese haha). dim sum palace gives me a taste of authentic cantonese-style food, reminding me of my hometown! thank you for the delicious food!!!
OMG! Just devoured my takeout order and it was so good! !! How am I only now discovering them? Highly recommend!

Rip off dim sum joint in the East Village. Might be just ok for half price but we paid full price unfortunately because it was raining and cold and we didn't want to deal with going further away from the apartment. I knew then we were vulnerable to being ripped off.  Small dim sum portions at twice the price of Chinatown. Don't waste your money. If you know dim sum you will be very disappointed. Walk, no run, half a mile south for the real deal at half the price and avoid the $5 green tea that is free everywhere else in the world. Thanks dim sum palace for making me feel ripped off. For 2 small dim sum I could have gone to Kikoo and had all you can eat sushi!
This is a regular for me and my girlfriend. Their shrimp dishes are our favorite which we recommend.
This was an amazing place. The duck-turnip cake was exceptional. I went here with my family and we all loved it.

My husband and I chose Dim Sum Palace for a big group get-together this weekend. They were extremely accommodating, happily offering us a private room for our 15-person party, and obliging our ordering seconds and thirds of several dishes throughout the afternoon. The waitstaff was very attentive and friendly. And the food was absolutely delicious. Every serving was gone within minutes and we kept ordering more! The prices were also affordable, even when including several rounds of Tsingtao beers. I was expecting to be shocked by the bill but it was very reasonable. I would definitely make this my go-to dim sum spot for future gatherings. Loved this place!

Simply delicious perfect dim sum. Freshly made and incredibly flavored with three brilliant sauces. The wild mushroom dim sum was a marvel; the shu mai pure yummy shrimp; the soy bean dim sum exceptional. The sautéed bok choy was scrumptious. I would so so come back and try even more dishes.

I've been here twice for dinner and now my first time for dim sum. Authentic Cantonese style food right in east village. Awesome service and delicious food.  No need to trek all the way down to Chinatown. Great food right here.

Loved this place! The service was fast, the prices were good, and the taste was spot on! The shirt dumplings were my favorites and the dessert rice balls (the green ones) are amazing! Definitely go with a group of people.
Great place.  Loved the food.  Will definitely visit this place again. The menu was easy to choose from and the restaurant was very clean and the atmosphere was awesome

Great dim sum place! I came here during their happy hour, which is 50% off dim sum until 5pm. I highly suggest taking advantage of this offer. I got the mushroom dumplings which were really flavorful! My friends also enjoyed their pork and shrimp dumplings.
No comment
I was hesitant at first because it looked nice inside but the dim sum is great. It's fast and good. They have a couple of newer dishes I didn't get to try.
Hands down one of the best dimsum places. Instead of carts they use an erasable paper and one checks the desired items. However, different ordering style intimidate you.

This place is amazing. Looks like they just opened this week, but the food and ambiance was incredible. I'd venture to say the dim sum is better than Tim Ho Wan. This may become an East Village classic. Highly recommended!
This place has great dim sum: food is very tasty and the price is reasonable. Staff here are friendly and the service is attentive. It's not a huge place but it's clean and quiet.

I've been anxiously anticipating the grand opening of this new Dim Sum Palace location since the sign for it went up this summer. Finally went today with a group of friends for Sunday dim sum. There was no wait - it doesn't seem to have been really discovered by the neighborhood yet. There is not much dim sum competition in the neighborhood - Tim Ho Won is nearby but very overpriced. I thought that this place was good, overall, but lacking diversity of the menu and with a bit of room to improve on the dim sum. There is a 20% discount for dim sum right now during the opening, and a free dim sum with yelp check in, so I advise you to go try it before these deals run out. We tried several dishes. garlic spareribs were a highlight - dried garlic and chili on top made them very tasty. Also tried pork and shrimp siao mai - both very meaty and tasty. The Ha gow was good as well. The tiny pork buns could be improved - they don't have very much meat inside, mostly vegetables. And the soup dumplings were a bit low on the soup - mostly just pork inside. The green sesame peanut dessert balls were very good but the sesame balls were a bit undercooked - the dough was very soft and not as chewy as usual. I would return to try more dishes , especially if they add some more unique dim sum items to the menu.

Awesome service and awesome food at an unbeatable price - 3 dishes that fully stuffed 2 people for only 11.70. We came in at 1:30am and were seated and served food so fast from a super jolly host. 100% coming back here again!

This has become one of my favorite dim sum places!! I stumbled upon it around midnight a few days ago, really craving dim sum but having no other open options. This dim sum was fantastic!! All of the food was delicious, the restaurant is clean and very nicely decorated, and the two gentleman who were serving were kind and attentive. The prices were also not bad at all. I live in upper Manhattan and this is a way better option for me than going down to Chinatown, where a lot of the restaurants I've been to (particularly dim sum) are not the most attentive to people who don't speak Cantonese/Mandarin and who aren't super aggressive and pushy since the restaurants are often small and busy. Delicious, fresh dim sum at this place, a real gem!!

Meeting friends in dim sum palace , the restaurant was clean and looks great. We order a couple things , shrimp steam dumplings, chicken feet , steam pork dumplings and stick rice, the food taste great . Fresh and delicate , better than some Chinatown traditional dim sum restaurant. Btw the tea was excellent. Must be try and we will come back

Really want to like this place. The congee was good. Hot and sour soup is the most bland I've tasted of all Chinese in America. The crispy shredded beef that costed $19.50 came not at all looking like the picture on Yelp menu. Should fix that to not mislead customers. It's just a plate of shredded beef on steamed broccoli. overall not a good dining experience. Still glad that there is a dim sum in the neighborhood. Hoping it can improve

Delicious food and nice service. Every time when we want some dim sum or when we want some Chinese food, we always choose this place. The kids love the dim sum so much, they can eat more food at here and another food are delicious too. The place is quite and you can just enjoy your food,and it's comfortable to sit here and chat with friends.
This place is incredible. The Dim Sum was full of flavour, fresh, delicious. The juicy beef dumpling was unreal

The Dim Sun here is delicious! Highly recommended. The shrimp dumplings are amazing! I've tried multiple items on the menu and none have disappointed. The food is always delivered very fast or on time. This will become a weekly routine if you enjoy dim sum.
This place was a disaster the food was horrible and the manager rude. The wait staff if allowed to do his job was very pleasant. I know this is a trying time but good food is good food.
Name says it all! Perfect place to enjoy dim sum ! All of them perfect and delicious! You will over indulge... I'm drooling just writing this review!
A VERY good dim sum spot for those not willing to hit up Chinatown. Tasty, quality, authentic, affordable, and good value.

Ummmmm the place is very clean and cute inside. Food is very bland. The ratings are so high, came in for dim sum and the variety of selection is small. No variety and bland at a higher end price. If you want good food you're better off in a Chinatown... People are very sweet but coming from an asian home and hometown in California this food was completely disappointing. I'm not even so sure how it has such high ratings other than its atmosphere and cleanliness.....

The food is very average. Note, there are no carts and you order dim sum off a sheet. Not an authentic experience and it shows in some dishes like shanghai pork buns and certain dumplings. Some traditional dim sims unfortunately have been dialled down or just blatantly prepared in an odd way to suit a wider audience I guess. Very disappointing.

Everything was excellent! We tried 5 different dishes, I can't remember the names of all of them but the cucumber was great as a veggie and the steamed shrimp and pork dumplings were sooo good. The fried spare ribs were also good. Great and friendly staff. Some of the best service I've had in the village.
Really good experience. Dumplings and cho fun were delicious and the service was excellent. We stumbled in here on a snowy, windy night and it hit the spot.
Pretty authentic foods and great service! We really liked the house boiled soup and cucumbers, as well as all of their dumplings.
Delicious dim sum, love with the taro buns!! Main dishes were also really good; friendly and attentive staff

Went here for a quick friend date and we were not disappointed. We got two orders of dumplings and chicken and broccoli and it was more than enough and pretty affordable. The flavors of great the places smells delicious and the food is great
Decent food and nice service! Everything I got was tasty except for the soup dumplings. The soup dumplings were okay, but I would expect more for a place specializing in dim sum and all.
Great vegetable dim sum! The edamame and mushroom ones were my favorite! And the fish filets were yummy but coulda had a better sauce
Walked into the happy hour. Half off on dim sums. Checked in and got one dim sum for free. Very fresh and authentic. Definitely recommend it.
The dim sum is excellent--we ordered more than we needed because we just couldn't stop eating. Interesting variety of dumplings. Clean flavors. Service is attentive. Would definitely recommend!

Hands down this is my favorite dim sum spot in the city. I am always on hunt for the best hargarwo and I will return for it. They just recently opened and have happy dimsum hrs between 3 to 5p. Make sure to advantage of that!!!

This place is giving Tim Ho Wan a run for its money as best Dim Sum spot in Manhattan; good quality, no crazy wait times and good service.  They also have 20% off lunch right now for their grand opening.

We frequent the this spot and are never disappointed! Their dim sum is on point. Tried the new sesame custard balls and shrimp mayo dumplings and they were delicious ! Plus lunch time they offer 50% which is in heard of. Hands down a must try
No comment
One of my favorite places to eat in the city. So cheap! The soup dumplings are amazing. Also try the scallion pancake and the pork buns. You honestly can't go wrong!

The food here is good, but we only got dim sum. We ordered 4 dishes which included pork soup dumplings, pork steamed buns, shrimp and pork siu mai, and egg custard buns. The soup dumplings were pretty good but the wrapper was a bit too thick and the soup flavor was a bit lackluster. I would say these were not a meal highlight. The siu mai were delicious with nice thin wrappers filled with big plump pieces of shrimp. I was pleasantly surprised as usually siu mai are mainly filled with pork rather than shrimp. My favorite dish was definitely the egg custard buns. The buns themselves were fluffy and soft and filled with a gooey perfectly sweet egg custard. So good and definitely a must order. I might come back just to order these some time. The prices aren't as cheap as Chinatown or Flushing, but it's to be expected given that this place is in the East Village and real estate there don't come cheap. If you're in the area definitely give this place a try.
Really slow service, on a day with few patrons. Food is just ok but when it takes 25 mins to receive soup appetizers, something's wrong.  Won't dine here again.
It's  a good dim sum restaurant, the taste is the same as that in Hong Kong, the waiter is enthusiastic, I will definitely go again.
This place is amazing! Foods are delicious, workers are nice, and the place is very clean. Would definitely come back.
More expensive than dim sum places in Chinatown. The quality of dim sum is good, although I would only eat here to optimize for convenience of location.

Amazing experience in Dim Sum Palace with my friends!!!!! When I was hanging out with my friends around East Village, we found this grand new open Chinese restaurant. We tried the bbq pork bun, shrimp dumpling, chicken dumpling, Shanghai juicy pork buns, and the pan fried tiny bun. I can say all of them are perfect for me. I am a native born Chinese from the south of China, who grew up with dim sum as daily food, but since I moved to NYC three years ago, I miss my hometown food so so much. I couldn't find that kind of tases even I am in Chinatown. Dim Sum Palace is different, their foods recall my memories when I was in China!!! Definitely come back again!!!!
This is a great Chinese restaurant. it tastes authentic and the service is very enthusiastic. it is worth recommending.
Food is served with tons of MSG - have a gallon of water after the meal. $$$$ for fake Dim Sum.

The place was very clean and nice. The service was excellent. Food was also super good. I thought it was a bit overpriced though. Other than that, however, I think it's worth checking this place out. Like I said, the dim sum was super good.
Good dim sum good juicy beef mmmm soft meat very good doesnt come with rice tho  haha was good but it was really good and the service was ok
Quick and friendly service, and AMAZING food. As simple and ubiquitous as scallion pancakes are, this place  has some of the best. The rice noodle rolls were exceptional as well.
Had a chance but left off hoisson sauce for moo shu pork, and gave us a half mini cup of soy sauce / no duck sauce for a $65 order. Not getting it done.
Good service. Food met standard taste for Cantonese dim sum. The lotus leave sticky rice was good except it was overpriced.

Best Chinese restaurant in Manhattan, such cheap price with prefect traditional Chinese food. As someone who has been growing up In China I am very picky about Chinese food, this place satisfy my demand.
It's been a while, so I came here tonight for late night food. It's still so delicious !!! Love this place, the shrimp dumpling and bun are so good! Service is great too! Can't wait next time!
No comment
Just delicious! Everything was perfect. The skin is particularly good. The lotus dessert and coconut were also good.

Had a great dim sum brunch there earlier today. Everything was delicious, service very good. We got in at 10:30 am just as they opened, and were seated quickly. Took maybe 15 minutes for dumplings to cook and come out to us. One orders off a menu with pictures and descriptions, with a dry erase pen - super easy and convenient. Fun music on, place was clean and has good rest rooms as well. Nice to see their other locations. Since dim sum are a huge family favorite, and they do theirs so well, we will definitely be back!
No comment
Love the food here. Ordered delivery several times and my favorite is the steamed spare ribs with olive sauce. The shrimp dumpling is delicious.

A bit pricey but great dumplings. We ordered the hot and sour soup that wasn't that great to be honest. But the rest of what we ordered was really well done! We ordered the soup dumplings, the Buddha delight dumplings and some pork dumplings as well as pork buns. They were all really good.
Delicious and open late! All of the dumplings we had were wonderful and piping hot. Reason for 4 stars is price which was very high.
I ordered pretty much every variety of their dumplings in on sitting.  Quite impressive flavor.  Must try.

I'm this restaurant, the way dim sum works is you order all the food first instead of ordering while eating. The food was decent. Some of the food ordered was too salty for us. Price was way more than expected compared to other dim sum places
Quite expensive and the waiter "accidentally" gave us more foods than we ordered. We ordered 1 bowl of soup, he gave us 3. Quite the accident

I had high hopes for this dim sum place near my home, but only disappointment results after my initial order. My usual fave, the char siu bao, here have a vinegar aftertaste, most unpleasant. The har gow shrimp dumplings are decent, and stuffed full of shrimp. Shredded duck rolls are slimy and fried shrimp rolls are tasteless. Beef congee nasty, and could use some mustard greens, and again with a bad aftertaste. Other dishes hugely overpriced. Won't be ordering again. Chinatown is not that far away, for better and cheaper.

This is a great place to go for early morning tea, they have a variety of dim sums to choose from and each of the dishes are pretty good. Especially the shrimp dumplings and their custard/red bean/ roast pork buns are superb.
This place was really good! The shredded duck rolls and juicy dumplings were my favorite! Also nice decor, clean bathrooms, great service, ended up staying there a long time.

I ordered two different dumplings, fried rice, chow fun and chicken with broccoli (spicy) with extra soy sauce, duck sauce, and hot mustard. The chow fun tasted burned as if sautéed in old oil. The fried rice seemed reheated and also wasn't very good. They gave me 2 packets each of soy sauce, duck sauce, and hot mustard for 5 dishes. Lame. This was my first and last order from them.

First of all, this new dim sum restaurant gives Tim ho want some much needed competition. They have much more selections and is offering 20 percent off all dim sum. We have been here back to back weekends and have not been disappointed yet. The egg yolk bun, shrimp dumplings, Shu Mai , were perfect. The chow fun was excellent as well. I always judge a Chinese restaurant by how they prep beef chow fun, and this did not disappoint. Not too oily, and just the right amount of flavor.

Excellent.  So good it got our family to stop bickering.  Authentic, understated and cozy.  Highly recommended.  The General Tsao's chicken was perfectly crisp outside and tender and moist internally.  Shrimp with Bok Choi was exquisite.  Beef broccoli took this mundane staple to a whole new level. To top it off the staff is friendly, professional and attentive without being obsequious.  Quite possibly the best Chinese food in Manhattan.  Lovely.
Dim sum palace is my new go to! Dumpling were sooo delicious! Fresh, tasty and the staff was great! Perfect for date night or big group dinner, or late night eats! Open late. Will be a staple for me!

Delicious no-frills dim sum in a nicer than usual restaurant. Started with fried garlic ribs, which as expected were great, and tried a variety of dim sum dishes. Pork buns were amazing, soup dumplings good, duck dumplings great, shumai very good, and the pan fried dumplings (ordered the pork/chive) were delicious. The service was quick and friendly, and they were running a 20% off all dim sum special! Will definitely be back.
No comment
Good dim sum. Would recommend green tea rice balls after the meal. They come hot and are filled with a peanut sauce.
Fantastic place and happy hour deal; pretty standard dim sum fare in terms of the menu but rivals Tim ho wan at a fraction of the price

Great place to hangout with friends , the most traditionally Chinese dim sum restaurant around this area , the shrimp dumplings and steamed soup buns were amazing very juicy. Also the serve was so good , definitely will come back next time .
No comment
No comment
No comment

The price is right here The perfect hole in the wall, small, local business place to grab food on the go. It's perfect for a quick lunch during work days  , especially if you're trying to eat healthy, fresh food without breaking the bank. It's Korean Japanese fusion, so I would say their yummy sticks / sushi burritos are a combination of kimbap and sushi - in the form of a burrito of course. I need to try the other items on their menu, such as the udon, next! Sometimes there is a small line but the service is really quick and always friendly. I'm so glad I found this place.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Cheap, delicious, and filling food. I got the original yummy roll, shumai, and chicken teriyaki. I couldn't finish everything all at once because the roll was already so filling! The original yummy roll was delicious and filling was flavorful, but the rice could have been seasoned more. Chicken teriyaki was cheap and delicious. I love coming back here for a quick lunch!
No comment
The food is just as lovely as the couple who runs this lil establishment. The food is always fresh and delicious! A go to lunch spot with an incredible bargain
No comment
No comment
No comment
It's literally a hole in the wall. Filled with a cute Korean family cooking these kimbap x sushi esque burritos. It's quick, cheap and delicious.
Love this place. The sushi burrito was very cheap and good. The mom and pop shop is super cute and small. Would recommend for a quick bite.
Do it! Finally stopped by Yummy Stick. Got the Shrimp Tempura. Tasted like sushi burrito heaven. Super filling as well.
Was intrigued by this literal whole in a wall.  Basically is an uncut sushi roll that is served warm. Was a great quick lunch on the go as I ordered 2 for only $12!!!!!
No comment

Spotted this place after searching for something to eat in manhattan for lunch. After looking, I wanted to order everything but, we decided to order 4. It was definitely worth the price and did not regret a single one. We didn't really use the soy sauce provided besides dipping it for the salmon and avocado because the flavor was great without it. The fact that the store was a small family store made it even better. Will definitely try to make the travel to come back and order the rest of the menu.
Truly the best ever, love this place and the lady that works the counter. Shrimp tempura yummy stick is unreal
No comment
This tiny mom and pop shop is amazing.. the service is fast and the lady that takes the order is soo sweet... the sushi burritos are to stay for... great place for a standup lunch
No comment

Great little spot to grab lunch from. Prices are low and the food is tasty. Shrimp yummy stick and ninja yummy stick (special) were both wonderful. Will be back for a tempura stick soon! Consider stopping by and supporting this tiny hole in the wall place.
