I love this place so much. The owners are so nice and welcoming and the yummy sticks are delicious. Get two if you're super hungry--they're that good. Every time I'm in the area, I need to swing by to get a spicy tuna yummy stick.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Definition of hole-in-the-wall, super fast and friendly service. I had to try the original yummy stick and it did not disappoint. I will definitely be coming back to this spot and recommend it to anyone visiting or living in the area

Spot is a gem. Never heard of it before (don't live in the area) but was swayed while walking past based solely on the good vibe of his tiny setup. Been back three times since. Owner is genuinely friendly and sweet and you can taste it in the rolls. Go support him and his family. Love Maru 2, it's now one of my favorite to-go places in the city. This isn't a corny and soulless sushi burrito spot, just homey uncut rolls made with love. Get the Ninja Stick.
No comment
Very cheap and inspired. Fast too. The spicy tuna yummy stick was great. Lots of options for 5-6 bucks incl. chicken teriyaki over rice for 5 bucks.
No comment

Love this little place. It was a wonderful experience. Every thing that we purchased was really fresh and tasty. Workers are super helpful and service is very swift. I'll definitely be back to try some other things.
No comment
My favorite sushi spot nearby! The sushi burritos are delicious and easy to get as takeout. The owner is incredibly kind to customers and a pleasure to interact with. 10/10 recommend. Hidden gem!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I ordered delivery from this place. Ordered through grubhub. Tried calling then 10 times to make a small change on the order but no one picked up. The food was prepared very late too. It took them an hour to prepare the food and was delivered to be 10 minutes after that. So I totally blame it on their service. The rolls were good.

Five dollars for phenomenal food. Great amount. Great taste. Great people! So welcoming, and speedy. Can't believe I haven't been there in a year, miss is so much, used to come here at LEAST three times a week.
No comment

Maru is a decent enough place to stop by on a lunch break, but given all the other food options in the area, I wouldn't say it's going to make my list of regular places. The prices aren't high, but when you begin adding things to your order, it comes out to the price of any other fast-casual lunch place. The sushi rolls are fine, but the rice isn't fresh (though I guess you can't expect too much from a casual place like this). The udon was also fine, but tasted almost like it came out of some sort of instant udon packaging. It satisfied my craving, but is not high on my list of good, casual Japanese lunch places.
Love this place. Excellent and inexpensive salmon yummy stick. Love the owner who is the nicest man in the entire world.
No comment
Tiny hole in the wall with the friendliest owner! No frills mini sushi burrito spot with really fresh food.

I came here on the advice of my students (I teach at the high school down the block).  They sang the praises of the Yummy Stick.  I was not impressed.  Too much rice.  I popped in again on a rainy afternoon to see if they could cater an event (they couldn't - not even a platter of cut-up yummy sticks), but the man and woman working there were so nice and friendly, and I wanted so very much to like the place, that I ordered an udon soup with chicken.  No dice.  It was $9, which is really not all that cheap for a soup that was mostly noodles, with skimpy flakes of chicken.  But the real offender was the broth, which was definitely "instant" and too sweet. I would have actually preferred a cup o'noodles from the bodega for a dollar.  So...add a star if you are a broke high school student.

I usually NEVER leave reviews but after my experience here I just had to!!! The owner is SO sweet and everything is super affordable and quick the spicy tuna yummy stick hit the spot!! Looking forward to coming to this neighborhood spot more often and coming back for some udon in the fall!!

I love sushi, especially shrimp tempura rolls so I was excited that Maru 2 had a shrimp tempura yummy stick. It was a nice size for $9 and was really good. The only downside is they close at 4PM and aren't open on weekdays. I enjoyed my meal and will definitely be back again.

Pictures don't do the yummy stick justice--the flavor is top notch, and the price point is probably the best I've seen in this city. It's a small shop with one very friendly person working, but I seem to get in and out super quickly when I go. No seating so make sure you have a game plan for where you're eating your food after!
No comment
No comment
Maru is one of my favorite spots in the neighborhood! The tuna stick is my favorite - it's fresh, reasonably priced and the owners are so kind.

A very small but great sushi joint. It us a hole-in-the-wall and hard to notice besides their white sushi sign. I tried the Ninja Yummy Stick and it was and is probably one of the best sushi rolls I have ever had. Ordering and making it was quick. The worker is very nice and always cleans the station when he needs to make another order for someone. The Ninja stick has spicy tuna, shrimp tempura, teriyaki sauce, egg, avocado and some kind of mayo. I was not expecting it to be as amazing and big as it was. While it is $12, the roll is the size of a hero sandwich like a big sushi burrito. The flavor itself was amazing and felt like I was trying multiple things at once from the tuna to the teriyaki and mayo and just everything else. All of it together is packed so well. Not only is it worth the price and the time, it is worth every bite.
No comment

Maru 2 is amazing!! It's tiny, a real hole in the wall. The sushi burrito is fresh, delicious, and truly affordable for the city. The man behind the counter is super friendly and fast. The place was full (6 people) and it only took 3 minutes for him to make my meal. Definitely recommend!

Wonderful quick and easy lunch. This place is small and very cozy. You are served quickly and all the ingredients are really fresh. I would recommend this place to anyone who's looking for a yummy lunch that won't break the budget. Can't wait to come back!

Great for a quick and affordable meal! I ordered the yummy stick with avocado and fried tempura and it was very satisfying! The service is always great, and you can order before through yelp for an easy pick up. Space is limited inside, so it's best for something quick and convenient.
No comment
No comment

Randomly stopped here and plesantly suprised!  I got the Spam Sushi Burrito and the California Sushi Burrito. Both were inexpensive and YUMMY.  Very very kind owners.  I'll be back!  Food was made quickly.
Amazing! Will be going back again and again... and again. So fresh and delicious! I had the spicy salmon yummy stick. Can't wait to eat my way through the menu!
Not really for a nice sit down meal, but yummy and affordable food. Great for take out or quick bite if you are in the area. I got the yummy stick with added avocado and it's bomb
No comment
No comment

Agree with all the reviews, the couple is ridiculously nice, yummy stick is yummy but don't expect anything that would blow your mind, but don't get me wrong, it tastes good!  It's a perfect lunch which is filling cheap and makes your stomach happy. I would continue to come just to support the small business :)
No comment
The Salmon Yummy Stick was the best $9 spent during our visit to NYC. Yummy is right!!
No comment

This place is so delicious and the man who works here is so sweet. The price is awesome and everything tasted really fresh. He was quick and efficient and even apologized to me for having to wait when i had been there for no more than 10 minutes, hardly a wait!! Will for sure be back
No comment

Sushi burritos were made with great ingredients and satisfied hunger for pretty cheap. Biggest selling point was that the owner was very kind. Hope for him to open a bigger restaurant in the near future.
No comment
No comment
I'm now a regular! I order through yelp for pickup and they greet me as soon as I walk through the door :) Food is delicious and affordable. A hidden gem in NYC.
this place is a gem my high school was right next to it and we always got lunch here. i had to bump onto ppl i hated but it was so worth the food lol :-)
Reasonable prices and the original stick is yummy! I also got the shumai which I liked! Definitely coming back  here!!

Tiny takeout Japanese/Korean-style food place. Super cheap rolls that are like kimbap rolls with sashimi inside. The owner is a suuuuper sweet man! Coming here makes me happy. I wish they were open weekends but he deserves that time to himself :)
No comment
No comment
Awesome lunch spot!! Favorite place to grab fresh, delicious, affordable, healthy "sushi burrito" on the go.

A nice small place for people who are looking for a quick lunch! The place is not for dining but rather for take-out. All the items here can be eaten on-the-go or really fast. I got the happy stick for $5. The ingredients are not extraordinary; in fact, you can make this at home if you wanted to. But the convenience of it and the location of the place contributes to the price, I guess. I would definitely come back if I needed something to eat really quickly. The man inside was really nice and he even explained how I should rip the aluminum foil.
Excellent quick lunch for pick up. The owners are the NICEST people ever. It is a joy coming here, both for the food and for the service.
No comment

I work in the area and this is my go to spot. $5 you can eat well $10 you eat like a king! The guy working there is incredibly nice too! Tiny walk in place w/ 3 stools so I'd recommend taking it out. Classic yummi stick, add avocado and you're set.
No comment

Really loved the sushi and Kimbap rolls. They sell it to you in like one big roll, no cuts like a burrito. Super tasty as a snack or as a meal depending on your appetite. Dip it in some soy sauce and you'll get a mouth watering Asian styled meal. Owner was super nice and has a great smile on all the time. He even has a painted portrait of himself super cool, not obnoxious lol.

Amazing service and incredibly delicious! I came here on a Monday afternoon about 30 mins to closing time. I was in the area and had this place bookmarked so I decided why not come give it a try? Well, that was the best decision I made all week. I was greeted by a gentleman (I assume he is the owner) behind the counter who was very friendly and understanding. After I placed my order, he went straight to making the Yummy stick and the spicy tuna roll. I didn't expect to like the spicy tuna roll but it was actually very flavorful! The egg in both of the rolls were the perfect touch as well. Definitely satisfied my sushi/kimbap craving! Most definitely will come back again!!

A great little stop, and a great little taste of Asia on this side of town. Fast and inexpensive, and always met with a great smile and customer service. They offer pick-up orders via Yelp too, so even more convenient! I ordered their chicken udon + sushi special was is a steal for $10... I'm full off of the noodles so I even get to keep the sushi as a snack.

Honestly didn't know what to expect when I got a Yummy Stick. A friend lives around the corner and has been raving endlessly about them so I had to indulge. It far exceeded my expectations! The Yummy Stick was filling and best of all only costs 5 bucks!

Delicious sushi at an incredibly low price. The Yummy Stick is the BEST. I eat here at least once a week because I just love to give this place my business. The owners are the sweetest people, they even sometimes offer you free miso soup when it's cold out!! Love them, love this place, would recommend 100x over.

This place is a lovely tiny spot with amazing little treasures. The price is very inexpensive and very fair, especially for the area. While I sat at the one person "table" (which was a stool and a ledge) and is the only seating... this is obviously a takeout place, there was a steady stream of regulars that came in and out. The proprietor was very friendly and you could tell when someone had come back more than once. He even remembered some preferred orders. He is a hard working man, and puts passion in his food creations. The most popular food were the "Yummy Sticks" which are essentially thin sushi burritos that you unroll from foil and bite. I will be returning to this place if I'm in the area. I'd say that it'd be better to have more space and have customers sit and eat, but that's the magic of their inexpensiveness, any larger and the overhead would be too much.
Super friendly owner, delicious and healthy food, great price. The only downside is their limited hours.

column3: East Fort Lauderdale, Fort Lauderdale, FL
column6: Grabbed a late lunch on Friday. Enjoyed the spicy tuna stick. Basically it's a Japanese burrito. Very tasty. My wife had the soup. It was a bit salty but the noodles were good.

Great place. It's a tiny hole in the wall kind of place with great takeout. I got the udon and asked for it to be made spicy. It was delicious. I also got the spicy tuna, the roll wasn't the prettiest but tasted great. My SO got the yummy spicy tuna roll, it was so refreshing. All together, love this place. The gentleman making the food was so kind and careful with how he packed all my soups so they wouldn't spill which was helpful because I made a stop to the post office before heading home. Everything came out to under $20. Awesomeness.
No comment
I have been wanting to try this place for weeks, but it's a long walk from work. Today I finally made the journey and it was definitely worth it! Delicious, filling and a super friendly owner.
No comment
Limited seating but great healthy food with a great price. Perfect for lunch take out or delivery.
No comment
No comment
Great value! Perfect spot to grab lunch to go. "Mr Nice Guy" will have you coming back!
Although this place is very small it's extremely lovely!!!! The guy who works here is incredibly kind and the food is great and affordable!!

Wonderful service and yummy food. I was a little disappointed with the lack of vegan options for broth so I wasn't able to get the lunch special that comes with noodles, but the friendly treatment I received plus the veggie dumplings and delicious avocado rolls left me satisfied.

Amazing little hole-in-the-wall, takeout sushi place run by an amazingly nice, friendly, and wonderful person. Unbeatable quality for the price (and also the friendliness of the owner)! My favorites are either the soba or udon noodles with shumai--which are leaps and bounds better than any equally priced restaurant in the area. If you're feeling indulgent, try the Yummy Stick, which is sort of like a sushi burrito.

I've tried a few rolls and the yummy stick - rice burrito with Fried egg, crabmeat, Japanese mayo. It's not bad for a quick lunch place. The people are super friendly. Come here if you want to be happy.

Quick easy and delicious. What more is there to say. Udon soup is delicious and totally worth it. It is a tiny place so don't expect a restaurant it more of a to go joint but delicious. Not the beat looking but the food makes up for it

This is not fine dining but it is a mom and pop type of eatery with the sweetest couple running it. There is barely room inside for more than 2 people to stand which is why the lines are out the door most of the time.  They have a solid udon soup and the yummy stick is an amazing deal for 5$. The sushi isn't bad either. Literal hole in the wall but great food, prices and customer service keep me going back.
No comment
No comment
I was craving sushi and found this place. It's super cheap but very good and the service is fast and nice. Will be coming here often!
No comment
No comment
Very good sushi for the price, served by the nicest guy in NY.
No comment

This is THE best place! I usually get the avocado kimbap for $6 and I can't find a better place to spend my money for a health lunch. The service is outstanding, very courteous and quick. I recommend not visiting the establishment between 12 pm and 1 pm because there is usually a long line of high school students. Other than that, I highly recommend going- you will not be disappointed.
No comment
No comment
No comment

It's a quick bites cheap eats kinda lunch spot. Basically the sushi rice wasn't to par and you'll find tiny pieces of fish in the sushi. Hardly i would even call it sushi as it contained so small of a portion of fish. Had the spicey salmon roll and udon lunch combo. The udon was way overcooked and noodles were so limp with no bite. Small shop with great service but the food was subpar.
No comment

Tiny place, served by the sweetest man! I got the udon and sushi lunch special and I can't say too much about it. It was an okay lunch, and did the job of satisfying my hunger. The sushi roll was salmon and avocado, and they were TINY. I asked for ginger and wasabi and he told me it was already in there. When I looked in at first I thought me messed up and forgot it, but really, it was just such a small portion of both that I completely missed it the tray! Service was really sweet, so at least it was a pleasant lunch in that sense.

I can not rave about this restaurant enough. It's close to my work, therefore I go at least once a week for lunch (not open during dinner). The chef that runs the place is a gentleman who treats every customer with so much kindness. He clearly has repeat customers as they all seem to know him. Tiny, take out restaurant that deserves "The Best Udon Noodles in NYC" title. Very authentic and inexpensive (especially for NYC).
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I was lucky enough to snag the only barstool just as someone was leaving, it's a tiny place but food is fresh, delicious, & the perfect price. I had shrimp tempura udon soup and shrimp shumai, both were so yummy!! Very nice guy (owner I think?).  Will absolutely be coming here more often!

i get the yummy stick with a one dollar soda ALL THE TIME. it's only five dollars and really gets me full, i love this place so much and the owners are so sweet! So affordable and if you need less spicy or sauces, they will provide for you
No comment

Wow....for a take out place...the sushi was really fresh.  The California roll was one of the best I've ever had...the rice was soft...and the avocado smothered the inside. It was melt in your mouth delicious.  The Udon noodles were again fresh.  I was in Shanghai and Xian China recently and it tasted just like the hand stretched and tossed noodle dough that I had when I was there. The soup stock was terrific.  The reason they can keep their costs down is there is very little accompany-ments.  No veggies in the soup...very little soy sauce, miso and ginger. Want a tasty and hearty meal...this is a terrific choice. If you need the little creature comforts of veggies in your soup or big helpings of sushi condiments...then you may not love this place.  But they have perfected the basic ingredients and priced it just right!  Amazing job!
No comment
Can't really say I was bowled over by this place.  But I did like their selections and quick and easy stuff during the lunch hour.  The staff was VERY very nice.
No comment
The sushi is amazing! And cheap, each roll with 8 pieces are $ 3.75 - $ 6.50! The place is small, but you can take the food home!
No comment
Spicy tuna roll fresh but very little tuna. Soba noodle soup extra spicy - soup was good but soba noodles were very mushy. I wouldn't come here again.

The pork belly buns were nice but they are smokey in flavor and sous vide'd so they are nice and tender.  Not a big fan of that ham flavor but this was good. The brussels sprouts were flavorful and did the trick to get a veggie fix.  Pass on the bing.  It is nothing more than naan and some kind of sweet chili jam. The meati nuggets were a tad spicy and perhaps should have been made with the sweet chili jam from the bing.  My favorite was the crispy potatoes with the notes of sour cream and crunchiness.  It was comforting and tasty.  Overall, the bites were a smorgsbord of ideas and flavors, some tasty where you want to eat the whole thing yourself and not share with your companions (e.g. potatoes), some where 1 piece was perfection (pork belly bun), some where you can't eat but 1 piece (meati nuggets) and some where the description and expectation were too different (bing) and the deconstruction dessert which was a disaster in presentation but you still ate it.  Go here for the view with a group. Picnic tables exude fun with friends but may not translate as fabulous food unfortunately.

Typically iceberg salads have no flavor but this one did. I really like the sesame on it. The Palmer was a lemonade and I love how green it was. Really yummy. The waffle was average. It could have use more apple and more flavor. My boyfriend had the chicken burger which was a really nice portion. Feel free to ask for a knife and fork for that burger!Service was attentive but not overbearing. Beware that regular prices are expensive but hey it's Manhattan!

I was really looking forward to eating at Momofuku Ssam Bar but unfortunately had a very disappointing experience. I've eaten at his restaurant in Las Vegas and have always had an incredible experience. With that being said, the food was ok but the service was awful. We made a 9:30 year reservation and received a call around 8:30 saying that we could come by earlier. We weren't able to so showed up a few minutes before our 9:30 reservation. We were rudely greeted by the hostess who seemed to be extremely upset that we had shown up so late (at 9:28 for our 9:30 reservation). I understand people want to call it a night early sometimes but don't offer reservations at this time if you're not capable of delivering on the David Chang experience. So once they begrudgingly sat us, the waitress comes up and says kitchen is about to close so you have one shot to put in all your food. There's definitely a more customer-service appropriate way to say that...anyways we ordered the ssam set which was overall very good. Drinks were also solid. The meats were all good and I really enjoyed the salad. The raw fish dish, hamachi I think, was a little fishy but the bing and salad made up for it. The meats were all tasty and the star of the meal. We ordered the oysters which were pretty standard but the $55 cacio e pepe rice cakes were not worth the price tag. You could tell throughout the meal that they were trying to rush us so they could get out of there, which really deterred from the experience. Once again, I know everyone is tired and overworked but we're pretty low maintenance so I just ask for a decent experience when we're paying to go to a nice restaurant. The subpar service really put me off to coming back to this restaurant. Would not recommend it unless there's a turnaround and more focus on service.

Hit n miss on the dishes.  The best was the fries that came with the ribeye, the oysters, and the rice cakes.  The bad was the fish, prawns, and shrimp toast.
Great views, friendly service and tasty food. Awesome place for a nice dinner by the water! Highly recommend reservations, always packed. Good variety of drinks and food!

I had brunch with a group of 6 here on a weekend. The wait was about 10 minutes. The staff were all very nice. The drink menu was impressive. We were all very satisfied  with our drinks. The galbi steak bowl was good, but not the best I've ever had. I've had a lot better for less than $39 so it was definitely overpriced. I would visit again for its location and drinks, but would probably not dine too frequently.
No comment

Didn't eat a full meal here but a group of 4 of us stopped by for pre dinner drinks and apps. Drinks were good - good balanced flavor profiles and decent amount of alcohol (not too strong either). Docked a star for the size of the apps. The ricotta with chili oil was great but the accompanying bread was TINY and asking for more bread was several dollars extra which seemed excessive.

I have mixed feelings about this new iteration of Momofuku Ssam Bar. I was a big fan of the old location and appreciated how intimate it was and how it reflected the David Chang swagger of the other earlier Momofuku restaurants. That vibe is nowhere to be found in the new location. It feels like an overpriced tourist trap geared toward people who have a lot of money to spend, want to dabble in some gateway Korean food (and/or perhaps are not comfortable with venturing to K-town), and want to see and be seen. It looks like it was designed for social media posts. That being said, the food was decent. Our group participated in the full Ssam tasting menu and liked all of the dishes. Nothing was exceptionally memorable for me other than the salad (randomly). All of the dishes were very "safe" and not terribly exciting, but they were well executed. The service was good until the end, when we were asked to leave because they had to "free up the table," even though all of the large tables around us were unoccupied. One other observation that I found to be somewhat interesting (as an Asian) was that I didn't see any Asians among the many staff members who were working there the night we went. I find that unusual for  an Asian restaurant, but perhaps this just happened to be case the night we went. Ultimately, I doubt I will return to Ssam because it just feels like a "new Coke" version of the old location, but I do think the overall experience would be enjoyable for most people.

Had such a great meal with some friends! It's a little chilly if you're seated in the outside portion but we were wearing our jackets and there were heaters. The food was im goodness sooooo good! We had such a blast besides the food and drinks being amazing. They were all so drool worthy, really go there. I only got one picture because well it was all too good to take pictures of.

We had the ribs, the American ham & baguette, white kimchi, and the steak. Let me tell you the sweet & sour ribs were the star of the show. Melt in your mouth juicy and seasoned to perfection. Stood in line due to reviews. This is a great $6/$8 meal. It's a shady looking place but it's great at what it is. Rice, a few pieces of cooked bok choy topped with roasted chicken, pork, or duck then a ladle of liquid from the meats is poured on top. Your meat will be chopped just before it's put in your small or lg container with the bones, skin, and fat. No place to sit. Line looks long bc only one customer goes inside at a time. We'll, it actually is a long line usually. I was about 15th in line and it took about 20 mins. Two men were dishing out the meals inside.

Can't beat the prices here but be prepared to wait in line. Got a large pork and large duck for $12.50 and it was enough for 2 people with leftovers. Only complaint is that the duck is a little bony so you had to work for not that much meat. Loved the "gravy" that they pour over the rice and will definitely be asking for extra next time!

Always a line out the door no matter what time! I ordered the char siu roasted pork and the chicken for $8.00 and let me tell you there was a lot of food! The chicken was actually better than the pork! I was surprised how tender the meat was. I will say, and I don't know if I came on a bad day but the pork was a little dry! I feel like I need to give it another shot but overall great flavors for a really low price!

Cheap and consistent are probably the two words that best describe this establishment. There is almost always a line out of the door given that the interior space has no seating and can only fit two or three patrons with standing room only. Their offerings are simple - roasted duck, roasted chicken, Cantonese bbq pork, and crispy roasted pork belly. This isn't the best bbq in Manhatten Chinatown by any means but given the $8 price for a regular pick two combo, you can't really beat the value. A classic! Love this place, great deal, there's usually a short line outside. Good for a classic pork over rice with lettuce and they have chicken options too. Super affordable and cash only. Line is always long so be prepared to wait. The roast pork (char siu) is the best thing to get here, hefty amount of food for the super cheap price. And the pork is so juicy and flavorful. I haven't tried the duck here myself but I heard it's kinda meh compared to the roast pork.

This was another spot in Chinatown that I kept seeing all over my social media. When we got here there was also a line and my friend and I probably waited like 30 mins. Keep in mind this place is also cash only but it's super cheap, we ordered a small roast pork and roast duck and it was only $6. Overall thoughts on this place is their meat is good but their rice is a bit more soggy, I think they they cook the rice they added a bit too much water and when they pour the sauce form the meat over is makes it more soggy. One of my other friends went on a different day and also said the rice was also soggy so I think maybe that's just how they make it. They also have a larger option for a little but more but my friend and I just wanted to share the small one. I think it's good to try this spot, for the meat and not the rice! But for the price, I guess you can't complain since where else can you find $6 roast pork over rice.
No frills, cash only, quick and delicious food. An absolute classic in Chinatown. Do NOT skip on the cabbage. I always ask for extra!

They just do everything right. The meat is always so clean, so flavorful, and packed to the edge. The price increased a bit bc of the pandemic but it's worth every penny and beyond.

Would walk by here as a kid when it was $2.25 probably back in 1999 back due to inflation it's now at $5 with lines going from the restaurant to to the corner of Hester st . It's a choice of pork or chicken w/ rice  in a container . The have outer items also but this is your best CHEAP option to get. I would go to Ny Noddle town if you don't feel like waiting but definitely $5 won't hurt your pocket . And the got and A Rating too . If your in the hood .   #cheapeats #undertendollars #FiveDollarMeal #onlyfivedollars Wah Fung No 1 華豐快餐店 #chinatownnyc #smallbussinesssupport #roastpork #bbqroastpork
If you know you know. The food and hustle is unmatched. This will forever be a go to. I send all my visitors here.

Pork/duck with rice/cabbage hit the spot perfectly  There was a bit of a line, but once we got to the front, they made the food quickly. There's a park nearby with benches too, so we ended up sitting there to eat. Can't recommend it more - absolutely delicious, juicy, and perfect portion size with a drink.

I've always seen a long line outside this place, so I've always wanted to try it, but never felt like waiting in line. I found myself free during the week, and decided to come here around 3 pm to avoid any lunch/dinner rush, and I was pleasantly surprise to see only one person in line! I got the small size of pork over rice, which also came with vegetables. I brought it home and emptied it into a bowl so that it would be easier to eat. The whole container was stuffed, so by bowl was overflowing with food! The small size was still a big enough portion to fill me up. The bbq pork was nice and tender and flavorful! I liked how they also poured some of the sauce onto the rice, so that my rice was also flavorful! I will definitely be coming here a lot more since the food was so good and affordable! I would've easily paid $10+ for this meal it was so yummy and filling :)

1 of the best bang for your buck in NYC. They only sell Chinese BBQ items (roast pork, bbq pork, duck, chicken) but they're all delicious and fresh. Their Char Siu's on point - good flavors with tad bit of fat for aroma and extra flavors. Their small box's only $4.50 (still packed with meat), whereas their large box is $7 - they all contain rice and veggies along with the meat options. Get ready to wait 20-30 minutes as this place's always packed during meal time and there're only 2 workers there. CASH ONLY!
No comment
No comment
Fantastic and great quality every time I've gotten it. Roast pork is a must. Chicken is great and duck is good. Worth trying them all if u wish but must get the pork.
No comment

Legendary Chinatown classic, took me too long to try it when I first got here but now I cant stay away. Sometimes I work from home just because I'm craving Wah Fung for lunch. Once I went to the gym but one of the staff brought in duck for lunch which I can't say for sure was from Wah Fung, but reminded me of the restaurant so when I left the gym I immediately walked to pick up my lunch from Wah Fung. My favorite is the crispy pork belly over rice and a small is enough to knock me out for a midday nap. The other options are char siu, duck, and chicken. I've tried them all but there's something about the fatty pork belly with the crisp skin and slightly burnt edges that goes so well with the sweetness of the cabbage and rice. Remember to bring cash, two customers ordering at one time, and to keep the line on the right side of the sidewalk so as not to block the way for others walking by!

WAH FUNG. thats what i say to my wife every day at 4pm on thursdays. take me to WAH FUNG or you're gonna be DIVORCED. so she take me in our bmw x9 (m competition series). she drive me there and later she let me kiss her
Gas pack. Highly recommend. Always a line but always a worth the wait. Come hungry because the portions are huge!
So i finally made it to this place! Let me say i was mad there was no Duck left so i had gotten the pork and chicken over rice. It was Slapping! Real good plate for under $8

I don't know how you could give this place less than 5 stars. They make the most cheap yet delicious and roast pork and duck in Manhattan. It is less than $6 for a small box of rice, lettuce, and a meat of your choosing. A large is  less than $10 and if you just want the meat, it's a full box that is ~$15. The only downside is there's always a large line because of how amazing the deal is. The line moves very quickly because of how quickly they chop meat and you won't be upset you went. One of my favorites in NY
No comment

column3: Woodland Hills, San Fernando Valley, CA
column6: Loved the simplicity of the menu & fact that you can feed a family of four for less than $30! It's the Chinatown version of the Soup Nazi, but the chefs were great. We showed up at a slow time, about 2 PM, and the line was only 15 people deep. Seating would be cool, but there is a nice park across the street to sit down  & eat.
No comment
Amazing quality and value. Be ready to wait. Cash only. But worth it. Can't go wrong but roast pork is by far the best.

No frills hole in the wall serving probably there best Chinese bbq on the east coat. The roast pork is to die for.  The fatty moist porky meat contrast beautifully with the crispy skin. All served on a bed off rice and veggies that doak up all the drippings from the gravy poured over it.

Cheap, hot and delicious...how I like my food and women! A must eat at if you are in China Town! Always a line but it moves quickly. No seating but the bird sanctuary/park is across the street. This place was one of my best New York experiences.

What a long line but so worth it! If you're walking through Chinatown and see a long line in front of Wah Fung, get in line because the food is such a treat! The line was long but it moves fast. It's a tiny hole in the wall restaurant that specializes in a few different meats served over rice and cabbage. The small plate is around $4 and definitely enough for a meal. The large is around $7.50 and can serve at least 2, maybe 3 people. My fave here is the char sui which was is super tender and sweet! I also tried the roasted duck but it wasn't as flavorful. Cash only though so be ready!

This place always have long lines outside the door waiting for amazing Chinese food. The most popular dish is the Roasted Duck ! Ohhh yess so nice and tender roasted duck. But it's first come first serve so you are lucky if you can get it. It's even better wen you can get the combination platter with Roasted Duck, Pork, and Chicken YUM!
No comment

This shop has made what they served appear worthy to a gullible audience.  Sure, make this cheap rice box and fill it with all the fattiest meats, cheap wilted cabbage for veggies, and drench it in liquid animal fat to make it  shine and pump people with a lifetime of protein fat to give them some cardiac work.  After all the raves, I realize that my experience here only amounted to a waste of waiting time with other clueless out of towners  that got caught into a ridiculous hype.  As my meal was simply  a box full of roasted chucks of fats, actual solid wiggly fat!!  What's the appeal of eating animal solid fat.  If you look around NONE of those on lines are locals, because they're smart to avoid this shop and go to other places that are the real deal for good C-Town bbq.
Duck Over Rice very very very good.  Looking for good food on a budget?  This is the place to go.  Line is long but moves fast.   Grab and go kind of place.
No comment

This place is truly a diamond in the rough. Great cheap eats! I highly recommend the pig (crispy pork belly) so delicious! Be prepared to queue outside as there's almost always a queue don't be put off it's totally worth the wait. Big shout out to @strictlydumpling aka Mikey Chen as myself and I'm sure many others wouldn't of found this place without your video!
No comment
No comment

Went to visit New York with my partner. I've always wanted to see what the hype is all about. Went here a little during the afternoon and the line was pretty long. Waited a little over 30 minutes to get our food, and the chefs did their best to keep it fast pace. We ordered the roasted duck and roasted pork. As we took the subway back to our hotel I was afraid the heat and flavor would disappear by the time we got to our hotel. When we got to our hotel we finally were able to eat these dishes. The food is amazing! Both the roasted duck and pork were flavorful. The amount they give to you is so much. I had seconds and still couldn't finish it. The dishes are also really cheap. I'd recommend this for anyone wanting to try this place out.
No comment

TALK ABOUT BANG FOR YOUR BUCK. This traditional Cantonese take out place is popping. $4.50 for a small or $7 for a large and that roast pork with rice and cabbage and their traditional sauce, come on now. Haven't tried their duck but the pork was probably one of the best cha xiu I've had. Perfect balance of softness and firmness in the meat. Their traditional sauce is definitely what makes it though.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Long line out the door! But the line moves fairly fast. Still the same good ass food. Everything but the chicken is good in my opinion. I get the roast pork and duck over rice. The portions are just monstrous. They give you the good cuts of duck too. Most spots always cut you the end pieces of the duck which is mostly just bone or fat. Wah Fung does it right! Although their flavor is slightly sweeter than competitors, you just can't argue with portion and prices! Thank goodness they didn't go out of business during this awful pandemic!

Decent cha siu fan, but not the best. The bbq pork was not as sweet as it should be, and the rice was overcooked and mushy. Doesn't live up to the hype, and certainly not worth a 30 minute wait in line. You can get better in SF or Vancouver.

If I could have lunch here everyday I probably would. The $5 lunch special is divine! I tried the roast pork combo. The pork was so flavorful and tender and the rice and braised napa cabbage had perfect texture as was so aromatic. There is so much food stuffed into that little box that it was heavy as a brick. I'd like to try the duck here next time!
No comment
Great Char Siu not withstanding how CHEAP this place is and how much food you get. Just be prepared for the food coma afterwards :)

The hype kind of holds. The roast pork is tender and delicious and sauce really makes the dish. The portion sizes and price point is perfect and the line, although intimidating, moves quickly. The roast duck is AWFUL. It is quite literally all bones, chewy skin, and gritty meat. We did not have a chance to try the roast pig (fried pork belly) but other reviews will tell you it's their best dish. Good restaurant amid a slew of mid places.

Little storefront so easy to miss--find it by spotting the line outside. Cash only! Worth the wait during busy hours. Roast pork was delicious, as well as the duck. I got separate orders of pork and duck, but there is a combo option that I think I will get next time.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: I eat in Chinatown at least once a week.  This is the worst roast pork I have ever eaten.  Poor quality meat, poorly seasoned, and overcooked.  It is cheap. I can't understand why people line up to buy this food.  It is awful.

Just okay. I preferred the chicken over the duck. Our biggest issue was the line. Took about 45 minutes to get inside, however once inside, we got food quickly. Its all to-go, no dining in. Also very good and inexpensive pricing.
No comment
$5 for a filling rice plate and generous portions of char siu with vegetables is what bossman hooks you up with. This place definitely a go to when in NY for some good and cheap Chinese bbq

I would give this place 10 stars if I could - what a gem. For $4.75, you can get a huge box of food. A large I believe is $7.50. We got the char siu, and sat in the nearby park (no sit-down eating). Not only are the portions large, but the quality of the meat is perfection. My go-to Chinatown cheap eat for sure!

It's no secret anymore that Wah Fung is is one of the most legit and affordable chinese rice takeouts still standing in the area. Used to come here for lunch during the work week but now make it a must stop spot to pick up when I come to Chinatown. Good to see a healthy amount of business with a line out the door still, but it goes fast and you won't regret waiting fifteen mins. Try the cha siu (roast pork), duck and soy sauce chicken!

Wow  the portions are huge. I came in Saturday night around 5pm to grab some dinner. It was a big line but it didn't stop me, and the weather was good so why not? I think it took like 20 min and then I have another disappointment- they've running out of duck. So I decided to take pork($6.50) and chicken($6.50) large plates. They really not playing games with portions. They've huge. Chicken was slightly dry and a tons of bones were inside. Pork was great, super delicious and flavorful. So wish next time they will not running out of duck.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Super cheap and always a line for the place. With this price you can't buy anything better than this

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment

One of my friends used to make a 3 hour round trip drive every few months from Connecticut for BBQ pork from this place, so I had to give it a try. There was a line of around 15 people when we arrived. The BBQ pork was delicious - lean, flavorful, and just the right amount of sauce. The roast pork belly was absolutely amazing - crispy, tender, with a thin layer of fat on each of the slices. The prices are really reasonable as well and service was efficient.
No comment
No comment
So Delicious and tender  , we ordered a small roast chicken, roast duck & bbq pork over rice for $5.75 definitely worth the wait , line moved fairly quickly , I'd go back
No comment
No comment
fast, flavorful, and cheap -- what more can you ask for? I got a duck & char siu combo. This place is a gem and a stable in Chinatown!
No comment
No comment

GROSS! A truly disgusting experience. As I waited on line and watched the staff thru dirty windows hacking away at huge pieces of meat, I almost walked away. The positive reviews convinced me to stay against my better judgement. I ordered the roast pork. My first bite was all fat and I had to spit it out. The remaining bites tasted fine but it was nothing special- you can get equal/better tasting food at pretty much any Chinese spot in the city where they keep the kitchen out of sight so it doesn't ruin your appetite. I waited 48 hours before leaving this review so I could confirm that this meal didn't create a gastrointestinal emergency. If you are not disturbed by the sight of the kitchen and are on a tight budget so the large portions and cheap prices are important to you, I can see how this place would be appealing. But for everyone else, STAY AWAY.

Came here twice on our trip, once catching a 30 minute wait mid-day on a holiday, and the second time, early in the morning with no wait. Definitely opt for the off-hours since this has become such a go-to spot for tourists in Manhattan's chinatown. The roast pork still beats the chicken and duck, so we just got that the second time. Cash only.
I stood in line for an hour just to get the cha siu box and it was so worth it. I can't believe that the portions were so big. We fed 5 adults and only spent a little over $20.

This place 100% lived up to the hype!! We got a small plate of the char siu (think it was like $5-6) and it was ridiculously good. The meat was sooo juicy, and the plate was even more elevated by the extra juice that absorbs into the rice and veggies. Usually don't like eating all the carbs but I just had to for this place!! Even though I got a small plate, I thought that the plate was still pretty big (check out the photo, all that protein!!). You definitely get your money's worth here. Cash only!
No comment

I didn't get any rice with my half duck and chicken. It was good but I was expecting more. The line moves fast at the cost of not being able to talk to the staff. Can't beat the price. The way they cut it I found myself picking out one too many shards of bone. Not an easy thing to eat.

Is it worth the wait? Maybe. The pork is delicious, but plate is overloaded with day old rice. Prices were more than listed on the board. A large was listed as $8, but I was charged $11. Inflation, I guess?? It was worth a try, but not so good that I would come on a regular basis. Social media has hyped this place up. Good but not worth the wait and definitely does not live up to the hype.
They have great roast pork over rice. Always end up waiting for at least 15 minutes because there's always a long line of people waiting to get their hands on the tasty meat they have there.

Even with COVID, this restaurant has super long lines. We waited for about 20 mins for their signature cheap yummy roast pork over rice. I've come here a few years ago and remember it being amazing and wanted to relive that. The small roast pork rice comes with some cabbage as well. They pour seasoned soy sauce over the rice and meat so it is flavorful. One thing I did notice was that the rice was stuck together and mushy. I prefer rice cooked so that the grains are individual. If you're looking for a cheap lunch, this is the spot. But if you're willing to spend a few more dollars, you can definitely get better quality elsewhere.
Cheap and delicious - make sure to bring cash to pay. The bbq pork here hits every time

Horrible  food! Horrible! Horrible! Got there on 9/15/22 ~ 4 PM. There was a line of 15 people. For $ 8, got a plastic container filled with rice, mushy steamed cabbage and meats so dried that you could not tell what it was. I'm beating myself for not opening the container and walking out when what I got it was not even close to food pictured in the reviews. This place is riding on the hype created by past bloggers/youtubers. This place should be closed for fraud. Please, please, look first what you are getting and walk out if you are getting garbage.

There was a line in front of the shop and the wait was definitely worth it. The duck was so juicy and tender, and paired really nicely with the cabbage and bed of rice. They also ladle a spoon of the duck juice as a sauce for the rice, which made it even more flavorful. Be sure to have cash handy since they don't take card.
No comment
Delicious cheap lunch - the roast pork is better than the duck but everything's tasty, the sauce with the rice and cabbage especially.
No comment

The roasted pork and roasted duck was juicy and tender. Definitely worth the price and the park across the street gives you an area to eat if you aren't in a rush. Though they are fast they seemed to have a constant long line. Took about half hour or so for us to get our food so don't go when your super hungry or you may end up hangry by the time you get the food.
Cash only! Really yummy for the price you pay (: there's a line but it isn't too bad of a way. Definitely recommend the duck over the pork. New York must try!!
No comment
No comment
Long line but moves fast. Crisp, roast pig skin, tender, flavorful meat. Fast, efficient, no nonsense service. No fancy ambience but definitely `great food for your buck. Definitely worth the line.

The long line over here means cheap and delicious food. If you are in a budget or trying to get a good bang for your buck, this is the spot. Grabbed some BBQ pork and chicken small bowls. About $4.75 each.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: It was a very long wait outside in the cold. I got the bbq pork, the food was ok, I didn't taste anything special. Personally I don't think it worth the long wait. I can get the same, or better bbq pork other places.
No comment

I order the takeout and tried it after 3 hours. It is still the BEST roast pork I have ever tried in my life! Definitely come back to city again just for it! No regret in all dimensions, not only for the taste, but also for the price. The only regret is that they do not have indoor dinning.
Delicious BBQ pork and cabbage! The duck is delicious as well,  I would highly suggest taking the drie to come and try this great food!
No comment

I've been seeing people post about this place for the longest time and couldn't wait to try it myself. The roasted pork with rice is SO WORTH IT. The large is a hefty portion for only $7.50, and I legitimately scarfed it down. There was a pretty substantial line outside, and I could tell many of them were repeat customers who enjoyed both the taste and value that wah fung no 1 offers. We also got the duck and while it was good, it paled in comparison to the roast pork. There was a lot of bone in the duck and it wasn't as great of an experience. I will definitely be back!!
No comment

I enjoyed Wah Fung No 1 and this is Chinese BBQ fast food at its finest. Great value, great flavors and fast service. It's not the best Chinese BBQ you'll eat but if you take into account the other stuff, it's very very good.
No comment
I don't understand all these reviews. The food is just ok. I was waiting in a line for like 30 min and if I know what I am getting, I would never wait. Just mid for nyc
Everything here tastes so fresh and filling, especially considering the prjce. I got the duck and I loved it!! Everything is so well balanced, a must visit in Chinatown
No comment
No comment

I was here earlier today, had to grab a quick lunch. Perfect for a keto diet like myself, I choose a small order of roast pig with cabbage no rice [$5.50]. I really like their meat here because some places sell roast pig as well but if they dont clean em well and cook it right it will leave a stinky smell and taste from the pig, but I didnt taste it here which is perfect. I frequent this spot when I'm in Chinatown.

My boyfriend ordered their small rice plate with roasted duck and bbq pork and he LOVED IT. It is also super AFFORDABLE at around $5 per plate and super filling. Look at how much they give you!! If you are looking for an authentic cheap eat, this is THE SPOT!
No comment

The line wrapped around the block & the wait was soooo worth it. For $4, I got the roast pork & duck. Upon ordering, the chefs/butchers cut the meat fresh in front of me and added their specialty sauce. This was the best roast pork I've ever had the pleasure of eating.

Nothing beats WF in terms of price and a filling meal! Even the small size is enough to fill you up! Glad they still have great business and are open during Covid-19. The meat was good, but I felt that they could maybe include a bit more cabbage (or possibly any other vege too like carrots but not complaining esp given the price). My little box had two leaves of cabbage, so I felt that maybe they could either put some more instead of a huge bed of rice or just none at all. The meat is delicious though but too much rice for me!
No comment
No comment
No comment
I don't get the hype besides its a really good deal & very tender pork. Ordered a large and a small. Ended up giving the large to a homeless person in the subway.
No comment
No comment

Great fast affordable food.  The sauce is what makes all the meat taste more amazing.  So request more sauce on your meat, it's necessary!  I also would've liked less rice and more cabbage but all in all great Chinatown eats.  Chicken was well seasoned and well done.  There will be a little line to get in but when u have butchers chopping fresh meat for u, in front of u then it's worth the wait!
No comment
No comment

Delicious!!! Ordered a plate with pork and duck, which only cost 7 dollars. The meat was very tender and juicy and it came with a good amount of rice as well as some cooked cabbage. The line went pretty fast.

I heard so many great things about this place even when I lived in SF. So we took the subway to Chinatown to pick up our poultry for our Lunar New Year celebration! There was a line when we got there so you know it's good. The butcher was a friendly old man who spoke Cantonese so it reminded me so much of home in SF. We ordered a pound each of roasted pig, cha siu, roast chicken, and duck and it came out to only $56!This is half the price of what my parents would pay in SF at the place they frequent! Such a good deal and the meat was so flavorful and perfect! The prices and taste can't be beat here! I just wish the location wasn't so far from where I live!

One of my favorite go to lunches in the lower east side, I used to go there in 1983 when I went to I.S. 131 Jr . high school.  Couldn't believe they were still there,  love this place.  Be ready to wait on line to get in but it's definitely worth the wait.

I was thrilled to learn that Wah Fung reopened recently after closing due to Covid-19. Yes there was a line due to social distancing but it moved fast.  They're still cash only and still as delicious. Support small businesses!
No comment
No comment
Just to think I've been going to this place for ten now and the food still taste the same,the prices may have changed a bit,but not by much.
No comment

Stop by this place for the super cheap Chinese BBQ roast meats! Prices here range from 4.50-5.50 for a small and 6.50-7.50 for a large. They give a pretty good sized portion for a small of rice, cabbage, and meat. We ordered the duck and pork which were both super flavorful and tender. Be prepared to wait in line if you go later in the day and remember to bring cash!
No comment
No comment

A must eat in NYC!!! There was a bit of a line when I came but it was 10/10 so worth it. This is such an incredible cheap eat in Chinatown--at $12 for two boxes, the price point can not be beat. The meat flavor is impeccable and the roast pork in particular is to die for. The rice and cabbage worked super well with the meat flavors and it was seriously just SO good. I definitely enjoyed the pork more than the duck, but I still would highly recommend both.
The roast pork was tender and delicious!  There was a long line but the wait went by fast.

This spot is legendary for a reason. All you have to do is walk by and you'll know that. The line goes all the way down the block, even during a pandemic. That really says something about the quality, don't you think? The food here was fresh as can be, and the the ingredients were absurdly tasty. You have got to go here
No comment
Believe the hype! Large portions at cheap prices and everything is delish. If you don't want the white rice you can ask for no rice and you'll get extra cabbage.

Giving it up for Wah Fung - Five stars for surprising quality at such a small price.  Scored 1lb of roast duck ($11) Sunday mid-day.  I've seen the line outside stretch down the block.  Maybe the rain but only 6 people before me and the front door, which I came to understand once you reach it, you still wait until you hear some sort of shout to come in.  Super small space.  Cash only.  My change was taken out of a cardboard box.  No decor to speak of, but you came for one reason anyway; fantastic Cantonese style roast pork, chicken and/or duck!
No comment

I normally HATE duck - until I stumbled across this place! It's a hole in the wall Chinese spot that specializes in pork and duck and is cash only. I got the small order of duck, which comes with rice and veggies. Hands down the best duck I've had in a while. Don't be fooled by the outside/NYC hole charm - this place is amazing!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I heard from people about how I should try this place and that they have one of the best roast pork in all of New York.  I stopped by there yesterday and luckily for me, the line was short enough.  By the time I got to the front of the line, they almost ran out of the chicken.  I only got 1/4 portion of the roast duck, and ordered separately roast pork.  Lastly, I got a roast pork with rice and vegetable for $6.50 ish.  They did give a ton of cooked cabbage so that was good to see.  Roast pork is pretty good and turnover is very quick.  I do like the sweet glaze sauce that came with the roast pork alone portion.  Again, this The menu is very simple, and the owners do speak English.  They do have a huge following so I am sure there are a ton of diehard fans.
Got 1 pound of cha siu. Hard and dry meat; looks like they only gave us the bad dry end pieces. Would give 0 stars if I could.
No comment

In honor of Chinese (Lunar) New Year we drove downtown to Chrystie St (near Hester) to fulfill my craving for char siu pork.  I asked my NYC Hong Konger friend "Where's the best place to buy char siu pork?"  He told me Green Garden but I saw a big C on the door and balked.  I'm never trusting that friend again with New York Chinese food advice.  TC, I'm talking about you!  All I wanted to find was a simple, cheap, reasonably clean Chinese meat counter shop like Nam Fong in Honolulu Chinatown to buy juicy cuts of char siu, roast pork, duck or chicken.  Wah Fung No.1 in NYC Chinatown is that place!  We arrived late around 10:55am and there was a line to the street corner.  The shop is so small that only 1 or 2 customers are allowed in at a time.  At first it didn't move so fast (too many indecisive customers?) and we had to listen to firecracker music from the next door gift shop.  But we finally got in the door at 11:25am.  We bought a large takeout container of char siu pork (no rice, no cabbage, only meat!) and I had to hide my joy when they said $12!  They had to repeat it twice, I couldn't believe my luck!  CASH ONLY though so luckily I had $ in my purse.  There's one butcher inside chopping up your meat and another person at the cash register.  It looks just like Nam Fong in Honolulu.  I felt like I was home in Hawaii's Chinatown (the 2nd oldest Chinatown in the U.S.).  We were in and out in 3 minutes with our cherished char siu in our tote bag.  Wah Fung also sells "plates" of char siu, roast pork or chicken and rice for $4.50, but we just wanted fresh char siu to season our home-cooked fried rice, Singapore noodles or soup.  Beware however the char siu sauce is very sticky and leaked inside our tote bag (my husband was carelessly bouncing the bag on his shoulder).  It smelled so good that we couldn't wait to snack on it - rushed back to our car and ate the char siu on top of cilantro and scallion steamed rice rolls that we bought for $2 each from Delicious Huang Bakery around the corner on Hester Street. Wah Fung gives huge portions.  Good value for char siu exactly like what I grew up eating.  I only remembered to take a photo halfway through our feast.
No comment

This place is peak value. Definitely a must try if you're in Chinatown or even NYC. They serve rice and cabbage topped with various Chinese roasted meats, including pork, duck, and chicken. Honestly a small is enough for me and I have a pretty big appetite. For less than $5 you can't find food this good anywhere else!
5 bucks for a serving of roast pork and duck? Yes any day! Got a size small as an appetizer and def wet the appetite - recommended to try if you're on a China town food tour

They give you a big portion. There is plenty of food even if you order small . Roasted pork was good but too much fat for my taste even when I asked for a lean cut. Just an average roasted pork. There are places that honor a customer's request better without the long line in Chinatown.

They used to be so good but food quality has gone down the hill. I got roast pork cha siew and roast duck which was not as good as it use to be... Their roast pork with crispy skin was nastyyyy. I would only get cha siew and soy sauce chicken if I ever go back.

This was $6.50, cheap by NYC standards. My go to place when I feel skinny and am craving for pork. Since they are takeaway only, I usually end up at the park opposite, watching kids play basketball - best in spring and fall.
No comment

Hands down the best Chinese takeout!! Roast Pork or Chicken rice plate for $4.25. And it's one of the best slice of roast pork in all of Chinatown. Beware the will be a line out the door!! The rice "plate" comes in a white box with sautéed Napa cabbage, with tons of white rice, and yummy roast pork. The chicken option is a roasted leg quarter. The do have duck wings, roast duck, and roast pork ala carte. If you're on foot just go across to the park and enjoy your yumminess.
No comment

Saturday afternoon - over 20 people in line, prices has increased to $4.50 for the small and large is $7 w two items BBQ pork and Roast Pig.  High Quality meats and still my go to spot in Manhattan.   You have an option to buy the meats by weight.

Definitely worth lining up for! We waited about half an hour on a Saturday just after lunch. The two guys working were fast and friendly. Just be ready to order when they call you to come inside. Cash only.
No comment

What a fun local really cheap but very food Chinese.  In fact was so fun that most I'm this place spoke Chinese.  Also a lady sat right down next to me to eat as well.  I had a steaming bowl of the roast duck w veggies, awesome good and as said crazy cheap!  Had not been that far downtown in awhile.  Fun people watching too!
No comment
You only come here for the food specifically Pork and roast duck.  Then walk across the street and take in a basketball or handball game while woofing down your meal.  Yes woofing, it's that good!

Came here on an Asian food crawl. Got the small roast pork with veggies to split between three people. You get plenty of meat and it is sweet and flavorful. Highly recommend ordering in Chinese because I did not and I think they skimped on the sauce. So the rice could have been saucier but still this was delicious and such a good deal!

Today, I ordered chicken (no rice & no veggies). I wanted to bring the chopped up chicken home for dinner for my family. When I got home, 80% of the chicken was old!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The chicken meat did not look right, I pulled it apart with a knife and I knew I could not give this to my family! At this place you get what you pay for.....cheap prices and bad, cheap meat!!!!!!!!! Be careful with this place because if you don't carefully inspect their food, you can get sick! They should not be selling meat that belongs in the trash!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! And that is where I threw the nasty chicken in.....THE TRASH!!!!! People come here because they give huge portions for a low price compared to the other restaurants in Chinatown. Cheap meals are not worth getting sick and possibly getting food poisoning or ending up on the toilet for hours! I will not be coming to this place again!

I was craving for roasted duck and found this neat spot by accident! I got a small order of duck and rice, which was so yummy and surprisingly filling. The place didn't have seating area, but it wasn't a problem because I was gonna bring it back to the hotel I was staying at anyway. I'll be coming back to Wah Fung for sure!

Super long line but...hella worth the wait. Stopped by here right after landing from Texas. It's across the park so we posted up on a bench to eat it right away. Roast pork is different from the bbq pork, in which they don't really have advertised boldly on their menu. I recommend getting them all!! Cash only folks

Fast, cheap and tasty! I love this place. The small lunch portion is only $4.25 for pork or chicken. I actually opted to get the large pork lunch for $6 so I could eat half and save the rest for later. It also comes with some steamed cabbage. I wish they gave more veggies, but quite nice of them nonetheless. The pork was super moist and tasty and they're nice enough to pour sauce over rice for you...although it could be more flavorful. For the price, I definitely wouldn't complain though.
No comment

Best place for a valued takeout lunch of Chinese BBQ meats over rice. Place is small, only a counter for ordering. There is always a line out the door but it moves fast. Longer line during lunch and evening hours. The roast pork or chicken over rice with vegetables is only $4.25. Very tasty and satisfying.

There's a line for this place and there's a reason why. The prices are inexpensive, the food is freaking delicious, and it's quick. I mean Chinatown has a lot of inexpensive, delicious restaurants. I had duck and roasted BBQ pork. The best BBQ pork I've had so far was in Vancouver BC. I want to say this place is pretty up there with that. Very flavorful and juicy. The entire meal including the rice and cabbage just made my tummy satisfied after a long day of walking around NYC.

This place is a really small shop that will always have a line, but it's worth it! The meat was super tender and juicy. I went there multiple times and they can sometimes get inconsistent, but still good regardless. I definitely recommend the crispy and roasted pork. They don't have any seating, but there is a park across the street that's perfect for eating this bowl!

Fung bros food, you guys the reason i tried this place. My mother and I was here yesterday morning and We  tried two large roasted duck, both of them is salty i mean it's very very salty. I'm sorry just honest experience.

Pretty bang for your buck with lots of pork and rice. Would definitely recommend if you're stopping by for a quick bite.

SOOOOOOOOOO GOOD!!!!!!!!!! No where to sit and eat so it's just a buy and go type of place but i have no complaints. Sooooo much food for so cheap

This place I discovered 7 years ago,I'm looking on Yelp to find somewhere to get lunch,and a typed in Chinese food and this place popped up,so I looked at their sight and liked what I saw.So I walked over to it,the line was a bit long so I knew it was good and got my food,I wasn't disappointed in the least,it was so good,we have it atleast 3 times a month.

Honestly if you go at the busy times, this line is hella long. I got there at like 1? And it was 15 people deep, and took 20 minutes I think until I got to order, and I just wanted the tiny box. When I left, the line tripled. Hole in the wall, no frills, and everyone who comes knows what they are getting. They're pretty quick and calm and collected, and it's definitely a neighborhood gem. The little box I got was hefty but probably more due to the amount of rice. It smelled like childhood and tasted like it too--the flavors are balanced and really comfort doesn't get more comfort than this. Super cheap if you're on a budget and it'll fill you right up. Cash only!!

Always one of the best cheap eats in Chinatown and NYC. Fresh duck, chicken, roasted and crispy pork served over rice or by the lb. Always a short line but worth the wait.
Very very long line outside. Authentic Chinese taste and great value for money. Definitely would buy again

Tasty cheap eat in the Chinatown. I tried the combo platter with the roast pork and the roast duck. The roast pork was waaay better than the duck. It was tasty and super flavorful, while the duck was tasty, crispy but a bit oily. My only recommendation if I was to try this place again would be to skip the "sauce" on the rice. It was pretty oily and that plus the greasy duck was probably a bit much. However, a tasty meal at less than $7 can't be beat. I would definitely recommend!

My favorite, inexpensive Chinese food in NYC. Delicious!

Love it!!! Their Cha Siu and BBQ Chicken were so delicious. No one can beat their prices in Chinatown. You must try this place if you are in the area. I'm serious. Whenever I go, there's always a line. You know what that means.

Located in the Chinatown in NY, probably one of the best places for cheap foods that you can get with quality.  I think I waited about 20minutes. Because of COVID they allowing two customer inside. Or always have been 2 people inside, because simply not enough space for 4 people. No Dining in space.  I already knew what I was gonna order roasted pork and duck combo for only $7.50!!!!! But many uncultured tourists need a lot of time to figure out what they want.  It literally says on the signage #1 fast food, but more of a must stop tourist hot spot with average wait time of 20minutes or longer.  When it was finally my turn to place the order there was one skinny old man and a young apprentice working together.  I ordered and got my food and set on the nearby park bench. White rice at the bottom and stirred fried napa cabbage on top of the rice and roasted pork and duck at the very top.  Nice crust textures on the pork and it tasted delicious!! Who needs fried chicken from Zaxby's;). Duck was also very moist and tasty delicious!

Amazing tiny little spot. No outdoor or indoor seating so it's just grab and go. There's usually a line outside but it goes by quickly. The best dish is the roast pork with white rice and veggies. Highly recommend

How can this place say to a non-Asian that it's run out of roast duck at 4 p.m. on a week day when it still has a few ducks hanging in the window, which are reserved for maybe, other customers? Sorry rude guys, not a fan.

Apparently you can pay a small $4.25 for a mouthgasm. Came on a Friday afternoon and there was a line of around 8 people that moved fairly quickly. I ordered the pork over small rice and vegetables. The ratio of pork to rice to vegetables (sautéed cabbage) was 5:5:1, but the container was filled to the top and the two workers there were the no-frills kind of efficient. The roast pork was perfect, the rice was covered in some sort of sauce, and the cabbage was sparse but good. The place is cash only so remember to bring a $5.

This place is a cheap and cheerful joint offering great Chinese roast meats amongst many others. Added bonus with it being an "A" rated restaurant by the health dept. Came here and picked up 1lb of char sieu (bbq pork), 1lb of siew yoke (roast pork) and 1lb of chicken. All to go and ended up being $24. There are no seats in the restaurant but you could always eat it at the park across the street if the weather is nice. Slight queue when I got there but it moved pretty quickly.

So cheap and delicious. 7.50 for the 3 meat large which is large enough for me to share with my boyfriend. My favorite is the pork and he likes the duck, but we usually get the 3 meat for the variety. At 6pm dinner time the line is usually 10-15 people deep but they move pretty quick.

I asked for lean cha siu because that's what I usually get from other stores, but it ended up being really really dry and flavorless to the point of being like pork jerky. Would not recommend ever asking for lean. Might update my review if I ever come try the regular fatty level.

Cash only, $6.50 for the best plate of char siu. Amazing taste, price, service. Definitely worth the wait and lives up to the hype.

Literally the best place in Chinatown! There is always a line but the service is super quick! There is four types of meat: roasted duck, roasted pork, fried pork, and chicken. Definitely try the duck and fried pork. If you put up the three sign for combination, they will give you duck and both pork. Highly recommend this combination. So delicious! CASH ONLY!
No comment

This was probably the best food decision I made since moving to the city! Delicious, authentic, and satisfying. I got the large roasted pork and duck over rice for $6.50. Both meats were extremely juicy and flavorful, and paired perfectly with the rice and cabbage. The portion size is enough for at least 2 meals, maybe 3. As previous reviews mentioned, the veggies were a bit lacking, but then I think about how having more veggies would mean less meat... and well, the current setup is definitely preferable and better value. This joint is definitely worth a visit to Chinatown!

Went based on a popular video food blogger's recommendation. For a few bucks more, I went for large rice plate at $6 (small is $4.50). That was my first mistake. We did a mini food tour and wanted to try a lot of places in Chinatown. The large was LARGE and filled me up. Second mistake was NOT getting the roasted pork. The char siu pork is good, but the roasted pork is even BETTER. The roasted duck was meh. I would skip on that. Cash only spot. I probably would only come back to try the roasted pork only. No line and super cheap, so was still worth our time.

Hands down has one of the best cha siew in all of Chinatown. Their prices are reasonable cheap, especially for the generous portions they give you. I especially love their ginger scallion sauce. I always ask for it on the side because it's that good! Definitely would recommend getting it, especially if you're having rice with your bbq meats!

Consistently overated. I would never stand online for 20 minutes for this place when the siu yook at the teow chiao place next door Kim Thing is consistently way better. Wah Fung is spotty at best and their roast meats can be too sweet, too fatty, too soft and go from that to pretty good. Just cuz it's cheap don't make them the best though.

Cheap but super tasty roast pig. I usually ordered a Large without the rice and it cost $8.50. The serving is huge. This is a to go place since theres no seat
can anything beat wah fung ??? this price and quality is truly the best of the BEST. i love the pork much more than the duck but both are honestly amazing. make sure to bring your cash though!

Lines were long even on a Sunday at 4pm during a pandemic, but it moves quickly and it's well worth the wait. There are a few ATMs nearby to get cash. I've had their char siu (bbq pork), roast duck, and roast pig (crispy pork belly) multiple times and it is always juicy, fatty, smoky, salty, a little sweet, and so delicious. If you don't know what to get, get the char siu because it's a classic, but I really recommend adding some roast duck or roast pig to make it a well-rounded feast. Pictured is a large container with half duck and half char siu. I usually skip the rice if I can make the rice at home - get more meat!

The pork was nicely flavored and they really do not skimp out. Good portion size for what you pay. Super fast service, would love to come here again.

Had the half roast pork and half char sui on rice with veggies - for 7 dollars, this is the best meal I've eaten in NYC, I love this place! Will definitely be back again from Canada to have this amazing food again!

Best cheap meat-rice dish in Chinatown. The place speaks for itself, definitely worth checking out. JUST DO IT.

I was growing up in Hong Kong so Cantonese style roasted meat was always my home food. This place sells amazing char siu (roasted pork) that is as good as those I ate in Hong Kong! And they sell it so cheap with large portion, that makes it even more amazing! Always long queue but well worth the wait. Make sure you also buy the roasted chicken leg (pretty big size) and pork ribs for dinner or next day if you come from far away for it (like me, from NJ).

This place needs to come to Toronto. You cannot beat the prices at Wah Fung. We got their ROASTED DUCK, PORK AND CH ($6.50). It really is the #1 fast food place in New York and I would go back in a heartbeat. They don't have anywhere to sit, but definitely worth standing for.

Some of the best roast I've had in a while! Gotta love affordable, quick but delicious food that you can get on the go to share with friends. I got the roast duck which was just a perfect balance of savoury and sweet. The skin was the star of the show and the sauce was just heavenly
Amazing traditional roast duck and bbq pork for the price. Theres always and line and I personally waited at least 30 min, but was worth it. Will definitely go again.
Look at the line anytime and you'll see why its like this all the time.  Service is no frills and they move quick. The porkiIt's just a fattier juicer cut then other places for the lowest price.
