The owner ignores you lol oof when I walked in tryna get some food I checked and I had no cash I went to the nearest bank and get cash and then I came back and got ignored lol so fuck them

All I can say about this no frills little hole in the wall. It's cheap and yummy. Cheap, as inexpensive not quality. The chicken and duck plate was delicious. If you're ever in NYC and need a getaway from the $20 meals check out this place for a small plate for $4 or a large plate for $6. Cash only and fast service

I don't know this guy. But I have to tell you he practically raised me! Growing up eating this awesomeness. I hope this place last forever! Especially with the price and the portion. OMG. Since I was a child till this day. The price hasn't changed! That's what brings ppl back! Anytime I'm in the city. I would buy at least one to go! What I recommend. EVERYTHING. My person Fav. Half skinny/fat cha Siew with rice. Lots of sauce! *Drools* Don't judge me!
No comment
No comment

This place is so freaking good and most importantly, cheap!!!! "Small" roast pork over rice for only 3.75. They call it small but I think it's enough to fill 2 people. So much pork in one little container. Very flavorful and juicy. Not dry at all. I've never tried the chicken or duck but I've seen a lot of people order the duck so I'm assuming it's pretty good. Lines can get long during lunchtime but service is fast.
Solid Chinese bbq. Everything is great but the lines can be long.the line moves quick though.
No comment
Food is good, come for the value. I haven't gotten this much Chinese grilled meat for $5 since 1999.
No comment

The cha siu over rice (& cabbage) is plenty of food, and excellent food at that...and to think you give them $5 and get $1.25 back? Absurd. Explains the line even at their 11am opening. The takeout container requires some skill to eat without a mess, but how overpacked the portion is, especially for the price and taste, more than makes up for it
No comment

Hole in the wall type of place but mad good! there's no where to sit so it's a take out place. don't let the line fool you it moves fast. Quality food for dirt cheap price. What else can you ask for! I love getting their $3.75 box of char siu. It's huge and more than enough for one person. Def my go to place from now on!! and no it's not dirty at all! they have a Grade A unlike many of the eww-wy chinatown places.

Came here on a Saturday afternoon and the wait time was about 15 minutes. Ordered their $4 roast pork on rice special. It also comes with steamed Chinese cabbage which was a bit overcooked but was still pretty good. Roast pork was flavorful and tasted authentic but did not wow me. Some pieces of the pork were a bit on the skinny (with no fat) side and some had a great skinny pork to fat ratio. Definitely worth the $4 and would have to come back to try their crispy roast pig.

This place is amazing! The duck is a little boney, but the skin is extremely succulent and juicy! The chicken is also incredible, as is the pork. I highly recommend the large portion with duck, chicken, and pork. It comes with rice and a good sized portion of cabbage. Make sure to ask for the green sauce in the bucket; it's superb. For the price; 4 for a small and 6 for a large, the quality is unbeatable.

yummy char siu over rice! (roasted pork over rice) The meat is juicy and a bit greasy. It comes with a bit of veggies. It's cheap: only 4 usd for the small size, which is good enough for brunch. There is no space to seat in the store. Just get your order and have picnic in the park across the store.

I have always walked past Wah Fung on the way for bubble tea down the block, but I had never stopped there for anything. This past summer my cousin from out of the country visited and said he had never had chinese food, so I decided to bring him to Wah Fung for Duck. He thought it was so good!
The best ever place for roast meat. The chicken is my fav, but everything is delicious. Extremely affordable and tasty.
No comment
No comment

Been coming here for a few months now. Let's just say you get what you lay for. I order either the duck, chicken, or roast pork with rice. All three are $5 for a massive portion including rice and some braised cabbage. Its good. Its dirt cheap. Its filling. Its definitely not high quality. But it does the job. Kind of like a guilty pleasure. But don't come here expecting luxury. There's no seats. About 4 people can fit in the whole restaurant. You stand in like for about 10 min max. Its chaos. But you leave happy and still as rich or poor as you arrives.
No comment

Yea I guess still a 3, although things have changed. The line moves at a normal pace now. The portions of meat are not as generous, but you can get the pig by the pound, which I don't remember being a thing before. Things still taste quite good. Kind of a 3.5 round down situation overall but nothing wrong with this whatsoever.

The food here is consistently great and cheap! My go to is the duck with rice and the Chang fen with fish balls. Ah writing this is making me want the food. The man packs each lunch box to the brim with food so you definitely get your money's worth! The roast pork is delicious as well. You can get an amazing meal for about $5 or less! There is a long line always for the duck but I believe you can skip and just ask for Chang fen if you want? I haven't tried that but that's what my friend says.
No comment
I like their BBQ Ducks & rice. The menu is limited. Take out only but the food was good!
No comment

Cheap and delicious. We got a pound of char siu, which was perfectly sweet and juicy. We passed by around noon and the line was pretty long so we decided to come back after two hours. The line was still about the same but worth the wait.

Can't believe I have not made a review for this hidden gem! You get duck, roast pork, or chicken with rice and vegetables for around $5-$7! What a steal! The line can get pretty long during meal times so get here early and bring cash! The duck is my favorite, but the roast pork is also great. Great meal for post workouts!
No comment
No comment
Great food at a affordable price. Not alot of option but the choices are authentic and top notch. Expect a wait.

I love this place. It is hands down some of the best roast meats for your money in the area. I was turned onto the Roast Pig (which is different than the Roast Pork/Char Siu) by a friend and it is by far my favorite option there. It's all white meat... crispy, fatty, and full of flavor. It reminds me of really great southern barbecue thrown into a Chinese barbecue joint. All the right levels of crispy, salty, juicy, etc. My second favorite is probably the duck which is also super tasty along with the rice and cabbage they throw in.
No comment

Everything you've heard about this place is true. It is without a doubt the best deal in Manhattan for a meal that will fill you up and tastes awesome. You get rice or noodles, vegetables and a very generous Chinese BBQ pork for just $3.75!  That's not a misprint. It is insanely cheap, insanely filling and insanely delicious. It's kinda like David Blaine. I have no idea how they do it, I'm just glad that the do it and keep on doing it.
No comment
The Roast Pork Over Small Rice Special was amazing! $3.75 for lunch is such a great deal. I'm definitely coming back for more!

For all of the tourists who are fortunate enough to travel to Chinatown, you simply must visit this place. Wah Fung, simply put, is the HOLY GRAIL of Chinatown. I vividly remember the first time I tried Wah Fung's char siu combined with their sauce and I couldn't see my meal because I was crying so much. The roast pork was so damn juicy that I thought OPEC was going to ban this dish. Lord have mercy upon my soul, I forgot to breathe in between each bite. Forget your cholesterol levels, if you going to Wah Fung you here for a GOOD time not a long time.

Seriously I drive from New Jersey once a week just to get this. 7 bucks for 3 kinds of BBQ meat over rice + Holland Tunnel toll fees and 1-hr round trip, it's still better than most of Cantonese restaurant in NJ.
No comment

A great place for cheap eat! Their portion is huge and you cannot beat their price. The food was very flavorful and pumping hot. Their set rice with pork or roasted duck are very delicious. Whenever I visit this place I would buy extra meat for the entire week. Highly recommend if you only want take-out food and is looking for some high quality cheap eats.

After watching many stellar YouTube video reviews about this place, I finally decided that I must try it out being a foodie myself. Obviously, that created a very high expectation about their food. When I arrived on a Saturday afternoon, there was a short line of people waiting, but the line moved pretty quickly. I ordered a large size combo of char siu and roasted pork. After my first bite of the roasted pork, I found it very bland, but the skin was good though very crispy. After eating almost the entire meal, there was only one particular piece of roasted pork that was well seasoned, but the rest was very bland. Not sure if the chef did a lousy job seasoning the pig that day. The char siu was ok, I found it to be a little bit too sweet and was lacking the real char siu flavor. The only good thing is that this place gives bigger portion than other Chinese restaurants for the 2 combo. Overall, I was disappointed about the food. It was too much hype. There are definitely much better places out there in term of flavor and quality in Chinatown and Brooklyn Chinese areas.
Great prices and food ! Come early and get a bit of everything !!! Oh and it's cash only but there's atms all around the block !

Very good meal. I had duck and pork which was very good. It was inexpensive and only less than a five minute wait. I like the pork over the duck. The duck has too much bones in every bite but it was still very tasty. The pork was on point and would get again. Even though there no seating my friends and I went across the street to the park. Would go again.

It is one of the best Cha-Siu restaurant I found at NYC! Although it only offer take away service, but I still come here again and again! All the BBQ is great, especially the barbecue duck! And the chefs are very hospitality! The price is really reasonable:)
No comment

Prior to coming here for the first time, I have noticed the super long line made up of a diverse group of people. I think this is testament to Wah Fung's universally appetizing and reasonably priced dishes. Wah Fung has a small menu consisting of classic Chinese food like roast duck, chicken, BBQ pork, and roasted crispy pork over rice. The amount and quality of food is great for the price, no wonder there was always a long line of people outside.

This is probably my fifth time here but I haven't had any complaints. The process is simple. You get In line and pick either chicken or pork with the rice and cabbage. Even though the line appears long and daunting, it moves fairly quickly. We wanted these for our road trip back home from NYC. Nothing beats roast pork/ chicken +rice for $3.75. They also add the perfect amount of soy sauce for flavor--it's  really awesome. The food is packed in a small rectangular container-- looks can be deceiving because I couldn't finish it!
No comment

I've been eating their roast pork for 3+ years now. It is absolutely delicious and cheap. The only reason why I am docking a star is because they raised the price on their small plate while decreasing the amount of pork they pile on. They used to pile that sucker on to the point where a small could really be eaten as two small meals. Now it's just a normal one :( lol but I can't complain about a 4 dollar stunner like this one.

Affordable and delicious BBQ roast pork or chicken with rice and veggie and rice roll with fish balls. This shop have been around for years. Students and old timers love to come here for the $3.75 special of BBQ roast pork/chicken with rice and veggies. This is all day special. I just order the small box for lunch. The guy that works here is fast and efficient. He chops the BBQ roast pork and chicken so fast. I know his arm is strong but all the years of cutting may hurt his arm. The lines are long everyday. Yesterday when I went the line moved quickly. The owner hired another guy to help him with the orders. In the past it was the owner and wife. This place is still popular and affordable for everyone in chinatown. Good place to get comfort food. Been here a few times and will come back for the Mai fun. They ran out of it yesterday.
No comment

It's right there in the name, No 1 Fast Food. For $4.25, you can get a small bowl of rice with your choice of pork, chicken, duck, or roast pig. It's called a small bowl but the small is more than enough for most people. They have two different types of noodles, your standard lo mein noodles and thinner rice noodles. I still prefer the rice over any noodles, though. I go here at least once a week as I work nearby. It's a favorite of all my coworkers.
No comment
No comment

Literally the best. For 5 bucks you get a small container of rice, boiled cabbage and roast pork. It's cheap, hearty, and delicious. I would eat this everyday if I could. The pork is tender, fatty, and they don't skimp out on the sauce or slices of meat. They only make a few dishes, but boy do they make it well. I will definitely be back here if I'm back in town.

Paid a visit around rush hour on a Wednesday. There was a line but it moves fast. I got the bbq chicken with rice and cabbage for $5. The food is actually decent for the price. Was very flavorful and filling. I Would most likely return. I would like to try the other meats.
No comment
Their duck over rice is the best, and that's what I would get every time I'm getting a bbq meal in Chinatown.
No comment
No comment
Best duck and pork over rice in New York. There's no place where you can get better value and quality for 6.25!

The deliciousness is real! Had BBQ pork and a side of duck. Kinda tasted like someone's grandma made it. Grab and go for al fresco meal in the park. Nyc at its finest. Hope little neighborhood spots like this stick around forever.
No comment

Well it's about 15 minutes from my last post. This placed looked promising so stopped in, ordered duck and pork over rice before walking to park across the street. The pork was very tasty but was covered with too much sauce that over powered the rice and veggies. The duck, however, delivered in every category. Defiantly slow roasted for a while with basting during the process. I will come back when I make the trip back up from Texas. Can't beat the quantity and quality for $5.50

We bought a pound of char siew meat, and all the "meat" were thin, tiny strips of mostly hardened sauce. I'm willing to give them the benefit of the doubt -- maybe they ran out of meat -- but we were still sorely disappointed.
Some of the best roast pork I've ever had, truly amazing. The chicken is also good, but not sure it matches up in comparison.
Came for the pork, stayed for the cabbage and rice (and meat juices).
$3.75 for some tasty BBQ pork or chicken on rice with cabbage! Make sure you ask for ginger and green onion.
No comment

Really decent authentic Hong Kong cuisine, each dish is flavorful and unbeatable price point stands out among others. I truly recommend this restaurant and grateful to get to taste it with a short trip in New York.
No comment

It's super cheap. It's super good. A good box of food that 2 people (or 1 very hungry person) can probably get full on and it's $6. That's like poor college student heaven right there. I'd totally come back.
Most valube lunch I've had. Very tasty roasted pork and duck. And highly recommend roasted pig, crispy and juicy.
Good was not that great regular chinnesse food. I had the bb irk with fried rice. Next time I might check the roast pork aka chicharon

Tasty Cantonese roast meats and can't beat the value. The roast pork is delicious. I've seen Wah Fung mentioned in lots of places given its rise in popularity, but the one that really got me was Mike "Strictly Dumpling's" YouTube video from a few years ago. After seeing that video I knew I needed to get some Wah Fung asap. I love supporting Chinatown businesses and the delicious food at Wah Fung makes that easy to do.
Quick delicious affordable food! Come here and get the roast pork and rice dish! Huge portion of meat. They DONT skimp out on the protein. One of the best deals in the city.

Yes, I jumped in the line to experience the hype.  This was my 2nd time, the first was when my bf brought me a takeout of roast pig and charsiu to work and I knew it was not your average Chinese barbecue.  Went again on that weekend and stood over a half an hour with about 20 social media'd millennials in the cold just to walk away with 3 carnivore's containers of contentment.  It was fattier than my first time but delicious and satisfying nonetheless.  If I keep this habit up, I'll gain the equivalent in my consumed pork poundage.  You can by the pound or your choice of 1, 2 or 3 meats over rice.  The roast pig is very tendēr but maintains an amazing amount crispy skin.  The charsiu is sweet and savory all at once.  Have a plan on where to eat this lusciousness as there are no seats in this proverbial hole-in-the-wall greasy spoon.  The park across the street would be a good choice to sit and enjoy your meal but when it's only 20 degrees, you retreat to you car or subway.  It's worth the search for a place to devour your find.
No comment
No comment
The food here was not as flavorful, kinda dry. Maybe it was just my plate, but I can say that they give big portions which is great for hungry guests !
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

That was amazing! Order the roasted pork and bbq pork. Comes with rice and veggies. Two man working team, no where to sit or eat but u can find a way to bust it open and eat this. I think cash only. Line will move fast so don't get intimidated or discouraged! I believe u can ask for sauce if you need it!

The food here is simply perfect! There's really no other way to put it, it's just great. I highly recommend the roast duck or pork plate. The prices are also affordable and the plate will pack a punch, since everything is seasoned to perfection.

might be a little intimidating when looking in from the window but take a chance! can't get enough of it! best chicken and char siu ive ever had in the states. the meat is so juicy and tender. the sweet and savory sauce is oh-so amazing. support your local businesses today

The long line is worth the wait for decent priced roast pork rice or any other meats on rice. I would not say it is the cheapest but with all those idiots on YouTube that made videos of this place caused the prices to go up. But still it is decent price on good food that is good size. The roast pork are the best.

If you are craving for lots of meat and cheap price,  then this place is for you.  Their prices are a lot cheaper and meat a lot more than other places. The meat is fat and juicy and flavorful. Other places usually have thinner pieces of meat. There's no seating here but you can get this to go and eat it at the park across from it. My fave place to eat in this area.

Customer service isn't stellar. The staff seems cold and a bit impatient- but I guess it makes sense because they have to keep the line moving. I got the small bbq pork and my husband got the large mix of bbq pork and the crispy pork. After reading reviews, I wasn't as impressed as I thought I would be by the taste. It was good but nothing amazing. However, the portion is really good for the price so I had to give it a 4/5. I was a bit disappointed because I didn't receive any of the cabbage or "vegetable" that all the reviews mention and is listed on their menu. My friends and husband did get some cabbage in theirs, so not sure why they didn't give it to me, but I didn't notice until after we left. Also, I asked for the green sauce and saw some behind the counter but the staff claimed they ran out. Not sure if I will come back to this spot but if I'm in the area and want something quick and cheap maybe.

Honestly if I lived near Chinatown I would eat here every other day lol. It's so yummy and so cheap... what more could you ask for?? I came later in the day so they ran out of the pork. I was disappointed and got the chicken, which turned out amazing. I'll be back to try the pork. And then I'll be... back again. And again. And again!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Price is hard to beat. Less than 10 dollars I got a large roast pork rice and a roasted chicken leg. It was a ton of food and both the pork and chicken were very tender. There was a bit of a line even at 4 in the afternoon but it moves pretty quickly. My only complaint is that it was too much rice and not enough veggies, but that can easily be a positive for others! Rice was on the wetter side so I can see others thinking it too mushy, but you can ask them to not add the sauce on top of the rice.

A 15 minute wait is about average in the PM when I go. I've been coming here for years and usually just get a 1/2 Lb of the roast pork. They have a super $4 special with chicken or pork and noodle or rice and some cabbage. You can also get the proteins by weight. Usually roast duck, roast pork, or roast chicken.  Always good and once in a while fantastic. It's always luck of the draw. Sometimes you get a piece with the right fat content sometimes you don't. Get a drink at the corner deli and eat in the park across the street. Usually there is a Mister softee off the corner of the park and you can round off your meal for under 10 bucks including desert!

Best deal in Chinatown! This is definitely a cheap eats worth checking out. You get a small box of rice with roast pork or chicken and veggies for $3.75. How can you beat that?! You can substitute rice for noodles. The roast pork is really tasty and authentic. They also give you a heaping and generous portion worth your money. You can also get roast duck here. They have large rice boxes which are also quite a steal! A lot of times there may be a long line out the door, but if you don't mind waiting a little bit then you'll be in for a treat!

Theres nothing more to say than its super fast, super cheap, and very delicious. Im glad i randomly found this place from a suggestion on a youtube video. It was way better than i expected. When i first arrived there it was storming and the line was out the door, but the line went by very quickly. It really was fast food. Would definitely come back again.
This is potentially the best roast duck in Manhattan. Not very much meat, but cooked to perfection.
This place is absolutely fantastic! The best peanut noodles I've ever had - this place is way better then Vanessas dumpling house. This is the place you want to go too
No comment
No comment

Cheap and deep. Quick meals.  This wouldn't be my first spot to hit if I wanted char siu in Chinatown, however their secret sugar sauce over the roast pork, rice and side of veggies can't be beat. They pack the container to the brim. Usually a line but it moves, quickly. Father and son behind the counter serves 2 costumers simultaneously.
Wow! Stopped by for a small roast duck and pork meal. First time having duck and it was yummmeeee
Huge portions, great tasting food for a low price. Best place in New York. Hands down. It's a little hole in the wall that is cash only.

My favorite YouTuber Mike Chen led me this place and my life got better ever since! The charsu over rice is a must have and my favorite. Best for small bucks and taste not compromised. Everytime I am in Chinatown, I will make a detour to get a takeout.
The price can't be beat, but I thought the meats were just so-so.

Super cheap and good food. Not the best roast pork I ever had, but still pretty good. The line is pretty long during lunch time though. The large is $5.50 or $6 depending on whether you want one or two different meats. I had the pork and duck combo over rice and some cabbage, both of which where good but not great. It easily lasts two meals. I usually don't like cabbage but I actually enjoyed it this time.
AMAZING!! I absolutely love the food. It's a hole in the wall with great food. I never eat duck but only from here.
No comment

I went to Wah Fung expecting to get some Char Siu, and that is exactly what I got. For a very low price you get the BBQ pork belly over rice with some cabbage. $4.00 - $5.00 gets you a small lunch which is filling. The meat is tasty, very oily, and for the price cannot be beat. Are there better char siu out there, I most definitely believe so. But if you are looking to satisfy your cravings this is a great spot if you are in the area. There is no seating in the establishment and there is always a long line, but the line moves very quickly. Make sure to bring cash. I had read a lot and watch sole videos about the place, but I think it leaves more to be desired.
Best deal $3.75 small roast pork rice & napa cabbage. Perfect portions of rice, roast pork, veggies, and sauce. It's a fantastic meal at a fantastic price! To go only.
No comment

Can't express how much we love this place. You can get a nice meal with just $4.50 for a small Roast pork with cabbage over rice. The meat is always fresh & tasty. The portion is big.  You can also get 2-3 meats over rice aka Sam Bo Fan for a bit more $.  True hole in the wall. There are no seats. Lines are usually long but goes fast. On warm days, just bring it over to the park across the street and eat there.
Cheap eats! Its good but I've had better! Roasted duck over rice for $4.50 for a small, cant beat that! I stood in a 15 min line and by the time I ate the food, it was cold....
No comment

I watched a lot of youtube videos about this place. I made sure It was on my itinerary this time around. This place is small...I mean really small. Got there and line was out the door. Food is cheap! u can get a large combo with rice, veggie, and 3 different types of meat for $6! I was behind and gentleman and his wife who ordered a total of 12 combos each. It took forever. They had like only two workers. Finally my turn. I went for the $6 combo w/ veggie, duck, roasted bbq pork, and roasted pig (pork belly) over rice! It was HUGE!! No way i'm gonna finish it all. Glad I had 4 other ladies with me. Let me tell you guys that this was one of the best and simpliest food you will ever eat in your life. I was so full and satisfied and still have so much left over for my sis to kill.

Really delicious and quick place for roast duck and pig in NY Chinatown! Spending my childhood exploring Chinatown in SF, NYC's Chinatown definitely blew it out of the park with this little hole-in-the-wall eatery that was delicious and cheap. Brought my family from the SF Bay Area to try this place and they all agree that the food is amazing and great quality for the price (it did increase from what I've seen from previous reviews and pictures of the menu). The young man behind the counter is the same from years go and he's a real sweetheart. There's such a long line for lunchtime that the neighboring store's owner/manager was yelling at the poor owner of this eatery to move his customers waiting in line and blocking her store. The elder man who runs this place was so sweet and docile in trying to accommodate her (quite rudely loud) behavior.

Best bargain in Chinatown. Rice orders overstuffed to the max with your choice of roast pork, soy chicken, or roast duck. Always busy with lines so if there's 10 people on line it may be 30 minutes wait. Been a regular here for over 10 years.

Tasty and cheap! And not the kind of cheap that just passes but the kind that satisfies. The kind of cheap where you feel like you've won because it seems too tasty to be that price. Wah fung did not disappoint providing me with thinly sliced juicy meat over perfectly cooked rice for only $3.75. Would I return? Absolutely. Would I recommend? Definitely.

Obviously some kind of tourist trap for non chinese people. The quality of the meat is poor and the food is very greasy compared to the other stores that serve the same food a few blocks away. The only upside to eating is here is that its like a dollar cheaper. Not worth it in my opinion but I guess if you wanna save a dollar or two, eat here
No comment
Quick, yummy and cheap! Totally recomanded for a quick eat. Take away only. Has A rating but wish it was a bit more "shining"- tho will definitevely go again
No comment

Needlessly to say that this is the best Chinese food store where you can come in and buy a quick, tasty and valued food. Chinese BBQ pork which requires time and effort to make is so great here at Wah Fung.
Had the Duck and Chicken. It was delicious, def worth the small wait.  Heard about it on insider foods, it did not disappoint
No comment
Well there's not much to say really...it's No1 for a reason, it's simply the most delicious Char Siu I've had and the price is great! You won't be disappointed.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

So stoked I got to come here on my trip. Line moved fast, food was ready quickly, and it was a huge portion! Char siu was so moist as was the cabbage. Wish I got to try the other meats! Highly recommend to try out for lunch if you like Chinese BBQ!
No comment
No comment

5/5 quality and value. If I ever get to Chinatown I'll get two large orders, one for now and one for later. If you love chinese BBQ then this place ensures that you'll be satisfied in terms of taste and fullness. The long lines tell it all; get the roast duck or bbq pork, you won't be disappointed.

Fantastic. Not just for the value but the food is great. I had pork and chicken. The next time I will go with just the pork. It was so good. The portion size was huge...more than I could eat.  People were lined up out the door but the line goes quick.
No comment

$4 for a huge serving of tasty roast pork and rice? I would be here on the daily if I was a New Yorker. There was a short line out the door, which is apparently always the case, but the guys behind the counter are fast. Cash only. I suggest grabbing your drink from the tea place on the corner and finding a bench in the park across the street to bunker down and feast.
No comment

My cousin really wanted to eat here since everyone raves about it. For the price you definitely get a good portion. I couldnt even finish mine. I see why everyone loves it. Its juicy and very flavorful!
No comment

Simple yet delicious. To the point. Literally everything is great. The pork is perfectly cooked, the chicken is Bomb AF, and the duck is also pretty damn Delicious. I hate to admit that I'm obsessed with this crispy ass skin, it's kind of like a potato chip. I think it's the sweet Savory  crunchiness that kills me softly. The sauce that the meat comes dripping in turns that white rice into something like crack cocaine if I ever tried it. The cabbage is a perfect palate cleanser, to make you feel like you're eating healthy and stuff after shoving down mouthfuls of pork and rice. There's pretty much always a line but it moves super fast. don't expect top notch customer service, just get your food pay and go and eat the deliciousness. There's only like 3 menu items. In the words of my native New Yorker father, K.I.S.S ..keep it simple stupid

I can't wait to come back here! It's a hole in the wall with no seating but the food is incredible. My friend and I got here as it was about to close but we managed to snag the last large chicken and rice box. It was delicious. I can only imagine how amazing the pork and duck tastes!

One of the best roast pork dishes that you'll ever find in chinatown. This place is known to many as "the dirty man" place. But they say it's the dirty places that serve up the best food and this place lives up to that. Been coming here since 2006 when the price was $2 for a small box, and the quality has never deteriorated. Little bit of a wait, but definitely recommend!
Can you beat the prices here? $5 for a large cha siew fan and they pack so much in there even a fattie like me will be full. Tip: go on off-peak times as the line can be long. 5/5
No comment

My favorite place to get a quick bite! The pork is flames, the duck is flames, and it's so cheap it's almost unfair. My boy uncle shushu who works there is the man! Been there forever and still going strong. Make sure you tip my boy on your way out! Yuhearddddd
No comment
The best cha siu, Duck and crispy pork belly in all of ny. No seats, always a line, you order and go. Ridiculously cheap. La la la la love this place.

An A health rating in Chinatown for these places is rare, and they have it.  Ok, onto the food.  They make tasty roast everythings (pork, duck, and chicken), and my go to us almost always the pork.  They prices they have are more than reasonable, and if they started charging more, I don't think they would lose any business.  They almost always have a line, and it's worth it!
Got the roasted pork over small rice cause it is a great deal. I wish there's more fat in their roasted pork. But overall it was good.
No comment
No comment

I try to come here at least once every time I'm in town. The pork is juicy and unctuous. The portions are generous. And the price is unbeatable. I load up so I have extra for a couple days. Extra sauce on the rice please!

Yummy but oh so unhealthy. Lol The salt stays on your tongue for hours on end but do I go back time and time again, Heck Yeah!!! It's that dang pork that keeps me coming, that fatty juicy artery clogging delicious pork. And it's cheap but beware there's almost always a line.

Literally, THE best Chinese BBQ we have EVER had. We were visiting NY from AZ and came across a ton of recommendations for this place. We walked long and far to find it, stood in line for over 10 mins - out the door in 20° weather (cold for us Arizonans) and it did not disappoint! We got the BBQ pork and Roast duck combo, came with rice and steamed veggies for under $7. Definitely the cheapest meal of our entire trip and probably the best tasting meal as well. Me and my boyfriend shared this because we wanted to explore as many restaurants, dessert and drink shops as possible. There are no tables inside nor outside. It's literally a stop and take to go establishment. We walked to the park across the street and ate at the benches there...7pm at night, in the winter. With that being said, this was STILL our favorite meal of the trip! We went back the next day before our flight because we couldn't get enough but they were closed!  oh well, just a hop and a skip away from our hotel in midtown. We got to explore China town one last time. Skip all the other bbq places and JUST come here!

10/10 would come back. Platters come with meat, rice, and cabbage. Super simple. I got the combo of all 3 (duck, bbq pork, and chicken) and thought the bbq pork was the best. It just had more flavor than the others, but the duck and chicken were still good. Rice was super flavorful because they add some sauce on it. Cabbage was really amazing too. A little bit of wait, but line moves quick. Huge portion for a really cheap price. Cash only.
No comment

Best place to get cha siu. My boyfriend loves it and I had it for the first time and it was so good. Quick service and tons of flavorful meat. It's also very cheap, I only paid $4 for the the box with tons of meat, rice, and veggies. There is no seating but it is beside a big park where my boyfriend and I enjoyed our meal.
No comment
BEST CHAR SIU!! We travel to NYC every year and this is always on our top list to eat. It's cheap and delicious.

I found no other deli stores like this one where you would be surprised at how much value you could find out of their 6$ box - juicy tasty barbecue meat, rice and steamed cabbage. If you put these things on a proper plate and serve it at a restaurant,  it should be at least 12$. I wouldn't say it's as good as what you can get at a top Chinese restaurant, but the point is that you can spend less than 10$ for an amazing meal.
No comment
No comment
They offer good portion and quality of food with more than reasonable price. I ordered a small roast pork rice with only 3.75 bucks.
No comment
I love the place! The roast pig is everything! The duck is so good! Always a line! The prices are less then 5.00 dollars!  Going tomorrow because it is closed on Monday!
$6 for a large portion of roast pork (the juiciest you'll ever have in your life), cabbage, and white rice. You seriously can't complain.

I hate to be the person to say I was underwhelmed but.... I was. Maybe because I walked so far from the train station just to get something I could've gotten similarly in my own neighborhood (East Harlem). Surely it's cheap, convenient and filling but I envisioned something else; something more. Every bite of the chicken had bones in it. Also, I asked for hot sauce - and it wasn't spicy. I just couldn't understand the rave over Wah Fung. Sorry guys.
No comment
Fooking beautiful mate. I've been eating roast port for over 20 years of my life and this, this is one of the best yet.

Cheap and delicious charsiu ! I was skeptical at first and thought this was just another overhyped joint in nyc but nah it lives up to its reputation. I'm looking forward to coming back and doing a combo w duck and pig!
No comment
No comment
Delicious pork and duck for a great price. The small serving is big enough for one meal.
Very simple and very delicious. Best $4 you could spend in NYC. The roast pork over rice is to die for. The pork is juicy, tender, and so flavorful. Adding to my list of must haves here in New York.
Got the small pork and rice for 4 bucks flat, I was satisfied with portion and tasted decent.
Delicious. For 6$ you get a big big meal. A lot of meat, but the line is long and the resturant is small.

What is there to really say here that hasn't been said 300 times already? The value here cannot be beat. For $5.50 I went with the duck and roast pork, and you get easily a pound of rice, cabbage, a quarter of a duck, and two large pieces of the pork. The duck was good, but the pork was surely the star here. I went early, around 11:30, and there was no line at all. This is on my list and I will be back.
No comment
No comment

Always a line, even in 20 degree weather. Anything less than 5 stars is an insult to all new Yorkers. It's very different than your typical chinese place with pork. They use 2 types of sauces, their pork is from heaven, their bok choy is delicious. Their prices are amazing.
BEST FOOD EVER. Thats all. I dare someone to find me something so delicious for such a low price. I take on all challengers.
No comment

This place is amazing, and cheap!   The roast pork and duck were cooked perfectly and came with cabbage and rice.  It's a really small take out joint, so no seats inside.  You will likely have to wait in line for at least 15 minutes but its well worth it.
No comment
No comment

Working in Soho, it was hard to find a decent priced place for lunch that wasn't fast food until I was introduced to this gem! This place is absolutely amazing and worth both the 15 minute walk and the 15 to 25 minute wait! Don't worry about not being able to find this place, there will be a noticeable line outside the door. The taste and price is unbeatable. For $3.75 you can get a small, but filling, order of roasted pork or chicken over rice and cabbage. Pork or Chicken, the meat is tender, juicy and roasted to perfection. Don't let the "hole in the wall" appearance fool you. With an "A" rating and 4.5 stars on Yelp, this place is a must-try for foodies looking for a steal.

This may be the single best value for food in the city. The large roast pork/duck combo comes with enough meat for two meals. I like that they even put in a bit of veggies so I didn't feel like a total pig. I try to come during odd hours so I can skip the line. Here's to hoping the place never changes!
Super cheap food, you get what you pay for. The roast pork was a little dry but I definitely ate it. Wish they had a sweet sauce for it.
yes brother -- "pig" and "pork" mean different things here. get both. also duck. it's all gooe

Walking through Chinatown this place stood out to me because of the huge line that forms. We were walking toward the subway as the snow storm came down and surprisingly this place still had a line. The food is super cheap! Everytime I come here I have to get the roast pork and lo mein noodles. I love the noodles because they're the fatter type of noodles and the roast pork. The small box for one meat and one side is 4.99 and the bigger box is 6.99. Even after waiting an hour to get back to our hotel the roast pork was still so moist and the flavors were still there. If you work near Chinatown and is ale to go here for lunch i'm super jealous of you right now..
No comment
No comment
No comment

My office is on this block and I go here once a month. Cannot beat the prices or the amazing food! Sometimes there's a bit of a wait, but boy is it worth it!!! Get the combo and the large size. Cash only, but there are several ATMs nearby as its Chinatown. Do not pass this place up!

One of the good char siu places in Chinatown.  For four bucks, you could get a filling packed box filled with lots of rice, your one choice of siu mei (Cantonese roasted meats) and some boiled napa cabbage.  For 50 cents more, you could get a combination of two meats in the same container.  The quality of the char siu was great, with tender meat and a very good fat-meat ratio while being crispy in some spots.  Part of the reason is that it gets soaked up in the juices compared to other places.  You cannot really screw up some boiled napa cabbage, but it was good.  But for the rice, it was kinda mushy and needed less water to enjoy the rice flavored with pork juice.  This is a take out place; no seating within establishment but you just could eat it in the park.  Be sure if you don't speak any Chinese, be sure to bring somebody who understands it.  Cheap, filling char siu fan (barbecued pork {over} rice) in Chinatown.
No comment
Cheap, decent bbq meats.   Not the best, but not the worst either.  The large order consists of 2 meat choices plus a side of rice and some sauteed cabbage for $6.

One of the best joints in Chinatown for delicious pork, duck, and chicken on the go. Although there are usually long lines, it is definitely worth the wait! The portions are big for what you pay for and the meats are flavorful.  I'd say the roast pork over rice is the best if you had to choose just one meat.  Also be aware that it is cash only and there is no place to sit inside.
No comment

Decided to check this place out with some friends after seeing it on the Insider. There was a line when we arrived, but we waited around 15 minutes max. We got our food pretty much right after ordering. My friends and I got a large roast duck and pork belly ($6.50) Both came with cabbage, white rice and a few spoonfuls of their respective juices (yum). The pork belly was my favorite out of the two.The skin was super crispy! It was slightly too salty but the white rice and cabbage helped offset it. My friend said he was going to go back and get just the pork belly ($9). The roast duck was okay, each bite I had mainly consisted of bones with little meat so I was disappointed about that since my friends had raved about it before. I'll definitely come back to try the char siu and give the roasted duck another chance. All in all, worth the price and wait! Remember to bring cash though if you visit.

Probably some of the best roast pork you can get for the price. This place provides a generous serving of delicious pork for less than $5. I come here regularly when I'm in the area and will sometimes make a trip out from Queens for it if I'm really craving it. There's plenty of Chinese BBQ places near me but I'm more than happy to make the trip out. I've yet to come early enough to get noodles instead of rice but I believe that speaks volumes about the store. Everything is being sold almost immediately after it's done, so food is always fresh and hot. I've tried the other meats and they're good but their standout is the roast pork.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This has to be the best spot for excellent food and for a good price. The line was a little long when I went but well worth the wait. And you have to put some ginger on the side (gives your food extra flavor)

Best Chinese bbq I have ever eaten hands down. I've been to New York many times and little did I know I had been missing out on this gem. You get so much juicy pork on a bed of aromatic jasmine rice and cabbage for just FOUR DOLLARS. Add another meat or make it a bigger portion of just pork for a couple dollars more. I always tell people that Chinese food isn't  one of my favorites ( I know, I know), but damn, this m*****f***** changed my mind.
No comment

The rice is so flavorful as they really take the time to pour the sauce over BBQ. Their roasted pork is so famous and I found at least 4 ppl are eating the same food with me in the park opposite the restaurant. I went there around 230 and there is still a line of 4 or 5 ppl ahead of me. The service is on the slow side I have to say. The crispy pork is my favorite and I find the duck mediocre.
No comment
No comment
Hands down my favorite take out in NYC, out of all the places ive been this place has been consistently delicious throughout the years

The line for this place is always long, but the price is worth it. Might be the best deal regarding Cantonese BBQ dishes in Chinatown. They tend to run out of noodles near the end of the day, but it's okay since I've never seen them run out of rice. The portions are very generous too. A $5 meal here can feed me for days.

It's an insane deal. $3.75 for a small and $5 for the large. Do yourself a favor and get the big size. It's gigantic, but you'll be full for days. Lots of meat, rice and stewed cabbage is all piled up in a to go container; a delicious, well rounded meal. You can chose between the barbecue roast pork or duck. My friends got the pork and it was perfectly tender and succulent, with the right amount of fat to meat ratio, but by no means is it what you would consider a healthy dish. The sauce they pour over it is really good and covers most of the rice at the bottom. It soaks into the rice and makes every last bite flavorful. It was totally worth the hype and we only waited in line for about 10 minutes.  It's a quick in and out getting the food. The staff is very friendly and they even recognized my friend who used to be a regular a couple years ago. Definitely make your way over if you're in the area and enjoy an awesome, cheap and filling meal!
Beware of the chopping block they use. I found bits of the block littered all over my food. So disappointed.

This place has probably one of the best value to taste/portion ratios on the planet. The food here is very cheap, $4-5 dollars can simply get you a rice meal with some BBQ pork. The food is extremely good and they have this amazing sauce that they put on all their meats. Lines may be longer than average, but not extremely long. Basically, the wait is worth the food. Not to mention, the place is located near a park which is one of the best places to eat after you order from there. All in all, very good value and very good taste.
No comment

This place right here is why I use yelp. If it yelp did not exist I would never have found this place in a sea of Chinese restaurants. I am just beyond happy with the quality of the food, and will be returning for more 100%. This place is known for its char siu, and that's what I got on my visit here. Hands down this was the best char siu I've ever eaten, it was packed with flavor. It came with white rice, cabbage, and some sauce spooned over them. The portion was nice and filling, and everything is cheap. The line while quite long moved fast, 15 to 20ish minutes  and I had my meal. I look forward to trying out their other offerings.
Quick and easy. make sure to get the ginger scallion sauce.
Meal is super filling for only 5$ you get massive amount of cha Siew (roast pork and rice) if you're hungry and can't spend much THIS is the place to go!!

I went in to this shop blind and had no idea what to expect. The shop is pretty small with a small, but straighforward menu. The shop has an atmosphere that of a butcher shop, which is pretty appealing. Though the shop is small, the line gets long fast. When asking my friends their recommendations it was a consensus to get the roast pork. I got the small with rice and we went to the park across the street to enjoy it. The pork was cooked perfectly and flavor fantastic. The rice was the perfect warmth and moisture for the weather. This place will not disappoint.
No comment
No comment
Very tasty, really cheap Chinese food. They cut the slab of pig in front of you. The only down side is that it's pretty greasy.
You can't get better value for the food here...unfortunately the duck was WAY too sweet and I didn't have any. I don't think they do plain duck, chicken, or pork, its all soaked in sugar and soy.

Can't remember the price but it was pretty cheap...generous amount of food...thanks to Strictly Dumpling's YouTube video~ great recommendation~ store is very small...u walk in n order then pay then leave...no room for u to linger around...more like a takeout place.

I've been a big fan of wag fung's small char siu over rice for the longest time ever since i heard about them. Their small char siu over rice is under $5 which is a steal because its one of NYC's cheapest char siu over rice. This is one of NYC's best cheap eats in NYC. They are truly the champions of char siu.
No comment
This place has really great food! Very affordable and delicious at the same time! Recommanded for a fast and easy meal.
it's cheap & it is nothing special. I used fatty pork at $5. maybe lean or 50/50 is better. ? idk

Came to Wah Fung at 11 am on a Saturday and thankfully there was only a short line. It's take out only, but fear not cause there's park across the street where can sit and savor Wah Fung. For the price, quality, quantity of the food, this place deserves a five star. I gave it a four cause I've had better roast pork back home in Indonesia. The roast chicken was an absolute delight. I wish I could try the roast duck cause I heard good things about it. CASH only!!!
No comment

Very affordable and very good Cantonese meats! Their $4 cha siu rice plate makes for a great meal to go, won't break the bank and is bursting with flavor. For a little extra, you can add roast duck or size up to a large!
Great quick bite. Awesome pricing. Food isn't overly sweet nor salty. Highly recommend it!
This place was absolutely disappointing although the cuts of meat were okay most of the cuts are fatty.  if you're not Asian don't come here!.
No comment

Quick, cheap, delicious. Got the roasted duck combo with rice and vegetables (cabbage). The duck was super fresh and extra juicy. Portions were big enough for 2 or one hungry soul. That sauce over the rice was so good! Can be a little wait sometimes but would definitely recommend!

Excellent place for a quick, cheap but great bite- trust EVERYONE who writes great things about this place. On a trip to New York, I decided to try out some chinese food, and Wah Fung stood out for its price and the amount of positive reviews. The small dish of BBQ pork and duck was enough to fill me for lunch, but for a bit over a dollar more, you can get the large. I wish we had a place like this at home!

This hole-in-the-wall Chinese bbq joint is extremely good. It is five star food for sure. Don't go here expecting a fine dining experience. You may also have to ignore the appearance and turn a blind eye to the cleanliness. If you can get past that, then you're in for a treat. I recommend trying the small roast pork over rice, if you want to give this place a try. It is $3.75 and it is enough food for two people, easily. Hands down, the best Chinese rice bowl I have ever had. I will definitely make a special trip to the Chinatown area the next time I am in NYC just to have a rice bowl from Wah Fung. It really is "No. 1"!!!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is definitely a good cheap eats. It is hit or miss on the amount of food that is packed into the box. The first couple of times, the box was over packed and the roast duck and roast pork was not fatty. The last time we went, the roast pork was mostly fat and the roast duck was very small pieces with lots of bones and  not very meaty. It is still a good place to get a cheap meal.
Great lunch deal with $5 for a great small plate of pork & rice. Also the cabbage was a great cleanser to the strong pork! But overall would totally recommend!!
No comment
Roasted chicken, roasted duck and roasted pig over rice in a huge portion for only $6!! Delicious!!

One of the best deals in the city. A small portion (with a generous helping of meat) is less than $5. Comes with a little cabbage, but the BBQ meats are the star of the show. Chinese fast food at its best, usually a line out the door, but moves quickly as the workers are adept at getting orders out quickly, efficiently. They ladle some sauce (drippings in soy sauce) over the rice for extra flavor. Delicious despite the cheap prices. Roast pig and roast pork are my favorites, but the duck and chicken are excellent as well, but you will have to pick through bones in the latter two. For the hungry man, the large portion is $6.50. Cash Only.

After a long time, I finally went and tried this! this is great. Enough for two people with the $5/$5.50 lunchbox. Some of the meat is fatty, but it still tastes great!!!!! The man who chops up the meat's been doing it for a LONGGGGGG time now so i give him much props for consistently churning out great food for thrifty college students and people alike!

Cheap, great tasting, Chinese bbq. Always generous with the meat and always tipping the guy. Pork is sweeter and fattier than big wong. He somehow smashes the same amount (maybe even a little more) pork into the tiny tin container. He also tops with veggies and juices from the meat. Every portion is crafted with care and he includes pieces of fat, burnt ends, and sauce. It's a humble establishment, but there is often a line out the door.
No comment

Deserves a MICHELIN STAR!!! Cheap, delicous, and the wet sauce is the boss. It's wet sauce because typically char siu is dry and then soy poured on top...also the food makes me wet down there. Best bang for your buck not just in ctown, not just in NYC , but probably this hemisphere. Their containers also bust open because it can't contain the meat. #meatsplosions.
My go-to spot whenever I'm in Chinatown. Easily. For $4 you can get rice, cabbage and pork / chicken. It's really a great deal if you want a meal and you're in a pinch downtown.
No comment
No comment
The roast pork is worth the wait.  It is sweet, savory, and salty.  It would hit every part of your pallet!

One of my goto place for Cantonese roast meat over rice. The meat, rice and the cabbage side dishes are all simply right and perfect. It's super cheap but the place closes soooo early!!! At 7 pm. I wish it can extend hours so I can pickup dinner here more often
No comment

Cheap and tasty food. It's a nice place for some hearty roasted meats with great sauce and veggies. Delicious and good portion sizes. However, beware that the lines are very long and slow. Worth stopping by!
So worth it for the price. Char siu + duck or char siu + chicken... Such a good combo! If you arrive before they close they might run out of duck. I like that it comes with some veggies. Cash only

Fire! Absolute gem of NYC. For under $5 you get a solid portion of rice, veggies and roast pork. The pork is delicious, succulent and juicy. I go here every time I am in Chinatown. Grab a small roast pork and head to the park to eat it.

This place is sooo bomb! Small, cheap, cash and takeout only but the food is A DREAM. It's flavorful and reminds me of the food my grandma cooks. One small portion is $4 with roasted choice of meat (duck, chicken, pork), rice and vegetables. I had roasted duck, which I think it's the best. Hands down perfect for students on a budget like me. You gotta see how the food is made too. The place is located in Chinatown near small stalls and markets so I feel really immersed in the experience--like coming back to Hanoi my hometown again xo

Love this place! There is always a line but totally worth the wait! The roast pork and roast drumstick are delicious and with extra sauce on top. I usually get it by pound for dinner since it is cheap! This is definitely my favorite out of all the places I have tried.

Had the roast pork, roast pig (there is a difference) and the duck. Ate all of it!! Need to go back for more. It was the right amount of salty, sweet, crispy, soft, just perfect. Duck was my favorite. Best pork belly I've ever had.

We arrived in the city and our first stop was here based on simply dumplings video on YouTube.  I couldn't agree more with his review. For under ten bucks, my son and I shared a large with roast pork and duck, rice and veg. The meat was succulent. Every bite was delicious and the duck skin was marvelous. Even though it was a fine amount for two people, next time we will have to get separate plates so we don't fight over the last bites.
No comment
Loved it! Best $4 ever spent. Went on a Sunday afternoon and only waited 10min! Comes in larger size for $5.50 too
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is seriously the best place for "Chinese BBQ," aka roast duck, roast pig, BBQ roast pork, and roast chicken in New York. The amount of food you get for the price is phenomenal. Not to mention the food is always delicious. It's no wonder the line is always out the door. Despite the long queue, the lone moves fairly quickly. I highly recommend if you're in Chinatown and want cheap delicious food.
Food was good and great price. Not a lot of difference from any other restaurant that offer this type of food. Still nice to have tried it.
Absolutely delicious and cheap! My favorite restaurant in Chinatown for sure. There's usually a line but expected considered how good this place is. Highly recommended!

I grew up in Singapore and can say, with some authority, that this is the best char siu pork over rice I have found in the city. (And I've been looking.) You don't need to take my word for it though: there's almost always a line literally out the door. And it's cheap too! GO HERE!
Incredible!  So tasty and flavorful.  Was shocked how inexpensive this place is considering the quality.
Solid, fast, surprisingly inexpensive given the Yelp hype. Would come again.
I like the roast pork over noodles ($4.50). It's pretty good.

Since I work right across the street from this restaurant, I decided to give this place a try. They have limited meat options, which are roasted pork, roasted duck and chicken. The basic meal option includes one of the three meat options and either rice and vegetables or noodles. The best part of this restaurant is that this basic meal is only $3.75 (tax included), and while it looks small, it's actually big enough to get full with. Downside? It's cash only and there's no table or chair - it's all take out. The quality of meal is good compared to its price.
No comment
No comment
The red sauce pork is the absolute best! I took my friend here for lunch, because the first time was awesome. He enjoyed it as much I did. The prices are reasonable as well. Will be coming back!
I am fall in love with this place. The best roast duck. The best lunch place to get roast pork and rice as well. Lines can be a little long because it's so good but it goes by pretty quickly.

Looking for something CHEAP and DELICIOUS? Please come here. It's only $3.75 for a small container of rice, vegetables and your choice of roasted meat (chicken, duck, cha siu pork, roasted pork). You can also get a large container for $5.50! I have been here a few times, most recently this afternoon. The line is usually long, and you should try to come early in the day as they may sell out of the meat you're craving if you come too late. I only ate half of the small container, so you can bet your booties you can get by with only buying the small for a meal! Now that's cheap! My favorite meat is the cha siu followed by the chicken. I love duck but the duck here wasn't that great the last time I got it, lots of bones.
No comment

This is a family owned Cantonese restaurant known for its  roast pork  roast duck and roast chicken with rice and mixed vegetables. it costs $6 and the name is called " sam bo fang". sanitation wise, the workers here do not use gloves while chopping your meats but that's common in most restaurant as this has an opened kitchen. this is also cash only so don't come here with a credit card. i would come back if i want to be guaranteed to be full for less than $7. u really can't do it here in new york with the expensive restaurant in the midtown and uptown area. i never had a problem with the food, and i think this is def a better deal than chiptole or the pizza parlor right next to this restaurant. u can bring your food to the "old people's" park and eat there while watching old chinese man toothpicked their teeth and swinging on the exercise machines. watch out for pigeons as they are plentiful and may drop a deuce or two onto your food. i remember trying to close the carryout box a couple time from the flying pigeons over my head.

Im giving this restaurant a three because although the food was seasoned well (i ordered the roast chicken special with cabbage and Rice)  and was very juicy - the food gave me a nasty case of food poisoning and i had a terrible stomach on account of the food poisoning for 2 days after . I wont go into the details of my toilet excursions but it was not pleasant . Let me repeat there is nothing wrong with the taste of the food (if you like five spice powder this is your place) but its how they store there meats is what im concerned about .
No comment
No comment

Came here because of all the hype from youtube... and it was good for its price but it wasnt all that. Its a grab and go. There are benches on the park across where you can eat your food if you're a tourist. Theres some homeless people and some of the benches smells like pee.. I guess thats what I get for watching too much youtube. Lol
Hey don't take debit in 2017. Huge inconvenience. Small stores in Williamsburg take debit Why doesn't this place? I wanted to like this place and eat here.

For what it is, this place deserves 5 stars. Don't go expecting full table service and a place to sit. It says it all in the name - "No. 1 Fast Food." My friend and I came around 11:30 AM and waited for about 5 minutes or so. We both got the small $3.75 char siu rice bowl and carried them back home with us. We arrived at home about an hour later and the bowl was still warm.  The bowl was packed full of white rice, steamed cabbage, thinly sliced char siu, and drizzled with sauce. It was one of the most comforting things that I have eaten in a while. The pork had a nice balance of sweet and savory with the right amount of fat. The drizzle of sauce was just a perfect way to tie out the dish as it seeps into the rice and flavors it. I will definitely be back! Next time, I may get a larger size with multiple meats and save it for a few meals ;)
Boring food. No quality control. Nobody cares to reply to you because the television is more important in a restaurant over business.

I was probably way too hyped to try this place from all the great reviews but I honestly thought their meats tasted just like any other Chinese restaurant's. I got the roast pork, duck, and pig rice box priced at $6.50 - pretty standard price. I definitely do think their $4 small rice box with roast pork is very worth it just from the pictures I see. I came on a weekday around 1:30pm and there was a line with over 10 people in front of me but the wait was only about 7 minutes.

This place is amazing. You can't beat the $3.75 roast pork or chicken over rice deal. The food is always fresh and the line which goes out the door moves quickly. This place has become a regular go-to spot for locals. The duck is also your typical good Chinatown Peking duck.

Stopped by here on my way out of NYC to grab some to-go food for my trainride back to Boston. Even after 45 minutes of sitting in the packaging before I dug into it, I can say ... it truly was as amazing as everyone says. They were sadly out of noodles by the time I got there at 6 pm so I got rice with combo pork/duck and cabbage. The pork was outstanding.. amazing crispy bits, and OMG the sauce they pour over it all meshes with the rice and creates perfect combo of sweet and savory and fatty goodness. Next time I'd skip the duck and just get all pork (I think I've decided I'm just personally not a duck person -- I bet theirs is considered really good). Will definitely be back here next time I'm in town!

Nothing to say about this place that hasnt been said before. Cheapest good quality food around. I always get the duck over rice, but the roasted pork is always a good choice as well. The staff there are OGs and dont care if u dont like their attitude so tell them what you want, pay, and get out lol if you linger they'll probably tell you to leave anyways.
No comment
Good food for a good price. The portion sizes are generous if you get a Large.  I love the pork.

The food is good but for the price, I pushed it to 4 stars. The yur dan cheurn feng is not as good as the small hole in the wall in flushing. The rice dishes are delicious though. $5 for dinner... can't beat that

Oh my goodness! This place is one of my favorite fast food places! The lines are usually long and the place is tiny but the flavor and food is not! It's a must-have when you're in the area. All of the items were delicious but my favorite is the BBQ pork...my mouth is watering just thinking about it now! I can't wait to go back to NY just to have this again! This place is cash only but you only need 3.75$ for a platter which comes with rice and a side. There's no place to eat but it's just across the street from a park that has a limited number of benches and tables that you can eat at. Definitely a place to try!

Gosh this food was great, and it was super cheap. Being from Texas I get a lot of conventional Chinese food but this is the real deal. It's very authentic and it taste amazing. I got the pork and duck for 5.50$. The pork was tender but it had a super crispy layer on top and the duck was perfect. I am going to remember this place for the rest of my life.

First time here, I got the 3 meat over rice.  With the understanding that roast pork should be eaten with fatty portion, but I found their roast pork to be too "tendony" (too chewy, not editable fat/tendon) for my taste, didn't get that tenderness that I expected.  The Chicken had real good taste as well as the roast pig, wished I had gotten more of the crispy skin from the pig.  Though I didn't get duck, from the person before me, it looked pretty good.  The gem is the rice that became infused with the sauce from the meat and the added sauce they put on.  Service was fast even with a line at 3:30pm on a weekday.  All said, it didn't meet my expectation, maybe due to the over hype.  But there was enough "taste" that I plan to come back for a second try.  Will post a update when that happens.
It does not open on Monday!! Read bunch of reviews before I went but nobody mentioned this. I didn't even realize I passed by the store. Then I walked back and found it was closed...
No comment
No comment

Best of the best Chinatown has to offer. Meat was juicy the owner is super cool, trust me he will hook you up the amount of the meat you get on your plate is enough for two people. Just make sure you are aware there will be an line waiting outside, this is the spot for chinese BBQ

I'm so hooked on the BBQ meats from this fast food restaurant. Oh well, it is more of a take-out. Even though it is advertised as a fast food restaurant, it is not what you think - the meats are roasted carefully and they are in the ready to serve status if you will. The store front is very small and you'd walk pass through it without even noticing. But hey you can't, you know why, because there is always a line. After this place was featured by several vloggers, it is getting even more popular, with tourists all over the world even. The other weekend when I was in line waiting for my perfect chicken, duck and pork combo, I overheard a group of tourists asking a lady behind me about the food. Unfortunately they asked the wrong person, or maybe the lady behind me did not want to deal with these tourists, she replied nothing special, just for a quick bite. No, she was 100% incorrect and ironically she stood in line for her meal after turning away the group of tourists. I feel so bad for the misinformed tourists. They completely missed a perfect opportunity to experience Chinatown and a tasty meal which are not available in typical Chinese take-outs in the states. Alright, let me speak about the meats. I'm sure by now you've probably heard that is one of the best place to get charsiu AKA Chinese roasted pork in NYC. But what most people don't know yet is their chicken is equally as amazing or even better. I found charsiu can be a little over sweet but the chicken is cooked perfectly. The juicy and tender dark meats are infused with cooking wine and soy sauce. And the crunchy skin gives extra chews and adds up more flavor. The stewed cabbages are quite delicious too.  It is so simple but adds so much freshness and balance to the meal. I'd be very satisfied with a small combo meal and if you are really hungry, a large combo will definitely fill up your stomach with only 7 bucks.
No comment
No comment
Finally got to try the char siu and Roast Pig! The char siu was good but i like the roast pig better becuz of the crispy skin! Its delish!

So as it stands this place is really popular. I've been working in Chinatown for some months now and every time i walk past this place there is a long line out the door. The place is really small so that's probably partly to blame, but after finally going in here to order something i realize that that the delicious food is also to blame. Less than $4 gets you a small container super packed with either rice and pork or noodles and pork. And i mean super packed. Honestly it's really impressive to see how much food they can actually fit in that thing, but it's a lot. And it's really tasty too. Like really. I managed to get lunch early one day so i got in there and beat the line and I'm glad i did. I thought this area would have a lot more cheap food options than it does, so finding this place was a real life and money saver. Yum!

heard so much about this place, absolutely had to try it once I got to chinatown. its def a dive, in a small location with barely enough room for a line.  But you get a ton of food for cheap! I believe I got the 3 meat combo, with cabbage and rice for 6 bucks.  in atlanta that meal would easily run 15 dollars.  Prob the best chinese bbq I've had.
No comment

Came here b/c of the hype and raving reviews from my friends and I must say that I was happily satisfied and my expectations were met! I shared a small roasted pork over rice with my mom and we were both pretty full after. There's no seating in the shop but there's a park across the street where you can enjoy your food while people watching. I'll definitely be back!

Ok I understand why people like this place. It is cheap and serve tasty roast pork. If you ask me this isn't the best roast pork. It was skinnier than others I have seen and chewier. I love their sauce, but hate how skinny the pork is. I believe it all comes down to preferences because i love my roast pork thicker cut, but this place has a better marinate than most roast pork I had. I had too many to know which is good or not.

My all time favor when don't know what to eat for lunch or dinner with low price but make you super full. This place looks small and.... crappy but you can't miss it if you are passing by Chinatown. it's the best roast pork in china town with reasonable price

Amazing takeout place for Chinese Delicacies! A Chinese friend told me about this place and I have never been disappointed on multiple return visits. The price cannot be beat here! Cheap cheap cheap! But tasty! I recommend the roast pork on rice.
in the short time I've lived here I already notice a decline in how much meat they give...and a raise in prices. I blame all those damn vids
No comment
No comment

Cheap, delicious Chinese BBQ. Not much else to say. I only need a small size because the large is so much food. You could probably stretch 2 meals out of the large, and it's only about $1 more. Quality of the BBQ is pretty solid, but the value is amazing.
Where else in this world can you get the triple combo - roast duck, BBQ pork, and roast chicken with Napa cabbage and lots of rice, all for $6.00?! Just look at my pix!

Easily the best value in Chinatown.  Agree with all the top reviews here that it's mind-boggling how much food you get for just $3.75.  I'm partial to char siu, but everything on the menu is good.  I try my best to get there right at 12 if not a little earlier because the line quickly gets out of control.
No comment
No comment

Every time I walked by this place, there was always a line, and one that appeared to be a slow moving one. It looked worth trying, but I was never sure about the wait. Christmas presented a good time to reevaluate, given the lack of other places open, and as it turned out, there were no other customers, so we could take our time deciding what we wanted to eat. As it turns out, it was really simple: a half a roast duck ($8) and a pound of roast pork ($9). The pork was tasty, especially given the price, and buying by the pound like that made it easy to cook some food at home and have it together. Cheap, friendly, tasty, and with a simple, straight forward menu. If you think you'll like what they have here, then you probably will.
All things considered (taste, portion size, price, etc), this is very likey my favorite meal in all of NYC. Well done Wah Fung. Well done!
No comment

Being an Asian man I am, I god damn love cheap and delicious food and this place is cheap and delicious. Authentic Cantonese style hole in the wall type store so don't expect a store that you sit and eat inside. The roast pork and duck god damn... Delicious and cheap (both over rice for 5.50) and the portion is big. Traditional Cantonese style service (you get your food and you leave) no customer service rating.
You can get a $6 footlong, or a jam packed container of glorious meat and rice, brought together with the gravy of the gods

THE BEST ROAST PORK in the city hands down. All others can fight for second place. But with that being said ... the cabbage they include with the dish is like if Vomte could be involved in a fight crime and yell racist words at a steaming 160F* that would be the veg they include. awful. but All in all the rice was perfection the Pork was devine and the Duck was beautiful and golden and crispy and juicy. Side note i got the younger guy and he is alittle skimpy on the meat but none the less IT WAS GREAT still good size meat portion for 6 bucks. Simple, tasty, low cost, real ingredients EASY 5 star.

This is like halal guys but for Chinese food. It is so good and so cheap!! Huge helping of your choice of meat and rice and a little side of vegetables. Yes it is oily and probably not the most healthy but it's the perfect comfort food and so cheap! Cash only as expected. Hole in the wall so pretty easy to miss but it seems like there's usually a line out the door anyways.
Delicious cheap and quick. The bbq pork over rice is 3.75 and pretty filling for 3.75

I had high hopes and enjoyed watching all the YouTube videos about this place.  However, I found the roast pork to be very fatty and chewy.  I really missed the roast pork that I've had in Flushing.  I won't be returning.
Always great food and fast service despite the line outside . Does get a bit greasy towards the end and the two men are always so friendly. Def go to for pork and duck

This is probably the most popular Chinese bbq in Chinatown. This is because they have maintained the quality consistently for years. The price is so low compared to everything in NYC. The line can be long, but I hardly ever hear them running out of the items I want. This is an amazing spot if you are in the neighborhood looking for some cheap and quick food.
the best. cheap as ffffffffffffffffffff. crowded and the line can get long, but so cheap, so worth the wait.
No comment

I seen this on place on YouTube. And well I thought it was great. Good food and good price. The cheapest place I ate in New York City. I had the duck and the pork. It was the first time my son seen ducks hanging in the widow. But you know a place is good when you have to wait in line.

This place is closed on Mondays - cleaning day. Unacceptable, as they should be opened 365/24/7.  It's a small place - take outs only - but the whole world knows about it. Every time i go there, the line is way out the door, blocking the entrance of the neighbor's door. The food is inexpensive and portion is huge. Normally 2 people in my family can share 1 order. Only drawback is the waiting line, which is deal-breaker especially during winter days. I think it's considered Chinese fast food, but it's no where close to being fast. Other than the wait, this place is great choice for meals. The char-siew (roast pork) is good!!

This is my absolute favorite place in Chinatown for char siu pork. I've tried other places, but Wah Fung remains the best. The meat is always perfectly cooked, just the right mix of tenderness and firmness, with a great glaze--not too sweet or salty. It's also really nice that you get a bit of cabbage along with your meal, as most places just plop the pork on top of rice and send you on your way. At least here you can pretend you're eating slightly healthier since there's some vegetables on the side (though they really do help cut the richness of the pork as you eat). The chicken and duck are both pretty good, but my favorite order is half roast pork, half char siu pork. The roast pork has an amazingly crunchy skin, and combination of flavor and texture is impressive. While the occasional long line can be deterring, the price and quality of the pork offerings is unbeatable.
