No comment
How did I just discover they serve rice noodle deliciousness on the side? Wah Fung does it right :)
No comment

I love this place. You can stretch a dollar here. And you get mounds of food. I don't know how these people do it, but i won't complain. The men at the counter are also very nice. Long lines though. You see people from all walks of life there so you can converse while waiting. I'm a Bridge Operator for NYC and i was standing next to a Chinese doctor in line. Lmao. We had a good conversation. Before we knew it we were saying goodbye to each other with our bags in hand. I just adore that place. Only wish the menu was more versatile. But i'll take what i can get.

Cheap hole in the wall for good food. Roasted duck, chicken, and two types of pork. They call one "roast pig" and "roast pork". (English names). It's all good. They have some kind of green sauce/oil thing. Get it on the side.
I don't know. The cuts are very greasy and they add more liquid grease on top. I found it very unhealthy.
No comment

When I was a kid, they used to own a small food cart before becoming a full time restaurant. They used to make tempura fried vegetables that were so gooooddd. However, their cha siu is currently the spotlight but I feel like it's too gritty for my taste.
Delicious! I got the small chicken with noodles. Nicely glazed chicken and the soy sauce that they put on the noddles had a mild sweet flavor. Cannot believe the amount of food for $3.75!!

Honestly one of the best bbq/grilled pork rices I have ever had in the US, and I'm from San Gabriel, CA, home to a million Cantonese BBQ places. You'll probably only find something equivalent or better in Southern China. But why such a high rating? Because it's cheap, fast, and absolutely delicious. The cabbage, cooked in the broths of the soup, is perfectly soft and flavorful. The grilled pork is perfectly cooked with a crunchy texture on the .outside and chewy texture inside. The BBQ pork isn't even remotely dry, as it is juicy with just the right amount of fat and lean meat. Put all of that over a bed of rice, and you have the perfect lunch box. You can get their special smaller size portion for around $4, or get the larger portion for $6. Since it comes with veges, it's a great alternative to the usual junk food at these prices. Pair this with some tea from Kungfu Tea next door, and you've got the perfect lunch!
No comment

Great great great food for the price we got. As a take-out place, I cannot comment on the service. But they are pretty nice. For $5 you can pretty much get a lot of food, and I mean A LOT OF FOOD. Their pork is extremely tasty. Their chicken is a little bit salty on the other hand. Really want to try their duck but they sold out by the time we are there, must be good. Overall, I would come back next time I'm in NYC to try their food again

It's an okay cheap eats place. The duck was too fatty. The pork was flavorful, but some strips too hard. Skipped on the cabbage. Server sweated all over the food. Understandable that it was 100 degrees yesterday, but take a moment to wipe your sweat off your face :( and touches food and money with same gloves  4 stars for the affordable pricing and a small portion is enough during lunch break. $10.75 for small duck/rice, small pork/rice and bottle of water.
Good lunch spot for roasted duck, chicken and pork. I love how low the price is 3.75/order! What?!?! And it's so good. I usually go to the park after I order to eat. Fine dinning at its finest.
Great food. The char xiou was a little over hyped, but the roasted pork and rice was fantastic. Must check it if in Chinatown NY!
Great Roast Pig over rice! Good that they have the small size option so that one can try a bunch other food in Chinatown.
No comment
Amazing roast pork.  This meal is worth way more than they charge.  Line moves fast.
No comment

At its price point this is a killer deal, 12 bucks for a large duck over rice and large roast pork over rice. These dishes are quintessential canto staples that i grew up with and this establishment makes it pretty well. The reason this isn't an 5/5 is because the rice and duck combo wasn't flavorful enough for my liking, i definitely recommend adding the sweet soy sauce but i took my order togo so it was too late for me.
No comment

$3.50 for pork or chicken over rice?! With delicious soy sauce?! And $5.50 for 3 things over rice!!!!!!!! Pork, chicken, duck, whatever you want! It was the most delicious chicken ever. We waited in the cold for half an hour because the line was out the door. It was worth it. Definitely coming back!!!
No comment
Very large portions and defs worth it cuz SO cheap! Got duck, chicken, pork and cabbage on rice for only $6. Can't go wrong with that~
This place felt really authentic. Two options pork or chicken. Rice or noodles. Simple and delicious. Real chinese food. I got pork with noodles yum. Go get some dumplings next door

$4 chashu fan...what more do I need to say? I do have some stuff to say though haha, even though this place is cheap the meat is probably the best I've ever had in NYC. Extremely authentic and extremely quick even if the line is long it moves fast! For sure a staple if you're ever in the neighborhood!
No comment

This place is so insanely cheap. I always have a riend wait in line while I go next door to Kung fu tea for some bubble tea. Be prepared to wait in line for at least fifteen minutes. The smell is amazing, get the pork on noodle instead of rice and get veggies. All for only $3.75

So let me begin by saying this place is legit, you cannot beat the food for the price but let me talk about the food first it is absolutely delicious, moist, flavorful, and definitely worth the wait on line (which moves fast by the way). There is no seating area to eat, it is  strictly walk in order and walk out. But there is a park across the street where you can sit and enjoy your food on a nice day. I ordered the large chicken over riceand cabbage (because they were sold out of noodles) I came late during the day ( on a Sunday) and the total cost was $5 what a steal so much food it was absolutely delicious. I  will come back in order something different on the menu next time. If you are ever in the area and want a quick bite to eat I definitely recommend this place it's worth the wait and visit.

Stumbled upon this gem by accident in my way to the lucky star bus terminal. WOW! What a deal! You get a heaping pile of rice, choice of chicken or pork and a choice of noodles or vegetables. I went with the pork with vegetables (the noodles didn't look that great to be honest). I am blown away by how delicious this meal was. Not only that, but it cost me $3.75 (CASH ONLY). The pork was so tender, and it was a very generous portion for the price. The veggies were nicely seasoned and the finishing touch was delicious sauce poured over the rice, which made everything even tastier. Over all, an A+ meal. I will definitely be back. Be aware that there may be a line but it is worth the wait.
No comment

The bomb!!!! Hella good and inexpensive! I tried the three meat combo and was so impressed. I can eat this everyday only if I'm not health conscious! Ask for sesame, BBQ sauce, and hot sauce. The cabbage is also fresh and crisp!! Can't wait to have another plate!!!

My new favorite place for lunch. I got the special that was 3.75. It came with a huge portion of rice and cabbage and a huge portion of roast pork. For the amount you pay for, its a lot of food. Taste wise, I loved it.
No comment
No comment

$3.75 for rice, BBQ pork and tiny bit of vegetables. Is it worth it?   Yes. Is it tasty?  Mediocre. There is always a line and it's narrow inside. Not a must stop diner in Chinatown.  3 stars for value, 1 star for taste. I'm Chinese so I'm super bias. Sorry!
No comment
Would pay $10 for it.  Only cost $3.75. Best char Siu I ever had.   Always a line outside so expect to wait at least 20 mins

This is the best Chinese BBQ pork place I have ever tried. The prices are insanely cheap and the portions are huge. Usually there is a line but it goes by fast. I highly recommend the roasted pork, crispy and juicy.
Flavors are extremely bland and the texture of the meat was very mealy.  Cannot recommend to anyone. Will not come back.
Quality might not be the highest but at this price point the preparation and amount of food is hard to beat!

Heard so much about the place. When there on a limb after my failed attempt during the lunar new year celebration. Waited for 30 mins on a rainy Sunday afternoon. Worth the wait. Probably the best kept secret in NYC. If I worked closer I'd come here at least twice a week. Got the three meat mixed plate. Must have been at least pound to pound and a half of food for $6. It is a bargain and you'll win a lot of cool points w your friends that you know one of the gems in NYC. By no means is this the finest of Chinese cuisine has to offer but the gentlemen who run this place are magnificent in that they are perfecting their craft on three dishes: duck, chicken and pork. Have a go at it, it's not suppose to be a Michelin star experience but a great experience nonetheless. Enjoy.
I was so happy to see that there was no line.  So I ordered two small orders of roasted pork and roasted duck.  It was mostly fat and no meat.  Lots of rice. No thank you.

Came here during our vacation trip to check out Chinatown. Very small shop with no tables inside. It was a weekday at about 5:30 pm, and a very short line. Food was tasty, and good portion. I wouldn't say the food is more spectacular than what I can find here in SF, but its a nice hole-in-the-wall to try while in NY Chinatown. The two staff members were really friendly too.
Amazing duck fatty goodness. Taste a sooooooooo good. Cheap too. Better than a fine dining restaurant. Wah da Fung??
No comment

1 star only because i cannot give it 0. Food is terrible bland and tasteless and the prices are not as advertised i ordered a small duck and pork which was on their menu for $4.50 the guy charged me 5 dollars which would not have been so bad if the food was palatable which neither myself nor my friends were able to finish their plates

A Yong Asian guy cutting the meat smashed the sauce bottle out of my hand, the reason I don't know. He said after it already has sauce in it. Which i didnt see him putting some thats why i wanted to put sauce. I grabbed it because someone else used it before me and they didn't tell him something so I thought it was ok for me to do it. It was my first time in this restaurant coming from LA but in my first time i came out of there very unsatisfied with his manner of treating a client.
No comment

I realize I'm at a point in my life where I'd rather pay a few dollars more for quality than whatever this is. Was the food cheap? Yes. Was it plentiful? Absolutely. Did I throw most of it out because it was fatty and just not well seasoned? I did. But Wah Fung has been on my list of places to visit for about .... 10 years now, so glad I finally tried it out. 18 year old me would have loved this place.

Really have nothing to complain about this place. Good portions, fatty, tasty meat, cheap, lots of cabbage - yes please! Make sure you know what you're signing up for though. This is a cash only, get it to go, no frills kind of joint. Know what you want before you get to the front of the line or you will be grilled at. Oh, ask for extra ginger scallion sauce while you're at it, too.
Best take out food in Chinatown.

For a "fast food" joint, the wait was pretty long for a short line. But I gotta hand it to them, the food is pretty amazing. The roasted pork was the best I've ever had. I don't think I've ever had pork like that before. The duck was good, but the pork was better. I also tried their broad rice noodles, which seemed like they were missing something in flavor. Never had it before so not sure if that's the way they're supposed to taste, but it just didn't seem to reach the taste that I wanted it to.
No comment

$3.75 for a tray of rice, vegetables, and some delicious roast pork or chicken? Yeah, this is one of the best deals in NYC, and in addition to being cheap is also incredibly good. You know it's pretty authentic when there's a line out the door and everyone is speaking Chinese. I think I was the only one that uttered a word of English the entire 15 minutes I was there, and there were at least 20 people going in and out of the tiny corridor that is this establishment. It gets really steamy in there as you can see them slice up the duck, chicken, and pork, but the meat is incredibly tender, topped with a flavorful marinade and sauce, and comes in an incredibly generous portion. Chinese bbq can rarely be done at a better value than this.

There was always a line there so I decided to check it out. Hole in a wall place with very inexpensive and fast Char Sui fun. Honestly, i have had better char sui in my life but the sauce on rice and cabbage combo was really good and cheap. I get why everyone loves it so much.

We had a good, quick lunch from here. We sat on a bench at the park across the street and enjoyed our meal of pork and rice. Very simple and well prepared food. Never would have found this place if not for the Yelp reviews.

The most happy making, filling, simple meal I have ever had. I've tried all three (pork,duck and chicken) but I just think the chicken is the best! The pork tastes so good too. Cash only. No frills. Usually a line. SO worth it! :)
No comment
If you can get over how gross on some levels the food/place is, then the meal is kinda delicious.   Moreover, the value is incredible.
No comment

I stumbled across this gem of a place while exploring Chinatown. The $5 small rice plate(box) with duck and roast pork was so damn good!! They give you some steamed cabbage and spoon Over the meat drippings(magic sauce) over everything. I went to Joes Shanghai and Peter Luger later that day but what i remember from that day is the rice plate i had here. 10/10 would come back!

Grrrrrreeeeaattttt food,  if you feel like getting some of the nonavrage Chinese food. Sorry I don't have any pics... I was hungry and the food was so tempting. I heard from YouTuber- StrictlyDumpling and I just had to try this place out. 5:50 for large 3:50 small, good price. Really nice options I'll say that much. I'm giving a 4 out of 5 stars because even tho they did give me a decent amount if meat. I sorta feel the rice to meat ratio is a little high. No big complaints here.

I came in with high expectations from past reviews. Overall, it was not a bad experience. The value is what makes this review 4 stats compared to 3. It's a cheap eat for the amount of food you get. Affordable and fast if there aren't many people in line. It would be a place I would revisit if it's close, but not worthwhile to get a taxi to go to. In terms of taste it is not bad. Nothing to write home about.
The best roasted duck, roasted chicken and roasted pork I've ever had  with a side dish of cabbage delicious I highly recommend eating food from here at least once in your life.
No comment
The cha Xiao meat was spoiled! Don't buy it when it is hot.  You don't know how they made it.

TINY place--almost 1 person wide.  Cash only (they literally just throw the cash into a cardboard box behind them).  The Char Siu was GOOD, but not amazing.  The "roast pig" however, was incredible.  Crispy, crackly skin and meltingly tender pork. Get that, large, over rice, for like $6.  Crazy good.  Line was out the door, but moved very quickly.

For a person who grew up in Hong Kong, this is comfort food. It's not as great as the ones in HK but it's the best in NYC. Every time I come here, there's a line. For $5.00 you get a heaping box of cha siu with steamed cabbage on white rice. The butcher also drizzles a spoonful of the flavorful cha siu sauce (the same sauce they use to marinade their cha siu in) giving each spoonful of a rice delicious cha siu flavor. The thought of it makes me hungry already. One large box is enough to last me two meals. It's fast, delicious and filling!
No comment

3.5*** off the recommendation of a recommendation I decided to try a new spot. Walking up I knew I might be in for treat. Approaching the store front there was a pleasant surprise of a line to get in of locals and after work commuters. There is about four items on the menu (roast pork, pig, duck and chicken)  over choice of white rice or noodle. All swimming in their own juices or swimming in special gravy. I sampled the roast pork. It seemed to be the line choice. Portions are packed and for low prices it's a place not to miss when passing by.

A totally no frills take-out only restaurant offering delicious chinese bbq roast pork, chicken, duck and pig (with crispy skin).  You can opt for a one choice of meat, or a combo, that is served with asian style gravy over rice and cabbage. Unbelievable prices from $4.50 (sm) to $6 (lg) that is packed to the max capacity of the food container.  It's difficult to find a better deal for a delicious protein packed meal.
Amazing. Really fresh and delicious BBQ pork in rice. I got a small, and it was plenty big with pots of meat. I think it was like $4 or something

BEST. ROAST PORK. IN CHINATOWN. They give you so much for the $ you pay. We went around closing time. We had to wait in line but the line moved fast and it really was worth the wait. The pork was cooked just right. I honestly expected it to be very salty but it was not salty at all. The combination of rice, pork and cabbage was perfect. When I went, they didn't have duck so I am definitely going to go again for their roast duck rice. 10/10 would recommend!

Take it for what it is. A hole in the wall joint with great BBQ pork. No frills, no gimmicks, just straight up what you see (literally as all the BBQ meet is behind a glass counter) is what you get. Super quick service so don't worry about the line that you see out the door. Small portion is perfect and actually feeds two as a snack and a hearty lunch for one. They fill literally to the brim so go for it. BBQ pork is the best. Soy chicken was a tad too salty for my liking. Everything tastes like the BBQ places you eat in HK. Must try if you are into Cantonese BBQ.
No comment
No comment
No comment

First time I came I saw a long line outside this very small takeout and I decided this had to be a great place. I ordered the large plate with roast pork, headed over the park to sit down, and it was just a great meal. The pork is incredibly juicy and tender. Now I come back whenever I can. If I am with a friend driving around I will make sure we come here. I think I must have turned about a dozen friends into regulars.
No comment
No comment
This place is so popular but kinda overrated: too much fat in their bbq pork and no sauce provided. I also have hygiene concern for their working environment.
Grilled pork is the best! You should come over before your meal because there is always a long line here. It is for to-go only, no tables for eat-in.

This is my favorite Chinese food near my apartment. Its only a couple minutes walk and its open late. Best of all its cheap and you get a  LOT of food. The sweat and sour chicken is my favorite but so is the duck lo mein. They spring rolls are out of this world. They also have milk teas which are great too.
Tasty, service is good, price is impressive
No comment
There is no cheap eats place that can beat the amount of quality food per dollar hands down. If you like meat over rice of any kind this would be the spot  for you to go.

One of the hidden gems of Chinatown. For $3.75 (no tax/cash only) you can get a small box of rice, veges and roasted pork or chicken. (Roasted pork or "char chew" is THE way to go!) And the small box can really fill you up! There is always a line but it does move quickly. Would recommend anyone to try this spot at least once!

Solid lunch spot for always. The roast pork has a really good amount of flavor and as everyone says they always give you soo much. I ordered a large and it filled me for both lunch and dinner. Make sure to get the minced garlic sauce too, cause that stuff is like crack. It's not a very refined dish like the way big wong does it's roast pork over rice but it's delicious regardless and it's worth the wait, especially when you're starving.
#1 reason why I've given it five stars is because it's not only cheap, it's tasty as well. Does that combination even exist in New York?!
No comment

So greasy, but so good. I travel to Chinatown from Flushing and obediently stand on a long line when I crave a good char siu over rice. Roast pig, chicken and duck are also very good.  Sometimes I order a large so I have leftovers for the next day and there's always a solid layer of fat at the bottom of the container. But I still go back for more. It's that good.

This place is delicious! I have been here multiple times and they have never failed me! There is always a MASSIVE line in front of this place, but that tells you that this place is one of everyone's favs!!!! It is also very cheap, which is a nice bonus. If you guys visit this place, you will not regret it! If you're in the area, definitely come and check it out! When you line up, you can see the juicy roast duck, roast pork, and when you get inside, it is warm and SUPER delicious smelling! But keep in mind, THIS PLACE HAS NO SEATING!!! That was the one mistake that we made when we came in, but that is too minor a mistake to take off any stars!
6 dollars for a giant box of rice, cabbage, roast duck and duck gravy is as good as it gets in Chinatown and the A on the window is always re assuring. There is always a line and get there early.

Definitely considered to be a hole in the wall. But it is hands down the best in the business of Chinese roasted meats for the cheapest price. They are a cut above the rest, just don't expect a sit down place here as there are no seats at all.

Found this place three years ago walking over to lucky star bus for a trip to Boston and have since been hooked, visiting quite frequently.  The duck is my favorite but everything is delicious!  Cash only and always with a long line (that moves very quickly); this is one of my go to places in Chinatown for fast cheap delicious eats!
Great Price awesome quality love it here ! I had pork over rice for only 4 dollars and it tasted amazing. The place always has a line out the door but it's worth the wait.
No comment
No comment

Wah Fung is amazing! Today I walked 11 miles to get here and I was not at all disappointed. I saw a video on youtube by Mike Xing Chen aka strictly dumpling. In his video review of dishes from Wah Fung he proclaims their char siu to be the best outside of Hong Kong and boy was he right! I have had char siu in Brooklyn and it does not compare at all to the char siu at Wah Fung. My order today was 2 char siu over vegetable, 2 char siu over noodles, 1 roasted soy sauce chicken over vegetable and 1 roasted pig over vegetable. I skipped the rice because I have no desire for it. All white rice does is take up belly space for no reason. I just want the good stuff. The roasted soy sauce chicken is so flavorful and the skin is that awesome gelatinous skin which sticks your lips and melts in your mouth. The roasted pig is awesome! The crispy skin puts it over the top and makes it super enjoyable. I must say that the char siu at Wah Fung is elite and is the way to go no matter how many times you visit. There are few things worth  going on long walks for, but the char siu at Wah Fung is well worth every step. I am now hooked on this stuff and am proud to admit it. A must go to spot for char siu!
So yummy!!! Best $5 spent in a while! Pork was delicious and fresh! Will definitely return when I'm in the area again.

This was close but has a long way to get to 5 stars ,even on a very esthetic level, what makes it great its local and people have been coming all there lives.It was the friendliest waiting line ever, and you will be waiting but not so long. The food and price was great, I had the pork and duck combo,I'd go with the pork alone, the duck was not filling. Heres the thing we ate outside because its take away only and it was sunny but chilly. When the pork cools down or has absorbed all the liquids it can get a little chewy, that said enjoy
No comment

Don't let the name scare you. This is OG Chinese barbecue. The food is delicious. Lines don't lie. Chinese people in general are curt but don't be intimidated. The roast pork, pork belly, chicken and duck are all fantastic. The lunch portion with rice is great to grab for a quick bite. They're very generous with their servings so be sure to tip. The line is slow at times because it's always worth it. My go-to for meats to go.
It's cheap and all but I ended up with fatty cartilagy chunks and broken bone bits. Not that pleasant.
No comment
Spectacular pork and amazing value for $5.50. However next time I'd skip the duck and focus on the good stuff. Green sauce is amazing and there's never enough. Cabbage is good

This hole in the wall served the most tender and flavorful pork and roasted chicken. That's what I got anyway. The duck looks pretty good too. There was a line outside in the middle of the day but that made me patiently wait even longer because I knew I was getting some good food. Oh, and how can I forget about the green garlic sauce...mmmmm mmmmm good!
No comment
Amazing I don't think I can describe it in a different way, it's tasty the pork melt in your mouth like butter, fresh, so cheap clean one of my favorite spots
For $5 you can get lunch and dinner! The portions are huge. Yeah it's a little greasy but it'll fill you up. If I lived in NYC I would never cook again.
No comment

Heaping servings of 2 roast meats over rice with cabbage for only $5 --need I say more? Be prepared to wait a bit. We were 4th in line and waited 20 minutes to order.  This hole-in-the-wall place (no seating) is run by a husband and wife team. The husband handles the meat orders and is the cashier too. The wife handles the rice crepe with fish ball orders further into the store (didn't try that). You can get a smaller portion of 1 meat over rice with cabbage for $3.50. With the 2 meats over rice, there was totally enough food to last a couple meals! The roast pork is definitely one of the best I've had in Chinatown. Despite the dirt cheap prices - they have an A health inspection grade. One of the best cheap eats in the city!
Definitely a must stop if you're in the neighborhood. Pork is the tastiest around. You go in, get your foot and get the F out.
The best pork in the city!. Little hole in the wall. It's basically a window.  Super cheap and super good

You get your money's worth plus more here! Sometimes there's a line so be prepared to wait if you go during peak lunch and dinner hours. For $3.95 u get so much meat packed with rice and veggies. Me and boyfriend literally got full off of one so it's definitely plentiful. Highly recommend

Wah Fung #1 is the little shop near Grand St. Station that consistently has a line 10 people long. I always step in, craving the $2.50 meal, and end up waiting for a good 15-20 (maybe more? I can't tell, never timed it exactly) minutes. It takes forever. If only Wah Fung served their tasty BBQ pork and roasted chicken over rice meals faster, this would be a solid 4 stars. In summary, the food here is super tasty, super cheap but oh, the wait, oh the wait.
No comment

I've seen videos of this place floating around online but didn't get a chance to try it out until now. This place is amazing! I came here for lunch on a Friday afternoon and there was a lineup out the door, though it moved pretty fast and it was my turn to order within 10 minutes. I got the small roast pork with rice, and two of these cost a total of $8.50, which is insanely cheap especially in NYC. There isn't any seating indoors (the place is really small), so my friend and I walked to the food court nearby and ate there. The food was great! Very simple (pork, cabbage, rice) but really hit the spot. Overall great food at a really cheap price point!
No comment

I actually went to get a roasted duck with white rice, was fast to get and tasted actually good. Not so bad for five dollars. Only thing is there isn't no space to eat and sit but besides that it's worth it. :)

Another NYC Chinatown gem. I was expecting mediocre food for a really cheap price (which I'd still be okay with) but it was RLY good food for a cheap price. What a great surprise! Roast pork is some of the best I've ever had. The trick is to ask for extra meat 'juice' poured over your rice. Nommmmm.
No comment
No comment

I would give this place a million stars if I could. This is the absolute best char siu (and siu yuk) in the entire city. The noodles are also incredible, I'd recommend getting them instead of rice. And it's probably cheaper by the pound than halal food.

If you are ever in Manhattan Chinatown, come and visit this place. They have the cheapest and great tasting roast meats around. The portions are big, even if you order small. It is cheap because they only take cash - so be prepared ahead of time. I can promise that you will not regret it! If you do not know what to order, try the roast pork. It is the best bang for your buck, also it is delicious and filling. Do not let the line intimidate you, it moves quickly. When it comes time to order, stick to the keywords because they are not there to converse. Even though there is no designated seating, you can walk across the street and find a bench under neath the shady trees. This is definitely my go-to place for roast meat lunch.

EVERYTHING is good here! I love coming here although every time I do come the line is out the door. The wait is totally worth it. Trust me, you won't regret it. My favorite is their roast pork and roast pig. Its 3.75 for a small which comes with rice and a side of veggies. They give a large portion for the small price. This place is literally a hole in the wall but it's usually places like these that make the best food. I love watching the son and father duo in action with their cleavers. If I were you, I'd go over there right now.
Its a Hole in the wall place. And a very cheap place a large order is only 5.50. Unlike someplace it cost you alot. Worth the travel to the place
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

worth the hype, worth the wait. Extremely affordable and tasty! will be back. I got the pork and duck combo over rice with veggies(just cabbage). The fatty meat juice they put over the rice is pretty bomb. They close at 7 so, try to make it at lunch or right after work!

This is where you go to get some of the juiciest, most mouth- watering Chinese roast pork or duck in the city with a side of rice and equally delicious cabbage, for super cheap prices. Simple and flawless. One of my personal favorite eateries in Chinatown, and my sister's all-time favorite in the area. Don't be intimidated by the line, or the narrow space inside; something as unbelievably perfect as this is worth it. Make your order, watch them serve it, pay, and leave. This isn't a place to hang out in, just great food to go. Which suits me fine. If one of these days I organize a Chinatown foodie tour, this mighty hole- in- the- wall would be a must. Take it from a guy who lived on the CT side of LES for years back in the day.
No comment
No comment

I came here to try the roast pork, cha siu, and duck rice platter. Usually I go to Corner 28 in Flushing for all of these, but this will definitely be a staple when I am in Manhattan. The portions are extremely generous for the price! The roast pork was definitely the best of these three meats. The skin is very crispy and the meat is so tender. The cha siu is sweet, flavorful, and soft. However, the duck here is VERY salty and I would not order it again. But beware coming here if you are in a rush because there WILL be a line.
No comment

Best Cantonese BBQ in Chinatown!  The food here is about as authentic as it can be.  The restaurant has no sitting area, but the park right across the street is a perfect place to enjoy your meal!  It's price is extremely cheap for the amount of food you get, it is easily possible to fill yourself up with about 5 dollars.  Keep in mind there is always a line for the place.
No comment
Unbeatable price and potion. Chashao is very tasty.
If you want something to fill you up for under $5, this would be the place to go. For 3.75 you get an enormous portion of cha siu comparable to one's in Hong Kong served with rice.
No comment

Even had a line at 3pm! The portions here are SO big! So delicious and amazing. I gave them an extra dollar because it's so worth it, they really pack in the meat and rice. The old man here is an artist-- he really cares and adds an extra dollop of sauce to the plates.

I thought I just had to come to Wah Fung before I took the Fung Wah bus back to Boston. You know this place is gonna be good by the fact that the line is around the block. Trust me it's worth it. For $5 you get a GIANT styrofoam container full of rice and cabbage and then the entire surface is covered in amazing delicious BBQ meat. If you want a normal sized portion you can get a smaller container with mostly less rice for $3.75. Cash only here (obviously). They have a very limited menu in the best possible way. I got the pork and my friend got the chicken and both were incredible. Some of the best of this style of food I've had. It's absolutely worth the wait.
No comment
One of my all time favorite place. The quality's consistent and the portion's huge for a great price. It's simply amazing! Definitely go try it if you haven't.
No comment
Food reminding me of home! Cheap and tasty
This is where you need to go if you're hungry with $6.00 and don't wanna go out sad. That pork and extra gravy sauce will get you right for the rest of the day
This place actually deserves 5 stars because of their amazing food, great customer service and again delicious food. It's a bit expensive but it's all worth it!

I come here almost everyday during my lunch break. Well worth the 10-15 minute wait. The portions are HUGE and it's so cheap ($3-$6 bucks will get you lunch and have you save some for dinner). Not just that, the food is so juicy and delicious. The best!

I love this place!! This is roast pork heaven! If you are a fan of Chinese roast pork, the type that hangs in the windows of Chinatown both Brooklyn and Manhattan this is the place. Total hole in the wall offering roasted meats, rice and some Veg. $3.75 will get you a perfect lunch amount of roast pork, cabbage and white rice. It's fantastic and probably some of the best roast pork that I have ever had. I just can't get this place out of my head the pork is that good. You cannot visit Chinatown without stopping here. God I love this place!
No comment

This place sells the best take out ever. As an Asian myself I've tried countless Chinese restaurants but this I would say is one of the top! They aren't cheap with their portions like other places and their vegetables actually taste really good. In other places they would be bland or very dry but their food is delicious. I usually order the pork and they always give the perfect or maybe even more portions of meat for the amount of rice. The pricing on this place isn't bad either, in my opinion I would say it's very cheap.
No comment
No comment

This place is about as no frills and simple as you can get but the food is absolutely delicious. Wait on the line (which can be out the door at times)....Order all three meats...you will thank yourself later.
Everyone knows about the meats; Don't sleep on the Mai Fun with peanut sauce!

Small, hole in the wall place but don't let that fool you. The roast pork (char siu) is the best I've had (and I grew up eating this stuff!) everyday $3.75 lunch special gets you a heavy portion of meat plus rice and steamed cabbage. Great deal. Also highly recommend the crispy pork. the roast chicken is good but doesn't even come close to the char siu!
No comment
No comment

For the price and the amount, I'd give it 5 stars. I tried this place at least 3x and to say I'll be back for the 4th is a stretch. Why? I'm just not a fan of the pork here. Although it looks like a hefty amount, upon consumption, I'm just not satisfied. Maybe it's because I'm a meat lover and I prefer thicker pieces of pork.. But the first two times I came, it felt like I was just eating the roasted skin with nothing to it. The third time... I picked at it for five minutes and the rest of it is in the fridge.. not sure what I want to do with it. But their sauce is pretty good?

This place is my absolute favorite and have been going here for the past 2 years religiously! It is BY FAR the freshest Chinese in town, quick, fast, cheap. The roast pork is a 5 out 5 and recommendation to all.
i love meat but felt kinda sick after
No comment

This is not only the best char siu in Chinatown but it's the best value too!  You can tell by the constant line outside.  I enjoy watching the chefs slice and chop the barbequed meats.  The duck is deliciously fatty. The chicken is my favorite! I got Just chicken and it was about 4 quarter chicken pieces weighed out and cost around $6.50 then whacked with the clever into bite size pieces. The chef then poured some of the sauce from both the chicken and pork pans all over my chopped up chicken I always ask for lots of "green sauce" which is loaded with garlic.  My husband prefers the char siu pork.  It's full of flavor and some of the best BBQ Chinese roast pork you can find anywhere. Two HUGE containers only cost around $12! There is no seating inside.  It's basically just enough room for a single line and just enough room to get back out.  I'm glad I'm always able to get a decent parking spot nearby.
No comment
No comment
Small Cha Siu with Cabbage and Rice for $3.75! No wonder why there's a long line. It's a great deal and super tasty.

We had a craving for duck and came here because of the great reviews on Yelp. When we arrived there was a long line which indicated that this is a very popular place. Unfortunately the duck was very greasy and sweet and I could only eat about 10% of the duck as almost everything was fat. Prices are very low but I would not go back here for the duck at least. Maybe the other meats are better.
No comment

Love this guy. Another hole in the wall gem of Chinatown. So much respect for a man who works 14 hour days on his feet. He went from a street cart with hour long lines to a storefront with hour long lines. He is notorious for his roast pork, duck and chicken over rice for a glorious price of $3.75. In the last decade, he's raised his price just 25 cents. Really can't find his cooking, price or generosity anywhere else. Definitely check him out if you're in the area.
No comment

The amount of food you get is absolute insanity. I may be dying at my desk post-lunch, but at least it be from food bliss. The 3-Meat combo platter with rice and steamed (?) cabbage came out to $6. The portion could probably feed a small family. Highly recommended - despite the length of the line, it's well worth the wait.

I used to pass by this place all the time. I would wonder why there's a line. Is it because it's really good roast pork with rice or is it just cause it's cheap? I finally found out today, it's BOTH. I got an order of roasted pork and chicken with rice, it comes with cabbage but I never really liked cabbage so I asked them to take it out. It also gets drizzled with some sauce after they stuff your aluminum container up. They're not cheap with the goods, for $3 bucks you get a lot more than you'd expect. Can't wait to try their fish ball with rice noodles and their roasted duck. The wait was definitely worth it!

Authentic, cheap, and delicious. What more could you want?! The line is always long (and unfortunately slow) but the men inside are always working hard to serve everyone. I make sure to leave them a tip because of it. You can't beat a large heaping of white rice with cabbage and generous serving of fresh Chinese style meat. The best part is when they pour extra juice. Get the large, it's worth paying a little extra for bc you get so much more. My Taiwanese mom says this place the best & authentic. Of course, be careful of the bones if you're unaware but that's how it's always served. My favorites are definitely the bbq pork (cha siu) and roast duck
No comment

I was a bit disappointed from reading the good reviews.  Having come from San Francisco Bay Area, the bbq and roast pork, the chicken and the duck were average.  The bbq pork was kinda dry.  The roast pork skin was not crunchy.  We ordered two items on two orders, and they were not filled to the rim like some reviewers said it would be.  I mean it was good, but I expected something that would blow me away.
Best for the value. The chefs here always give a generous amount of meat in addition to rice and veggies. They drench it in the soy sauce cooked in the roast pork. Yummmm! Would definitely recommend.
No comment
No comment

This small cute grandpa owned shop is well worth the wait! One night I waited on line for quite a while. It was almost my turn when the lady in front of me ordered the LAST two orders of their famous cha siu. I was ready leave empty handed but then she offered me one of her two orders!! Enough said, this place is awesome. Remember to go there early before all the cha siu runs out.
The best and most affordable Chinese food i ever had in NY. The portion is generous too. If u come to NYC in budget, u definitely need to make a trip.

Tiny tiny place with huge portions. Dont let the packaging fool you, they jam so much food in the tiny boxes. Roasted pork over rice is so juicy and cheap! Rice noodles with vegetable tempura is also delicious. If theres a long line (usually for the bbq/rice) items, and you want noodles, skip the line and tell them you want noodles so you dont end waiting on wrong line.
Give this place four stars for the price. They give you a lot of food for how much you paid. The food is good but it's nothing to write home about. It is pretty authentic however so I enjoyed it.
No comment
The service was great! We had to stay a line which moved quite fast. The offer was pork , duck. It was delicious. The price is unbeatable

The food here is delicious, and considering you're getting a hefty amount of food at a killer price? That's the ultimate combination. Unfortunately, be prepared to wait on a long line. This place is very popular, for obvious reasons. I've tried everything on the menu: chicken, roast pig, duck, and roast pork. And they are all spot on, and considering I'm quite the gormond when it comes to chinese food (been to China several times), that's saying something. Probably the finest fast food Chinese place in the city.
No comment
No comment
Great Char sui!!! Price is affordable for the taste they cook out
No comment

The first time I came here a few years ago I got food poisoning. I just gave it another try today  and I got the chicken. It was kind of dry and not much flavor. This stuff is just too greasy and sweet for me
No comment
The reviews give it away and also the long line to order. We stood in line for about 15 min and I don't regret one second.

There was a good size line outside which I took as a good sign. The line moved very slow, but steady. $7.50 for a large chicken over rice with a can of coke and a bottled water. Not too shabby. The only con is everything was so greasy. I expect a normal amount of grease, but this was excessive. It seems like a petty complaint I know, but just posting my experience. For the price and portion size, I really can't complain.
No comment

$6 got me a large portion of soy chicken and roast pork on rice with cabbage that can feed two people. For the price, you just can't complain about it. But I will say I wish the roast pork was not as fatty.
No comment

After having spent almost all of my money xmas shopping for family, I needed some good food for dirt cheap prices. This place definitely fit the bill, the roast pork was very tender and juicy as was the chicken. They definitely gave me my money's worth.For a very good amount of roast pork and chicken I only spent $5.00, I wish all food was this inexpensive! I'll definitely go back again.

Ok. so whenever we take the NYC-Boston Chinatown bus, this is where we stop first to get a delicious meal for the ride home. For an insanely low price, the men here just keep adding more to your dish, incredulously, like how much more meat are you going to pile on??!! They also add onto your dish, plenty of nappa cabbage for some vegetable balance. I will really miss this place seeing as I have given up meat. Highly recommended takeout place for you carnivores out there!!

Char siu was good. My only problem was we were standing in line, that went pretty fast..However, the amount of walk thru space while ordering and waiting, then getting out was pretty close to no space at all. The inside where they were plating and serving was kind of messy, but what can you expect from a grab and go service. Huge portions for cheap though:)
Legit. Cheap. Simple. Hype is real.
The prices may have gone up but it's still relatively cheap and let alone the value and flavor... absolutely worth the wait in line

Two thumbs up for Wah Fung No 1 Fast Food! A small lunch box for $3.75 with a choice of rice or noodles, cabbage and one of any roast meat, which includes roast pork, roast duck, roast chicken or roast  pig. The meats are extremely tasty. You must try when you are in the area.
This place is cheap and good.  3 juicy meats with rice, sauce and veggies for $6, what a steal.
No comment

At first I thought the place was pretty sketchy since it was so small, but I was in a rush so I took the risk. It's a risk I won't regret taking. Despite the fact that it's a cash only place, the food is definitely worth the walk to the bank. I ordered a roast pork on rice in large and the amount of food was enough to feed both my sister and I. It was delicious! It was worth the amount too, it was $5 for the large. When I go back to Chinatown, this will be my go to place for great food for a great price.

Best $5.00 I've ever spent. I came here with my sister just so we can buy it and let our dad try how good the meat is. He loves cha siu. Because we weren't hungry, we ordered a large pork over rice to share. The rice is drizzled with the pork sauce, but they weren't really generous with the sauce this time. I was also REALLY full after having half of it, so it's definitely worth it. There's lettuce included with the pork, too. The smaller size is $3.50.
No comment
lean, flavorful roast pork, inexpensive, long wait but well worth it.

Great food and cheap. I had the roast chicken and roast pork. Both were really good but I definitely preferred the pork. Although the chicken was amazing maybe even better than the pork as it was smoother, what held it back was the bones that unlike the pork were present.

Great food, the roast pork was definitely the pick of the meats, very tasty and juicy. The chicken had a few too many bones for liking but was also quite nice. You'll most likely have to wait 5-10mins in a line but its worth it. Don't be put off by the look of the place.
If diet is not in your vocabulary come here and get the fatty roast pork over rice....for only 4$ its like 2 meals of fatty pork rice and cabbage...super tender and juicy!
No comment
No comment
Watch out for the crazy jealous business owner lady next door. She will yell at everyone in line and pure buckets of water at the entire line and try to scare everyone away.
No comment

OUT OF CONTROL GOOD!!! They don't even need your business, because the lines are out the door. But once you've tired their roast pork you'll never be the same. I've been supporting this family since they were a street cart on Bowery Street. Everything is good, ask for extra sauce, be picky, and all your request will be granted. Get one of these $3 roasted pork on rice dishes and it will fill any big eater. Maybe it's the mound of roasted pork you get, the splash of lard and drippings at the end, dirty floors, lack of AC, no decor, the TLC from chopping every piece of roasted pork, or it's simply the fact that they never take any breaks nor any days off to make a great product. Now that is respect.
No comment

No comment

No comment
No comment
Just tried the roast pork with rice and cabbage and it was amazing and flavor. There was a long line of about 10 people but definitely worth the wait.
No comment
I love going here when I hit NYC tasty char siu pork over rice straight up good. Real Chinatown style street food.
No comment
Amazing duck. Good quality, low prices and huge portions. What more could you ask for?

The cost has gone up to $2.50 within the last 6 months so it's now just the best bargain that I know of, instead of silly and unheard of low-cost. I no longer get the chicken or pork after trying the pig. It makes me feel gross as it's really oily, tasty as well as the exterior is crunchy fat that's heart-stopping great. In case you adore fat-encrusted greasy meat, get the pig. It's really nice and so poor at the exact same time. It's similar to drugs or slow suicide in the event that you do it more often than once per week, but truly amazing. My advice is go early around 10:30am to prevent the ever present line and please don't get more than 2 orders, if possible.
No comment

Came here for a quick bite as I work in the area, about a 15 min walk from City Hall area. I was craving char siu, which is not bad at all, although I've had better and juicier else where, including Big Wong. The price is what can't be beat. For $3.75 you can get a small char siu fan (roast pork rice) and they also have soy sauce chicken and duck. You can opt for bigger sizes for cheap still but what kept me coming back is the cheung fun (rice roll) and fish balls that's sold by Poon kee (Madison St.) here... In which my opinion is mighty good. In fact I order big containers of it to bring home when I commute back to LI carrying it through Penn Station which is usually annoying but worth it. Good char siu and cheung fun is hard to come by in the suburbs if not impossible.

The line around the corner says it all. Quality Chinese on the go. Limited menu, most go there for their Chicken or Pork platters, they also have other items like Duck and Crispy Pork Belly. I'll definitely be back again soon. Cash only.
come here. buy box of roast pork and chicken for less than $20 and pack lunch/dinner for a whole week for 2. WIN
Good value for the price and amount you get. I had the duck and rice. My only complaint was that the duck didnt have much meat, seemed to be mostly bones.

One of most well known "hidden" gems in Chinatown. The roast duck/pork over rice are must tries. The bbq meats are very crispy but juicy at the same time, and goes perfectly with their special house sauces. And to top it all off, the portions are extremely generous and only $4 dollars!

A great place in a very unnoticed zone. However, the food is very tasted like traditional Fujian Chinese food. And the most important thing is its price. It's so cheap! Our family of three just need 20 dollars with a great meal. Must come again if having chance.

This place is freaken' awesome! Sometimes I do miss them being at the cart between Bowery & Hester st. Their quick and cheap food is simply amazing. Instead of Roasted pork over rice, try it with lo mein! Easiest way to cut the line is go inside to the "cart" section and order something from the cart. If you want something from the roasted meat section, order at the "cart" too!

I love the pork at this place, been coming here for years, but it only got 3 star rating since the owners son   began doing the serving. Usually the owner gives huge portions of the better cuts of pork, but since the son took over with the cutting, the portion and the parts of the meat has declined, he gives much less and most of the time he serves more fat than meat. Im going to start asking the owner if he could serve me from now on.

Typical hole in the wall place, can't go wrong with it. It'll be the best $3.75 you've spend on, a meal is cheaper than a frappacino and its so delicious. The roast pork is a must try, it's so juicy and tender. I also got the roast pig and roast duck, they're also good but the roast pork is the best!
Got in the city early today. Drop by this place pickup a lbs of roast pig. It was the best rost pig I had so far. So good.
One of the best restaurants in NYC and it is very cheap and so much foods. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone! Personally my favorite is crispy pork over rice.
No comment

Enormous portions for ridiculously cheap. Had the roast pork and duck over rice for $5.50 and it fed two. The line moves a bit slowly because there's just one dude behind the counter taking orders, prepping dishes, bagging them and running the cashier. There's also no seating inside or outside; you'll have to either take it home or to the park across the street. Not a problem in the fall but something to consider if it's winter

Walked by on Saturday to see a long line outside and thought I had to look on Yelp later to see if this place was worth it. The next day (Sunday/today) I decided it was worth it from viewing all of the mouth watering photos. I live in Hells Kitchen and decided to trek all the way out here which took 30 minutes due to the D train rerouting onto the F line (boo). Waited in line for a good 20-25 minutes. Messenged my roommates if they wanted to try anything from this place (all 3 decided "yes") and put in their orders and venmo'ed me. I held up the line a bit with my order: 1 roast pork + rice, 1 roast pork + noodle, 1 roast duck + noodle, 1 whole roast duck chopped up & 1 roast pig + rice. Total? $34!!! I only had 20bills so I gave them the change. I'm assuming no one tips at this place because the old lady and man holding down the joint looked at me at first with confusion and then gratitude. The $6 tip they deserve for the speedy service & later, justified in the tasty meal. OMG. Do you like no frills, greasy Chinese food?! This place is it. I got back to my Hells Kitchen apartment an hour later because there was subway delays (con ed decided to power off in some stations)... anyway I decided to have a feast by myself in front of the tv + an already opened bottle of prosecco. The taste of the food was exactly what I had been craving!!! Each to-go box was filled to the brim and overpacked with rice and meat ! Let's just say I will be back. And if you see that long line outside? Don't be deterred. You'll be satisfied later !
No comment
Super cheap. A lot of food. Definitely worth the trip. Best roast pork in NYC. Always drive to Chinatown for it.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Absolutely amazing food. Though everything from here is amazing, the roast pork and duck are the best. The roast pork is the best I've ever had.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I am horrified this place is still open after the health dept shut them down a few times over the years!. I have even bumped into friends and neighborhood cops waiting on this line and have tried to warn them... If you knew the truth you would RUN from this place. What you don't see beyond the cheap prices and glazed bbq is how they prep and handle the food from hanging in a rusted dusty basement dungeon, hanging it outdoors with no sanitary pans and mice and roaches of all sizes everywhere. I KNOW this because I worked in the building for quite some time. While I'm all about mom and pop shops in today's age of gentrified neighborhoods and I am a Chinese native in this area for over 30 years, this business should not be operating and if you had access to the stairwell just next door of them to see their basement and yard, you would see the truth. If I still had access, I would have provided photos but anyone with access to the building would see this. They even kept a poor diseased cat who had infected eyes and a bad limp in this area of the basement, running really hot down there. One day they saw me trying to rescue it but it got away in another locked room down there, and the next day the cat was gone and never seen again for the next few months, when it used to be there every day with no escape to the outdoors. Horrified at this place.
No comment
Insanely tasty food for this price! The small portion of rice and pork was perfect to share as a quick little lunch.
No comment
You must try this place. This is one of those hidden gems that never disappoints. We got the pork as a snack and it was delicious and CHEAP. Great experience and food, GO

I've spent half of my life in Hong Kong, I grew up with a BBQ lunch box, so I get picky when I want some siu mei. I currently live in San Francisco and the stuff they serve there makes even the worst ones in HK seem good. Here is the only place that does people from HK justice. The pork is moist, slightly chewy depending one which part, sweet. Just plain amazing, the nostalgia flowing through my mind with each bite. I love how the siu mei master makes his slightly sweeter than the ones in HK, making your hands slightly sticky if you touch it. The place even has an A health code rating so for the non Asian, don't freak out too much if they cut with their hands. All I can say is if you are from Hong Kong and you want a true taste of home and not some Americanized or half hearted effort, come here. I did, flew 3000 miles for this (not really, having a wedding). One thing to note, I think their side veg changes every now and then. I had some cabbage.

It's the second time I came this month, even though I know I should be coming here for lunch everyday. Yes, everyday!! the portions here live up to the hype, because words cannot express how much roast pork they actually give you. Sure, they give a decent amount of rice, but i guarantee you that the lunch special (only $3.75) will be more fulfilling than that chipotle bowl. The lines can get REALLY long; today i waited approximately 20 minutes for lunch! When you feel like splurging, get the big lunch special (three choices of meat with rice and vegetables). I bet you a lunch special that you can't finish it. super super big, super super filing, would definitely find myself back here weekly if my campus weren't so far away. Most affordable and tasty ratio lunch in chinatown. DO IT.
No comment

This place is amazing! $3.75 for a ton of tasty pork, rice and cabbage, two of us shared it and we were full. Had to queue for 5-10 minutes which is absolutely fine as you can watch it being prepared. Also very close to the metro station which is handy.
No comment

I was walking by to see what the long lines were for.  I ordered the chicken with rice for $4.  The food was totally overrated.  The chicken had a funny taste to it.  I took one bite and threw the rest out.
Dirt cheap, roast pork over rice. Good for take out. Their roast pork used to taste a lot better. Still good considering the prices today.
CHEAP AND DELICIOUS!!! What is better then that!?!?! I ordered roast pork, and roast duck over rice for like $6... That about sums it up...

This is fast, cheap, and no frills Cantonese bbq 烧味. Forget about the wonton noodles, and don't worry about finding a table inside because there are none. You get in line, and you either get a tray of meat or meat over rice (and cabbage) to go. As others have mentioned, you can fill yourself up on delicious meat for $5-7. The two types of pork, 烧肉 and 叉烧, were both very good. The former had just the right amount of fat and super crispy skin; the latter was caramelized just perfectly. In all honesty the 3 portion meat was probably enough for almost two people.

Delicious food at a jaw-dropping price. You really get your money for the amount of food he stuffs into that box. I got the roast BBQ pork with rice and veggies. Unfortunately, when I went, there were barely any veggies left.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Visiting NYC, and saw some cops in line here. Said they've been coming here for years. One of the secrets of Chinatown. A small pork, noodles, and rice is a LOT of food for $5.
Amazing restaurant for authentic ( at least to my knowledge) chinese barbecue for great prices!
No comment

No comment

Very tasty char siu here.  Very nice portion size. Well worth the price and wait.  They pack in the rice and meat into that small container.  Perfect portion for one person.  It comes with cabbage.  Go there !!
No comment

This little shop is a roast meat wonderland! The $5 roasted duck on rice is sooo good. Huge portion of meat and rice plus some greens. The duck meat is succulent with crispy skin. Next time I gonna try their beef ball soup and roasted pork. Unlike my other experiences in Manhattan's Chinatown, the employees of this place seem very nice.
No comment

After the many reviews, and Youtube videos I've seen on this place I had to go and try it. Ok, so I had to wait about 10mins in line. But I knew this place was going to be good because I passed by several Chinese restaurants on the way here and there weren't any lines..hehe. I ordered the chicken and duck with rice and cabbage. I also had a small amount of their green ginger sauce on the side. I wish I had more of the sauce. It took the meal to another level. The food was cheap and good. I was not disappointed. I will return whenever I'm back in the city again.
Amazing roast pork. The best I've ever had. And the cheapest. Line might be very long during peak times, but totally worth the way. Its takeout only too.
No comment
No comment

I am surprised at the ratings this place has gotten because IMO it's one of the most overrated places I have ever been to.  The roast pork is decent, but it's very fatty and not any better than a number of other restaurants within a few blocks of this place.  The people who work here are so obnoxious, that alone is reason enough never to come back.  They also put the pork in a Styrofoam container that doesn't seal, so by the time I was halfway down the block all of the sauce was out of the container and in the bottom of the bag.  There are a number of good places to buy roasted pork in Chinatown.  I am never going back to this dump ever again.

The best pork in chinatown. Prices are great! and portions are huge! This is a must try for a great meal. Line is long but for sure worth the weight.  I usually get the crispy pork, but the bbq pork and duck are also good.

Got the small pork rice veggie for 3.75. Delicious.  Wed. At 12:35 pm.  Line was just at the door and fast.  Great lunch option.  Need to try the duck and maybe some of the pork with the crispy skin.  Satisfied.
No comment

A bit disappointed after all the hype.  I got the roast pork and the duck.  Both were very fatty.  The skin of the duck was fat and bloated from oil, which should be crispy.  The roast pork was literally all fat with a sliver of meat.  I have to say it was cheap though...but I can't let that be an excuse for quality. I will come again to try to barbecue pork, which I feel like is their main specialty. Maybe next time I'll ask for a less fatty roast pork and try again.  As for the duck, I'll probably never order that again.
For 5 bucks you can get roast duck and bbq pork with rice.  Its a hefty sized portion and their bbq pork is the best i ever had!

Ordered the chicken and the pork.  The guy in front of me said not to order the duck- "it'll make you puke."  Not sure what the hype is about.  The price was good, food was decent but not deserving of the Yelp rating.  Will not make a special trip back for this.
No comment

No comment

So I've been here a bunch of times after my inital review....worthy of 5 stars. The roast pork is so damn tasty and as everyone else says, they PACK on the meat at a inexpensive price. The only very minor complaint is some of the meat is really fatty. Just found out you can ask for the delicious sauce to go!

Wah Fung is good but nothing special, main attraction is due to its low price and big portions. The lines are a bit long but it moves especially considering it's usually only 2 people working the counter. The employee cutting the meat, packing it up, and collecting money is usually the same person and no he doesn't take off his glove... but they are rated at an A. Overall decent food but good roast pork and most bang for your buck.
Our plates were $3.75 each and worth it my kids wanted to eat there everyday. The pork was the best. We had the chick, and duck but stick with the pork.
Awesome pork and duck over rice. Fulfilling and it's bang for your buck! Just don't forget to bring cash.

Had an incident here with what I suspect is one of those transplants that are growing in numbers here in NYC especially LES.  I noticed he and his ignorant friends were talking down to the cashier, and then out of the blue a chef came out with a meat cleaver in hand shouting in Chinese.  It was so crowded, the said Midwest guys tried to push their way thru the exit but couldn't get out  and they literally peed in their pants.  Swear to god.  Turns out the chef wasn't even talking to them, but yelling at another worker nearby.  It's cramped in there, food's good.

Tried the roast pork and roast pig, both over rice with cooked cabbage. Roast pork is quite good. Roast pig is really good, altho some parts were a bit salty for my taste. Both were a great deal at 3.75 and 5.50 respectively. Will go back for the roast pig.

Great value - $5 for roast duck over rice, and the portion was so generous this will be 2 meals. Complete hole in the wall storefront, people who work here are friendly and tolerant if you don't speak Chinese. Agree with what people say about the wait--when I got here there were 3 people in front of me, and I waited about 10 minutes. By the time I left, the line was about 12 people long.
Great Chinese style roast meat. They are very tasty and the pricing is unbelievably more than REASONABLE. I cannot figure how they can earn money from this business.
My go to place whenever I am in mood for some barbecue pork, roasted pork and roasted duck. Absolutely delicious and never disappoint me.

I speak Cantonese and can easily navigate around.  I go to Chinatown a lot and BBQ pork is sold everywhere!  I used to get it from Wing Wong or Big Wong but after visiting Wah Fung, this is my recommended spot for it!  Just the little hidden gem that focuses on the BBQ stuff.  Nothing fancy, not a sit down place, just simply good, quick, cheap take out food.

My dad told me about this place. The food here is amazing The prices they have you can't beat and the portions they give you are excellent. There roast pork is out of this world and its worth the wait to spite the long lines sometimes. Every time I go in to Chinatown I got to stop by that place.
No comment
No comment
Good pork. Good duck.  And you simply can't beat the price.

If anything, I'll give five stars just for the owner. I used to frequent his food cart when he was stationed at the corner of Bowery and Elizabeth. He didn't sell his bestseller in his food cart back then but he was still insanely popular. He would have lines down the block as well. He is incredibly hard working and extremely kind. His cart disappeared for a bit and then news spread that he now has a storefront. His old offerings (usual food cart fare) was in the back. And the rice boxes were in the front. It was so cheap a few years ago and it was still delicious. Now the price has increased a bit but it's still delicious. Don't expect it to be fine dining. This is good comfort food. The lines are insane but for the price and knowing how hard the owner works, it's definitely worth it.
Came for the duck, fell in love with the roast pig! Definitely going back.
No comment

I have come here about 5 times ever, and each time I am surprised by the portions that they give.  Very generous, even for the $3.75 lunch special - veggies, rice, and pork or chicken.  there is so much roast pork, and it is delicious!  perfect flavor, and they pour a little bit of the sauce on top of the rice, which makes it amazing.  i love this place.  don't love the occasional long line, but if you're not in too much of a hurry it is entirely worth it.
No comment
No comment
If you're on a budget and want a small meal to go this is your place, my only issues are the long lines and how the meat tends to be more fatty and lean.
I memorized my order in Chinese and walked in confidently with cash in hand. But after I ordered, the guy responded to me in Chinese and I didn't understand a single phrase. My cover was blown.

Hands down one of the best and most authentic Chinese  takeout place in chinatown, typical Chinese family run shop that has been in business for many years. The roasted pork is amazing! The $5 portion is HUGE. It can feed two persons almost! The lines is generally long throughout the day and they close very early! Every time I waited I always think to myself "why can they get another person to help out?!"  I guess in that case they might have to charge more to cover the cost! This place is really worth trying and waiting for!
$5 for a halal-sized box of rice; you can't get better value than this.
No comment

They're cheap!! Yes you can get a small order of roast pork over rice and a lil veggie in an overflowing container but that's it. A lot of quantity, but sadly no quality. I waited over half hr to try their food but its just hype. The roast pork had absolutely NO flavor at all, all the "supposed" flavor was in the gravy which was oily as hell. There are so much better places in chinatown to get roast pork aka Noodletown, Big Wong on Mott St...just to name a few. Also tried their BBQ chix leg and thigh and lets just say that my dog and stray cat wouldn't even touch it. They prefer BJs roasted chix!!! Pls save your time and your $ and look for another place.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is overrated... The roast is ok, but not the best you can find in Chinatown. It's food is cheap, I'll give you that but it's got no flavor. The crispy roast pork gets soggy and soft when you buy take out and bring it home. The soy sauce chicken legs are so bland in taste as well. For good Cantonese BBQ, try Big Wong on Mott st, or Wing Wong on Mott st, now that authentic BBQ.. And they make a green supposedly ginger scallion sauce, but with no ginger??? What's the deal with that??
