Took the wife and lil brother in law here for dinner. It's a great vibe and I would recommend the mushroom GARGANELLI!.... It's the best pasta and all the other ones are inferior... Gods honest truth.
No comment
Mushroom pizza was good and big enough for 2. Brussels sprouts over cooked but still not crispy. Service was good. Overall good value for money
No comment
No comment

Great spot! We went to the Bryant park location, which is unassuming from the exterior, but the inside was beautiful. We had the choice of sitting in the front or back, so we choice a booth in the back. We ordered the burrata to start, which was delicious - even the toasted bread was perfect. We split the meatballs and the cacio e Pepe and both are things I would order again. La Pecora Bianca is reasonably priced and delicious - would go back!

Great experience at La Pecora Bianca. We walked in on a Wednesday night and after a few minutes of waiting, we were able to grab two seats at the bar. The ambiance was perfect for bar seating! I started with an Aperol Spritz. From there, my friend and I split the whipped ricotta (highly recommend!!) for a starter and the cacio e pepe and tagliatelle for mains. Everything we ate tasted SO good. Will definitely return next time I'm in NYC.
Italian place definitely worth going back to.  Wild mushroom garganelli, and olive oil cake.  A+.
No comment

Came here with my friend during a weekday lunch who said this was his favorite Italian spot in the city. After trying it, I'd say this is definitely one of the best Italian food places I've had. First of all, the ambiance is so bright and modern, I didn't mind the seating being so close to other folks. I had the mushroom pesto pasta with burrata on top and it was absolutely amazing. The pasta was cooked so well, the sauces so creamy, and the cheese on top really tied it together. Highly recommend.

I can here for a work dinner the other night and everyone thoroughly enjoyed the meal. We made a reservation in advance - highly recommend doing so, as it's very busy at night. The server was a very nice Irish man who gave good drink suggestions! We ordered a round of drinks for the table and had the zucchini fritters and cacio e pepe bites for apps. Everyone in the group ordered different pastas - I chose the bucatini and it was delicious. The dessert menu is limited but tasty. We ordered the budini and it was the perfect sweet note to end the night. The restaurant is also very cute- nice ambience, albeit loud, but lots of seating available. Will definitely be back!

The food was non-negotiable. The vodka pasta with burrata? Slay! The salads? Slay! The Brussel sprouts?! WERK! The food came out fast and speedy. Fierce! Low lighting, fancy ambiance. This location is full of a lot of rich people. Slay?? Not really. I love diverse restaurants to give me stories. Our waitress was fine. Sla- just kidding haha. The bathrooms were not fancy. Didn't fit the theme hunnyyy I like a PORCELAIN throne to piss on. What took the last star from this, though, was really, honestly, quite literally...the hostess at the front. Rude! Like girl...how hard is it to add one more to a three person rez? 4 person tables are mathematic. Thanks a lot lady
No comment
No comment

One of the top italian places in nyc! And their tiramisu has the cutest sheep face on it. Got their famous rigatoni w/o burrata, brussels sprout, meatballs, and ending w tiramisu (so huge). All were perfect.

Pasta lunch here was delicious. I had the gramignaz which was incredible. My dining partner had the tagliatelle and equally delicious. Docking a star because I think the price point is a little high for lunch, but maybe I am out of touch with NYC prices now (and inflation, ouchie).
Good food, fairly quick service, a boisterous ambiance, and overall great experience.
Food, Service and Ambiance amazing! Nice centrally located area as well. The host was so kind he offered to charge my phone while I was eating..:)

Our hotel recommended this restaurant to us as it was within walking distance and we wanted Italian food. It's modern and very busy. We had the lamb pasta and pizza. I enjoyed the food, but my husband wasn't too impressed. If you like soggy pizza in the middle and a crispy crust then this is the place for you. They have a lot of servers and the place was buzzing. The person that brought us to our table was miserable and barely said a word to us until I said thank you, which woke her up and startled her a little. There's lots of great reviews for this place, but we were underwhelmed, unfortunately it wasn't for us.
No comment
No comment

This place is SO good I had it twice in the same weekend! I stayed at the Park terrace hotel next door to their Bryant location and ordered a Margherita pizza to go. Pizza crust was so fluffy and perfectly doughy and the ingredients tasted so fresh! The next day I went back for lunch with my family we tried their pastas. The penne vodka and the garganelli were incredible! Pasta was cooked to perfection and of course we had to add the burrata on top. Service was fast and the restaurant was beautiful!
No comment
No comment

I've been to a number of the locations. Generally, the food is fantastic. I've visited the Bryant Park location a few times now and I can safely say the staff there may be some of the most unpleasant staff I've ever come across. It's rare that restaurant staff will treat you like your business is a complete inconvenience, but in the few times I've visited that location I can safely say that they've never displayed any form of a pleasant attitude towards their customers.  I'd suggest going to the Meatpacking or Soho location for better service.

Tried and true. This is my fourth time here and it's my new go-to recommendation for anyone visiting, looking for a business lunch/dinner or just wanting takeout. The meatballs are the best and so is the homemade rigatoni aka vodka with burrata on top.

I was a bit hesitant to try this place because its a chain, but it def exceeded my expectations. I had the lavender spritz cocktail which was delicious. The calamari and Cacio e Pepe fritters were also amazing, and the whipped ricotta was to die for. All of the pasta dishes were tasty and perfectly prepared. We had the tiramisu for dessert, which was huge and also so so good! Excited for the UES location, I'll be a regular guest for sure!

Came with a party of about 12 and we got split up into 2 tables seated next to each other. I ordered the Rigatoni and thought it was a very solid pasta dish! The vodka sauce is perfectly creamy, and I loved the cheese topping. A couple of my friends got the Garganelli so I was able to try that too, and I actually enjoyed it over the Rigatoni so next time I'm coming, I'd probably order that one! One friend also got the Toscano salad and added salmon to it, I thought it was also a great dish. Perfect if you want something lighter for your meal! We got 1 order of the Local Burrata as an appetizer and I loved the burrata paired with the sweet figs. Highly recommend and will def be coming back here soon!
Food was absolutely delicious. I feel it was competitive pricing also. Our waiter (who was very tall!) was very kind and was keeping up with our needs very well. Would definitely go back.

Great for a business lunch or dinner or to recommend for tourists in the area. Delicious food and good wine selection. I was particularly impressed considering the location and that it's sort of a NYC chain. Get the curly pasta or the cacio e Pepe.
No comment
Great fresh pasta and service wonderful. Really cute place and a nice place to go even solo in the city.

I always get the rigatoni, it's one of my favorite pastas in the city. The tiramisu "for two" is okay but it is ginormous - could easily feed an army. Ambiance is nice. It's a good pick if you're having a hard time getting a res at more popular Italian spots.

One night in New York City after a long day of traveling on the train to NYC to watch the Hamilton matinee play, we had to find a descent restaurant for dinner, fast. It had to be near our hotel by the NYC main library & we found this very nice Italian restaurant just a block away, perfect location. We were a party of 6 including 2 kids.  It was great that we were able to get reservations online on a Saturday night, in "the greatest city in the world", Hamilton.  La Percora Bianca was able to satisfy appetite of all ages.  The food was super delicious & the kids were happy with pizza.  It was pretty good for adults too.  For appetizer we ordered the Zucchini Fries.  The adults ordered Gramigna, Spaghetti with Pomodoro sauce, Chicken Milanese & Linguini with clam sauce.  All the dishes were authentic Italian & super tasty. One dish Gramigna, curly pasta dish was outstanding.  It tasted just like we were in Italy.  They did not have a good selection of drinks or cocktails, otherwise it would have been a 5 star review.  Service was great & location was awesome.  if you're in Manhattan, near 41st & 5th avenue, I highly recommend La Pecora Bianca.  Don't forget Online reservation.
Great food. Attentive service.  Nice atmosphere. Note you have to request bread for the table.

The service at La Pecora was spot on and friendly without being overwhelming.  My pasta with a meat sauce was seasoned well.  The lemon ricotta cheese was richly flavored and worth every bite.  You can also grab a drink and they serve the usuals and a few with a fun Italian twist.  Overall, it is a pleasant dining experience.
No comment

Whipped ricotta was 3.5/5 - a little bland , but the bread was tasty. Brussels salad was well seasoned and very tasty - 4/5. Gramigna - 3.5/5 dominant flavor is pesto. Could've used a little spice. Rigatoni - 4.5/5 best dish on the menu! I would've preferred a protein on it, but very flavorful. Scallops - 5/5 I really liked the flavor and that it wasn't overly carb heavy. Really great! Tiramisu was HUGE! Definitely enough for at least 4 people.
Went for gluten free pasta. Nice to have options. But it was just O.K.  Nothing to write home about. But I appreciate the fresh options. Really good gf is just hard to come by

No comment

Was walking around Bryant Park this Saturday morning looking for somewhere to eat breakfast and noticed that this new spot. We entered the restaurant not knowing what to expect but it has a cool midtown type ambiance (high ceilings, lots of lighting) and the menu looked pretty good so we decided to give it a shot. We started with the olive oil coffee cake which we split; it was fine but really didn't have much flavor and I would not order again. We both had the Baked Eggs, which was recommended by the server and was delicious. The Baked Eggs comes with spicy tomato sauce, pancetta, and parmesan and a side arugula salad. The space was fairly big so I'd be curious to see how the vibe is at night.
No comment

I have been to all the locations of this restaurant in Manhattan and this is by far the best. The ambiance is luxurious, the waiters are attentive and the food is delicious. This is the perfect spot for a date night or a dinner with friends. Highly recommend.
No comment
No comment

My apartment favorite for a special occasion or a pick me up!  Burgers, calamari, meatballs, branzini, basil spaghetti, and all options will give you a little touch of Italia in Bryant Park Midtown Manhattan. If you get a Negroni or Old Fashioned it makes for a special time!

We liked it here very much. Too rich (perhaps in multiple ways) to come here regularly, but very nice for a special occasion. The service is top notch. It was meticulous without being fussy, with the servers taking cues from the diners as to how much attention they wished. The food was good, very good. We had pasta and in retrospect I think a family style approach would have been better, if we had ordered pasta, salad, a vegetable and then shared them. Then our meal would have been more balanced and not too excessive. The tiramisu is suitable for 4 people or more. We were 3 people and ate about half. But I was able to slip it into the takeaway container without destroying the little sheep's face! Win!
No comment
No comment

Four and a half stars, actually. A group of twenty, we had a private room downstairs. There is a freight elevator available, but we weren't told that, making a couple in our group with bad knees walk the long staircase. Our drinks order was taken quickly.  My old fashioned was superb. Plates were served to the table, not to individuals, which worked well. Appetizers of roasted cauliflower a bit overdone, but tasty; calamari okay, not great; eggplant very good, as was local burrata. For main courses we were served scallops (4 per plate a little chintzy) which were good, strip steak (average), and braised pork (excellent). For dessert we were served tiramisu (excellent), and olive oil cake (good). Cappuccino excellent. Service was great, friendly, timely. A little work is needed here and there,  but this was an excellent evening of dining. Recommended.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. The rigatoni with vodka sauce is my absolute favorite and their brussel sprouts are also to die for. If you have room left in you (or even if you don't) the tiramisu is a must. The atmosphere is pretty relaxed and the lighting is on the darker side. The service has always been great
No comment

I was so excited about this restaurant because I heard amazing things about it. The food was great but the service was HORRIBLE. We were the first to sit at the table and a couple next to us came and sat down shortly after us but our waiter didn't serve us she served them. We didn't mind but it took her 10 minutes after catering to them to get our order. Our appetizer comes out I asked her if we can get more bread she said sure but was hesitant. By this time its been 20 minutes and we have not received our bread or seen her. Our entree comes out and not once did she even acknowledge us but asks the table next to us multiple time if their food was good or if they needed a refill or anything, but she never once came to our table after taking our order. I work in hospitality and I never complain because I know it's overwhelming when working somewhere that is short staffed. But for her to not make effort and purposely ignore us while catering towards a table who is sitting right next to us is absolutely ridiculous.

Like, WOW. Where do I begin? The greeter (host), to wait staff to the superb food offerings. We decided to stop by on a whim and so glad we did. Great portion size in my opinion. The atmosphere is very nice, but even not unwelcoming or stuffy. I would highly recommend visiting this restaurant. Oh, don't forget to get the Olive Oil Cake - the best of the best!!
No comment
Frankie was amazing! Such a great bartender, his recommendations were delicious and he was phenomenal!!

Wow! A really delicious meal - I highly recommend the whipped ricotta appetizer! The portion smallest are a bit small, but I am used to Italian grandmother portions, so take that with a grain of Parmesan. A lovely wine menu as well.
No comment
No comment
No comment
I had dinner with colleagues one evening. Delicious food and wonderful service! I would plan to return. The restaurant is very nice decorated as well.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I have mixed feelings about this place. It was a cute restaurant. We were able to make a same day reservation which was great. We arrived early and were seated right away. Advice right off the bat - if it is cold outside (it was 37° when we went) DO NOT let them seat you anywhere near the door. Every time someone opened that door we were blasted with ice cold air. I had to put my coat and scarf back on while we were dining, which I would not usually do but it was just freezing with the door constantly opening. We got the meatball appetizer. I would consider the meatballs and sauce to be average. I ordered the tagliagelle pasta and it was fantastic. I ate every bite. My husband got the strip steak and said it was mediocre. Service left a lot to be desired. My husband was half way through his steak before they brought him a steak knife. He also had fries with his steak and was not offered anything like ketchup for them. He was also never offered a refill of the tiny glass of soda they brought him.  While I really enjoyed my entree I don't think we would return here.

A cute restaurant with great ambiance, delicious food and reasonable price. Found this place via Resy as I was trying to make a reservation for a Sunday morning brunch with friends visiting from Texas. I was immediately attracted by their cute white sheep logo and the interior design from the pictures posted by others online. The Bryant park location was spacious and beautifully decorated. We ordered a bunch of appetizers, love the meatballs, burrata (with figs), zucchini fries and roasted cauliflower. The quality was awesome,great combination of the ingredients and tasted fresh. For mains, me and one of my friends ordered pasta, really love the sauce and the texture of the pasta, flavorful and chewy. For dessert, we ordered the tiramisu for 4, it came with a cute sheep on the top, super creamy and smooth. The waiters and waitresses were welcoming and attentive. Overall, we were very happy about the dining experience.
This is one of the nicer restaurant in midtown. If you have lunch meetings, I would recommend this place. The food is delicious, and the space is also very nice.

I understand if a restaurant is busy or the staff is overwhelmed, but when you deliberately ignore us and knowingly provide poor service, it's on the server and poor management. We asked for more bread for our appetizer, since you can't eat spoonfuls of just cheese... our server didn't like that request and never returned to our table until I had to track her down for the bill. No water, no drinks, no "how is everything." I would expect better service at Olive Garden.
Amazing food, everything from apps to mains to drinks was simply amazing, truly enjoyed the cauliflower app and Branzino were amazing !

a pleasant italian restaurant that serves well as a fallback option. large open space with solid italian in a convenient location. if you're looking for amazing italian, would not recommend but if you're in the area needing a solid option that won't have a long wait, this is a good place to go
No comment
Love this spot for anything. Add their Buratta to all of the pasta dishes and you will not be disappointed. Staff is very nice too.

Pastas are mid. I've heard so much hype around this place from online reviews and Tiktok so I was super excited. But once I tried their pastas, I was very underwhelmed. Tagliatelle tastes literally like Spaghetti-os. Rigatoni was bland. If you had to get one thing, just get the burger. Any other local NYC Italian restaurant would have been better.
No comment

This is a good spot for groups, get togethers or a date. The food is good quality and the service is good! For apps - the fried cheese, calamari and meatballs are all excellent. If you're having pasta - you must have the vodka pasta. It's excellent. The chicken Milanese is excellent as well.
Delicious! Every. Freaking. Time!!! The food is always so good and so easy to get a table given the various locations. Always a good time whether it's date night or dinner with the girls.

I'm not sure what to rate this place of business. I made reservations and when I came in they told me to sit at the bar until a table was ready. When I was seated I was right by the door and couldn't really enjoy my food because of how cold it was. My pasta had potential of being really good but because it got cold I had to get out of there. The meatballs were great. If you get the chance to go I would recommend the meatballs and rigatoni

the service was poor. we had to wait a while to order and had to wait to be seated even though we had a reservation. the atmosphere was decent but not spectacular and providing a link to a spotify code when the music isnt really noticeable is kind of funny. 85 dollars for a pasta, an appetizer, and a dessert is ridiculously expensive. the pasta was underwhelming at best, and the appetizers were decent but not great. pizzas are not included in the 85 dollar price and we were not given the option to order off the normal menu. a complete 50 dollar meal being upcharged to 85. the chocolate cake is tiny, picture included and the included cherries do not taste fresh. the tiramisu is all cream, the olive oil cake is alright but not great. everything tasted like something you could either make or get for a lot cheaper in other places. cut the price or provide a better value.

Excellent. Outstanding service and the ONLY place open at 9:30 PM on a Monday in the area.  The burrata with nuts and honey was out of this world. The chicken millanese was pounded super thin and enough for like three people.  In Rome you must do as the Romans do so I tried the olive oil cake. Was way better than I thought.  However---I'll go with chocolate in the future. Wasn't an option though and the tirimisu was in like a TUREEN.  Seriously in a mixing bowl.  Nothing this good exists in Chicago sadly.
No comment

Had an amazing anniversary dinner with my husband here. Everything from the service to the ambiance to the food was impeccable. The manager, Rebecca, went above and beyond to make our evening memorable with champagne to kick off our celebration, wine tastings, and dessert.
A great lunch!  Excellent location. Excellent food.  Good service. Pleasant ambience. Looking forward to another visit.
Can't wait to go back. The meatballs are the best I've ever had. Bar staff was kind, considerate, and efficient. A rare gem in our current climate.
Great drinks, great food, prompt service, and a good atmosphere. The homemade pasta and margarita pizza were a must try
Didn't have reservations so they put us in basement.. that being said try the whipped ricotta with honey and country toast. Pasta was delicious.
First time here. Their meatballs are so good and the Brussel sprout salad...omg so good! Would be back

Was so excited to come here with my girlfriend. Heard so many great reviews about it and have never been more disappointed in a dining experience in my entire life. Appetizers were good but the pasta was the worst pasta I have ever had. Would not recommend anyone to come here, purely a tourist trap. Save your money and go to any other italian place.
The pasta was good, but the price was high and the portions small. Our waitress was helpful and pleasant.
some of the best Italian food I've ever had. Amazing service!! Will definitely be coming back!
No comment
Delicious food and generous portion! Couldn't even finish my pasta. Highly recommend the asparagus. Great service. Nice atmosphere. Worth every penny.
We ordered rigatoni pasta, it came so late and it was super cold. The princess was too high and the portion was too little.

Delicious pastas and calamari. The tiramisu was to die for and I can't stop thinking about it. It was $18 for two to share, the portion was huge and the 2 of us did finish it. The place was full and very crowded but I guess it's NYC. We sat in the library which is the basement and rather dark. Next time I will return specifically for the Tiramisu and request a table on the ground level. unfortunately, there was no outdoor seating.
best home made pasta and beautiful atmosphere. the service was very friendly and helpful. drinks were also tasty and unique. they allow you to switch out any pasta shape with any sauce.

Thought dinner was a 5. Pasta was out of this world. We got two of the rigatoni with vodka and also got a branzino that was one of the best I've been had. Crispy. Not oily. Flavorful. Ambiance is really nice. Not casual at all but wouldn't say fancy. The zucchini chip appetizers were crispy and delicious and the whipped ricotta app was delectable. Sweet with warm toast. Perfect. This was a last minute spot and they crushed it. Would come back in a heartbeat.

I made a reservation at the Bryant Park location for a girl's brunch and I was blown away by the service and atmosphere. I was not aware that this place was fancy and was worried I was underdressed. I was here on a Friday afternoon and it was packed! The service was impeccable, they definitely know how to do hospitality. There was a table next to me (the table was a bit close to me, but everyone had to be vaxxed to eat at this location), and the table returned an appetizer due to a health concern and shortly after the manager came by to ask what was wrong and if they could do anything to turn around the experience. When I observed this, I was blown away because not a lot of restaurants do that! Even if it was just a health concern/allergy that the person wasn't even upset with, they still checked in on the customer. As for the food, the pasta I had was delicious and I had the olive oil cake which I have been hunting down for since I had a friend that shared an olive oil cake slice. The place is super clean, very elegant and the staff is super friendly. I highly recommend this location if you are in the Bryant Park, Times Square area and want a nice lunch with the family, girlfriends or even a business lunch with a client. It is right next to Bryant Park which is great for all the summer and winter activities! Bravooo!!!
No comment

Loved their zuchini fries and Toscano salad! Their pastas were really good too! We had Bucatini, Rigatoni and Garganelli. And my fav was Garganelli, but everything was really good. Will def go back again.

I've been to this place three times and the first two it was perfectly fine, nothing special, but the last time was just horrible. I went in with a group of four friends - we had a reservation - and they seated us quickly, which was nice. Once we went to order, the waitress pointedly asked one of my friends, who had ordered a FULL MAIN as her meal, if that would be enough food and that she should get an appetizer (to be clear, none of the rest of us ordered appetizers or received this comment). My friend was flustered and agreed... and ended up being served at least 3x the amount of food of the rest of us, which she couldn't finish. When she asked for a box, our server literally rolled her eyes at her and begrudgingly obliged. The server spent the entire second half of the meal being incredibly rude to all of us in general, rolling her eyes a ton - and to the point where we were all commenting on it because we were so shocked at the behavior. The server also brought us still instead of tap water, which we hadn't asked for, and ended up charging us $27 for WATER ALONE. Finally, we wanted to order desert for the table. When my same friend went to order, the waitress again asked her if she thought that would be enough because the dish was very small while glaring rudely AGAIN!! - As if this poor girl hadn't just been forced into ordering an appetizer she didn't want, couldn't finish her main, and now just wanted a bite of a dessert that we were planning to share. The waitress was clearly trying to make a larger tip off of us by forcing us to order more, and we left shocked at the behavior. Will not be returning. Ever.
Great service great food and super nice environment!!! Been wanting to try their pasta for months and it didn't disappoint
No comment
Loved this location. Dined alone and felt very comfortable. The food was good but not great.
Came here for my birthday dinner last night and had the best time. Our server, Enrique took great care of us. Food was absolutely delicious!

Group visited for brunch before going across the street to Bryant Park Winter Village. Our table enjoyed the Burrata (ask for extra bread!) Mushroom frittata, lemon ricotta pancakes, French toast and eggs.  Portions were not huge but everything was in $20ish price range and tasty. Several locations around the city to enjoy.
This place was absolutely amazing!! The zucchini fries were the best we've ever had. The homemade pasta was to die for. And the cappuccino was excellent! We will def be coming back 10/10

The food was delicious.  The veggie appetizer was a delightful surprise and the tiramisu we had for dessert was amazing.  The only downside was the cold air that came in every time a patron entered (or left) the restaurant.  So if you can get a table away from the door or visit when the weather is warmer, I recommend it highly!

I'm very much not a fan of this restaurant. The food is fine - nothing crazy, but always decent. However, I have never had a positive experience with a server (across two locations). Most notably, this restaurant is very difficult and inflexible when it comes to dietary restrictions. I have a dairy allergy and have run into many challenges with getting a meal that meets my needs given the inflexibility of the servers and the menu. Further, the servers are often downright rude - I've gotten very negative reactions from servers when questioning about my allergy, and our sever last night completely forgot our appetizer and was disrespectful when we questioned about how long the food was taking. I definitely would not recommend this restaurant (at any location) and have no intention of returning again.
Beautiful place, amazing food, and friendly staff. I recommend this place! We had some cocktails and pasta.

I Visited La Pecora in Bryant Park, today, December 11th, for a Christmas lunch with my daughters and their friends.  I was very disappointed with the service.  We waited over an hour for our food and they forgot our appetizers and delivered them after our entrees.  I would have been willing to accept slower service because it is Christmas in New York, but, when the waiter came back to fill our water he dropped my glasses of water and it shattered all over our food and table.  I was soaking wet and my daughter's friend sat on a piece of glass and ripped her tights. They cleaned up the food that was wet but never brought us new water.  As an apology for the spill and shattered glass they offered us two single scoops of gelato to share between 5 of us.  I decided to complain to the other manager and after he asked the server what happened, he came back to the table with the impression that we caused the spill.  In the end I explained that it was the server, not us that spilled the water and broke the glass and he ended up comping our dinner.  I understands that accidents happen and that places are busy at Christmas time, what was unacceptable was: 1. The server placed blame on us for the spill and broken glass 2. Our water was never replaced so we had no drinks and the glass was never cleaned up from around my seat and the water with glass in it was never removed.  Very disappointed in this experience!  Additionally, the female manager, Rea - (she would not give us her name loud enough for us to hear) did not assist in solving the problem, after the accident, the team scattered and left us to fend for ourselves, we sat at 2:45 and did not leave the restaurant until 4:50.

Loved everything about this special restaurant ! We had a delightful lunch, with a amazing staff .  From the general manager to our server, we were so happy we stopped and took a chance to enjoy a beautiful Italian meal !

Clean simple Italian food done very well.  The whipped ricotta has become an addiction for me.  The cacio e pepe was fantastic; yes it's a simple dish you can make at home...but this is better by a large margin.  The olive oil cake was awesome as well
The tiramisu is bussin. The fries are bussin too. Follow my friend @thomsonxlee on Instagram!

One of my favorite restaurants and it's great for vegetarians! We got the Garganelli, vodka rigatoni, cacio e pepe, brocollini, Brussel sprouts, tiramisu, and lattes. Everything was made to perfection. Loved the ambience too. Can't wait to go back!
I visited their Bryant Park location with a large party. Excellent food and great cocktails. Manager Kevin and waitress Edna provided impeccable service. Will be going again.
have been to every location in the city. they never end. also a go to spot for some great pasta and good wine. highly recommend the penne vodka

This place caught my eye when I walked by on the other side of the street because it looked so nicely decorated inside, with its warm tones beckoning me through the window on a rainy chilly evening. We came back later the same evening to try it and found the food was equally appealing. The vodka sauce rigatoni was excellent, and so was the chicken milanese (I personally especially liked the salad that came on the plate with the chicken). The service was also fully acceptable with no shortcomings. Although it wasn't super quiet inside, it was not bad at all and we could pretty easily hear each other when talking. There are many other things on the menu we'd like to try, so we hope to come back again.
Wouldn't let me get chicken on my salad for dinner. Apparently that's only a "brunch option". Ridiculous. How hard is it to put chicken on a salad? Stupid at irs

All I can say is that the food was mediocre at best. We were a table of 8, for a birthday dinner on a sunday night. We had a reservation so we were seated immediately but they stopped us on the way in because we had cake. I asked them if they could hold onto it for us while we were eating dinner and asked if we could celebrate with the cake after dinner. They said there was a cake cutting fee of $5 per person..... and even if "cut" it ourselves, there's a fee for even if we want to eat it in the restaurant. We ended up not having cake together because we had already ordered an overpriced meal per person and a bottle of wine. The food was okay but it definitely was NOT good enough to be priced that high. I got a brussel salad and their most popular rigatoni which there are plenty of pictures on here. The rigatoni was just normal and there wasn't anything special that made it stand out. The brussel salad was fine too, the sauce and taste overall was a bit strong and I didn't like that the raisins were pickled but that's just me. We had a pizza to share in the middle and it was not hot at all, it was a cooled down temperature with a super thin middle and thick crust. Not my preference but maybe others like their pizzas like that .... To each their own I guess. Overall, the servers weren't too attentive even though we had clearly been one of the larger tables and one of the only tables celebrating a birthday. In the past, I have been to so many more restaurants have made efforts to make a birthday dinner that much more special because we chose to have it at their restaurant. I just remember leaving the restaurant feeling unsatisfied and disappointed by everything-- especially the fact that they don't have bread as an appetizer!!! One of the best parts of an Italian restaurant is the yummy bread with olive oil and balsamic and LPB did not have it at all. Not even available to order as a side. So disappointing and mediocre.

What a great dining experience! My daughter and I shared a bottle of their own label dry rose; it was a perfect accompaniment to our very different shared entrees.  The branzino with Swiss chard was a winner - lemony and salty/savory with the addition of capers. Our other choice was the tagliatelle - also delicious.  The only complaint is that the serving dishes should have been hot. The food cooled down too quickly. We also ordered a side of the roasted Brussel sprouts.  These were amazing! For dessert we shared the tiramisu for two - delicious but really can feed four or five people! (Not complaining - lol - enjoyed the leftovers the next day) Finally ended with an espresso martini - best one ever! This is a very convenient location close to GCT. We will definitely be back!
Best tiramisu in New York City. Made for lots of people so bewatre. Location by Bryant park is perfect

Stuck in a pandemic, many places closed.  LPB is near where I was staying and now I feel like it is family.  Travis, Sean and Selene (the Manager) have been extraordinary hosts.  At a time when it would be easy for people to be distracted with their own concerns, they have all gone out of their way, over and above what I expected, to make me comfortable and a valued customer.  Thank you to all of the staff especially in these trying times.
The manager called and was super gracious.  I have not yet taken up on offer to revisit restaurant, but I will.

Absolutely orgasmic. Hailed over a waiter after sitting down, because we knew exactly what we wanted. The food came in TEN minutes...we gasped. Utter disbelief. We debated over ordering the brussel sprouts...oh were we glad we did. Leaving satisfied. Will be thinking about this meal until the next time I go, and my expectations are raised once again. #dontsettle #pasta #isserafinareallythatgood

This place is top notch, we came here yesterday from Ct to bring our daughter to a dance school by the time she got out and back to the hotel we were not going to make our reservation, so they moved it 45min. When we got there the place was packed yet they sat us within a minute, shortly after seated we were in between two large groups,  it was very hard for us to hear our selves, the manager voluntarily came over to us and said we are completely booked but we have two upcoming reservations if either don't show we will move you! I was surprised and appreciated the gesture but thought that's all it would be when a few minutes later I look and he is come over and says let's move you!! Just grab your drinks we will take care of everything else and we followed him upstairs to a completely different section, sat down our food followed, he interdicted us to our new server and quietly walked off. It was seamless, uninterrupting and and he made us feel very comfortable like it was no bother rather it was his pleasure. To top it all off the food was excellent and service throughout the night was on point. In a world that is having severe help problems this restaurant has figured out how to master their craft.......
Fabulous new addition to the Bryant Park area. Exquisite setting, superb service, and an authentic Italian menu. First-rate in every respect.

I went to this place for the first time last night and had a wonderful time! I sat at the bar and got the delicious vodka pasta. Our bartender (I think his name was Sean) was very attentive and served us yummy drinks all night! I didn't see any drinks on the menu that I was interested in but Sean asked what spirit we liked and crafted us our own scrumptious cocktails!
What a great restaurant. We ordered the Borata, the Tuscana salad and thr garganelli pasta-it was AMAZING. So good. Highly recommended.

I saw this place in a TikTok while planning a trip to NY and decided to give it a go. We had a 5 o'clock reservation but got there at 4:45 and were seated immediately. The staff was attentive and were all walking around checking in everyone, they were not short staffed but at one point the hostess was even coming around to make sure everyone was doing alright. Food came out quick and was absolutely delicious, by far the best burrata i've ever had. We got the tiramisu and asked them to put a candle in it for a birthday and they were happy to do so. The sheep on the top was so cute! Overall the food was so delicious we actually came back the next night. Again, we had a 5 o'clock reservation that we were early for and we were seated 20 min early. Our server from the previous night recognized us and came over to chat with us and thank us for coming back. He ended up bringing us a slice of the olive oil cake back for free. The cake was delicious, just like everything else, and it was really nice to have such friendly waiters that would do that type of thing for us. Best food and best service i've had in an extremely long time and I will definitely be coming back here next time I come to the city.

Was excited to have dinner here last night. Reservation at 8pm. Calamari appetizer was good and came out at a reasonable time. The busier then wanted to take the unfinished plate away because "food was coming out". Well food didn't come out for at least another 30 mins! Manager came and apologized for it being late and we got another bottle of Pelligrino. Then the pizza came with the other dishes about 10 mins after that. The homemade pasta dishes were great and pasta Al dente. Meatballs seasoned well and juicy as well as the Brussels sprouts seasoned well and crispy. Our waiter did not come to our table after taking our order to check on us, nor to update us on our order. He did only after the food came with a "buon appetito"!! Tho the food was good, the service was very lacking. It was a very beautiful environment, ambiance, decorated, etc., but the wait staff did not welcome you enthusiastically as some other places did.  You would think especially after this pandemic, people welcome being back in operation and working and want costumers to come in! Sorry, I would not be able to recommend this spot.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

GREAT drinks, nice menu selection, plenty of seating, good vibes, reasonable prices! Becoming one of my go to spots for a drink date or friend meetup. One of the best bars in the neighborhood for cocktails if not the best.

The place is really pretty. The bar and bathroom are beautiful. They had the heaters on too high when we were there so we were melting. I got an amaretto sour and it was fantastic. I didn't order any food but I would go back. The bartender was friendly.

What a pretty bar. Great drinks. Well decorated. Not overly crowded. Also a bar that's staffed well. Im used to seeing one bartender manning the entire bar so this was a pleasant surprise. Ken will make you an off menu cocktail if you ask nicely. We'll be back for sure!
Too loud average food.  Great. If you love packed places. I definitely didn't enjoy myself and will not be going back to many other great places in New York to enjoy.
No comment
No comment
Varied options of food and cocktails. Everything we ordered was great. Very good service. Nice atmosphere. Two thumbs up.
No comment
The staff was great and fun to talk to. The food, drinks, and ambiance were on point.

If only I could give 6 stars to this place because it has it all, great service, amazing food and the atmosphere is nice. Cocktails are lovely and the food is out of this world. Definitely recommend this place for its food variety, atmosphere and especially the bar. Great job and welcome to Tribeca.
One of the best spots in Tribeca. LOVE the drinks, LOVE the food, and LOVE the bartenders and service. Would reccomend
Great ambiance. The duck confit was really nice. Awesome cocktails, loved the Choco Old Fashioned.

This place was so delicious. I highly recommend this place. Came in on a Wednesday and this place was packed! So many people here although the wait was not long at all. Great food an a large menu so everyone got their own dish. Although it was packed the service was amazing. I strongly recommend coming to this place if you are nearby.
No comment
No comment
Beautiful menu with abundant portions. Attentive service. Not huge on the lemonade, but will definitely be back to try other drinks. The presentation was not lacking, nor was the flavor.

I love this place. I realize how silly it is to crave a vegan Mexican restaurant in Hudson yards when visiting New York, but it is what it is. Their nachos are made of dreams. Tried the new cinnamon hot tea and it was delicious. My mom loved the beet and pumpkin empanada, and their tacos are decent. Just get the nachos and you won't regret it.
No comment
No comment
No comment

WOW! 10/10 recommend. The food was all outstanding, service was quick and delightful, and the ambiance was outstanding. Highly recommend ordering as much as you can and splitting with the table - I loved EVERYTHING! Empanada was the biggest hit but it was a tough choice because everything was outstanding.
No comment

Tried this place because we needed a quick meal. It was inside of a Whole Foods, and the interior was modern and clean. I got a burrito, which was honestly pretty average. The meat was standard, if not borderline bland, but the other ingredients in the burrito were solid, such as the rice and vegetables. The dipping sauce with some flavorless sour cream (I usually like sour cream). Pretty good place if you need something quick on the go, but I don't know if this average of a burrito was worth $15.

I've always heard great things about Jajaja, so I tried it one evening with a friend. This location is hidden inside a Whole Foods so it took longer than I'm proud to admit to find it. The food was pretty and colorful and had a decent amount of flavor, but it very much felt vegan. I feel like it's a good option if you need to eat vegan, but it's not great for Mexican food. I feel like this location also just felt a bit "food courty' to me, so maybe I need to try another location
